Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern : This letter is a formal complaint that you have ignored my previous request and failed to maintain reasonable procedures in your operations to assure maximum possible accuracy in the credit reports you publish.

Under federal law ( 15 U.S. Code 1681i ), you had thirty ( 30 ) days to complete your investigation from the date you received my dispute.

Credit reporting laws ensure that bureaus report only 100 % accurate credit information and every step must be taken to assure the information reported is completely accurate and correct.

Here is a list of items that were sent in my initial dispute letter that now must be deleted from your database. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Account Status : Open The information must be deleted from my report as soon as possible. Not only did you not respond in a timely matter about how the information was mine and verified to be mine, but the information was inaccurate and misleading and as such represents a very serious error in your reporting. 
Once again! Under federal law, you had thirty ( 30 ) days to complete your investigation from the date you received my dispute. Also, this account is reporting as open when it should be reported as closed Sincerely XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Please send your written response to my address of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, GA XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
Around XXXX, XX/XX/year>, I was in the branch of XXXX XXXX FL to take advantage of the new account bonus {$600.00}. ( Please see attached image for the account promo details which also can be found on the bank website ). As the new account bundle bonus include the new checking and savings, I decided to go with opening only checking account ( {$400.00} bonus ) with help by the branch client advisor, XXXX XXXX. Before starting the application, I emailed XXXX the website link with the promo details ( Please find attached image of email conversation ). At the end of application, I refused to apply the debt card as the promo term does not need any debt card purchase. 

I completed the requirements before XXXX XXXX, marked the XXXX day of account open. There was {$300.00} bonus deposited to the checking account on XXXX XXXX. On the same day I contacted XXXX about the {$100.00} bonus shortage. After a week investigation, I was informed the reason I did not receive the full checking bonus {$400.00} is because I did not complete XXXX debt card transactions. I double checked the website promo terms as well as the promo email sent to XXXX on the day of account open, I did not find any wording about debt card purchase. The back office replied with the promo terms which is totally different from the promo I applied for during the branch visit. All the email conversation record has been attached for your further review.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

Account name : # XXXX, Account name : # XXXX, Account name : # XXXX, Account name : # XXXX, has violated my rights. 

I looked at my Experian credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear ( Debt Collector ) ecently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you ha intacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming th Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor.

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor 4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Discrimination Based on Immigration Status in KeyBanks Checking Account Promotion I am writing to file a complaint regarding KeyBanks discriminatory practices related to their {$300.00} checking account bonus promotion. I believe this policy unjustly excludes XXXX XXXX holders ( XXXX XXXX ) and violates protections against discrimination based on immigration status or national origin. 

Details of the Incident : On XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to open a checking account online to qualify for KeyBanks {$300.00} bonus promotion. During the process, I was informed that online applications were restricted to U.S. citizens only and that, as a XXXX XXXX holder, I would need to apply in person at a branch. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I visited the KeyBank branch located at : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, WA XXXX. 

A banker began opening the account for me. However, during the process, the banker needed to call for confirmation regarding the bonus eligibility. After the call, the banker informed me that the bonus could not be applied in person and confirmed that the promotion was effectively limited to U.S. citizens because online applications for XXXX XXXX holders were not allowed. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I called XXXX customer service for further clarification. The representative again confirmed that the {$300.00} bonus was available only to U.S. citizens since XXXX XXXX holders could not apply online, and the bonus could not be applied in-branch. 

Basis for Complaint : This practice by KeyBank appears to discriminate against XXXX XXXX holders, violating protections under federal laws such as : 1. Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) Prohibits discrimination based on national origin or citizenship status in financial services.

2. Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of XXXX Prohibits discrimination based on national origin by institutions receiving federal financial assistance. 
3. UDAAP Regulations ( Unfair, Deceptive, or Abusive Acts or Practices ) Enforced by the CFPB to ensure fair treatment of consumers. 

As a lawful permanent resident, I meet all the standard eligibility requirements for the checking account and promotion. Excluding me solely based on immigration status is unfair and discriminatory. 


Washington state also has strong protections against discrimination that apply in this situation, in addition to federal laws. 

XXXX. Washington Law Against Discrimination ( WLAD ) RCW 49.60 Scope : WLAD prohibits discrimination in public accommodations, including financial services and banking, based on race, creed, color, national origin, citizenship or immigration status, among other protected classes.

Application : Banks are considered places of public accommodation, and denying a promotion to XXXX XXXX holders while offering it to U.S. citizens could violate WLAD. 
Enforcement : The Washington State Human Rights Commission ( WSHRC ) enforces this law.

2. Consumer Protection Act ( CPA ) RCW 19.86 Scope : Protects against unfair or deceptive acts or practices in trade and commerce, including banking services.

Application : Excluding XXXX XXXX holders from an advertised promotion could be seen as an unfair practice under this law. 

XXXX. XXXX Municipal Code ( SMC ) Chapter 14.06 Scope : The City of XXXX prohibits discrimination in public accommodations based on national origin, citizenship, or immigration status. 
Enforcement : The XXXX Office for Civil Rights ( XXXX ) handles related discrimination within the city. 


Requested Action : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and ensure that XXXX promotional offers are applied fairly and without discrimination based on immigration status or national origin. Furthermore, I ask that KeyBank be required to extend the {$300.00} bonus offer to eligible XXXX XXXX holders who meet all other conditions. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I appreciate your assistance in ensuring fair treatment for all consumers, regardless of their immigration status.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am filing this complaint regarding serious inaccuracies in the reporting of my account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) ** by Experian and XXXX XXXX Specifically, this account falsely reflects late payments in XXXX and XXXX of last year, along with inconsistencies in the reporting details across both credit bureaus. I have taken screenshots documenting these discrepancies as evidence. 

The reporting practices of XXXX XXXX and the credit bureaus violate several provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related U.S. laws. I demand immediate action to address and rectify these violations. 

Violations of Federal Law 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports Credit reporting agencies are required to maintain and report accurate consumer information. The blatant inconsistencies and inaccuracies in this case demonstrate a failure to uphold this obligation, resulting in harm to my creditworthiness.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) Dispute Resolution Obligations Upon disputing inaccuracies, credit bureaus must conduct a timely and reasonable investigation. Past attempts to resolve this matter have been ignored or mishandled, failing to meet legal standards for a proper investigation. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Furnisher Responsibility to Report Accurate Information XXXX XXXX XXXX as a furnisher of information, is prohibited from reporting information it knows or should reasonably know to be inaccurate. False late payments violate this provision. 

15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) Obsolete Information The inclusion of unverifiable or false late payments contravenes the mandate to exclude inaccurate or outdated information. 

15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) Permissible Purposes for Reporting Consumer Information Reporting entities must comply with permissible purposes and ensure consumer data is not misrepresented or mishandled. XXXX XXXX false and conflicting data breaches this obligation. 

Impact of Violations The inaccurate late payments have adversely affected my credit score, jeopardizing my ability to obtain credit on fair terms. This financial and emotional harm is a direct result of negligent and unlawful reporting practices. The FCRA provides consumers with protection against such actions, yet XXXX XXXX, Experian, and XXXX have collectively failed to comply. 

My Requests Immediate Removal of Late Payments : Remove the false late payments reported for XXXX and XXXX of last year from my credit reports. 
Corrections Across All Bureaus : Ensure that my account is accurately reflected across all reporting agencies.

Full Investigation : Conduct a thorough investigation into XXXX XXXX reporting practices and ensure compliance with FCRA standards. 
Written Confirmation : Provide written confirmation of receipt of this dispute and resolution updates. 
Evidence Provided I have attached screenshots of the inconsistent and inaccurate reporting for your review. 

I urge the CFPB to address this matter promptly. The continued disregard for federal law by XXXX XXXX and the credit bureaus demands immediate accountability. I trust that the CFPB will ensure my rights under the FCRA and related statutes are protected. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, FL XXXX XX/XX/XXXX To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Experian Information Solutions , Inc . 
XXXX XXXX Subject : Urgent Demand for Removal of Unauthorized Accounts and Violations of Federal Law XXXX  has demonstrated a clear failure to maintain consistency and transparency in its handling of your dispute, further compounding the harm caused by its already unlawful practices. On one hand, XXXX sent written correspondence stating that your disputes were deemed frivolous because they were previously verified or lacked new relevant information. Yet, when you called XXXX representatives, they contradicted this claim by asserting that the FTC report you submitted, along with other supporting documents, was invalid or not reflected in their system. This blatant inconsistency in communication highlights systemic negligence, internal disorganization, and possibly intentional efforts to delay or obstruct dispute resolution. 

Key Issues with XXXX Contradictions 1. Misleading Written Statements : The letter implied that your disputes were frivolous, suggesting there was no new information to warrant further investigation. However, the supporting documentation you submitted, including proof of identification, proof of address, and the FTC Identity Theft Report, satisfies the requirements under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 for blocking disputed items. 
2. Disregard of Submitted Documents : XXXX  claim during your phone call that the FTC report was invalid reflects either a failure to properly process submitted documents or intentional misrepresentation of its obligations under federal law. 
3. Obstruction of Consumer Rights : The conflicting statements prevent you from effectively resolving the dispute and exercising your rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). By sending contradictory information, XXXX undermines its obligation to provide a clear and efficient dispute resolution process. 
4. Possible Profit-Driven Motives : The delays caused by these contradictory statements may be a tactic to continue profiting from unauthorized or inaccurate information on your credit report, as credit reporting agencies often benefit financially from retaining more data on consumers. 
5. Violation of FCRA Procedures : According to 15 U.S.C. 1681i, XXXX must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information and can not arbitrarily declare disputes frivolous, especially when documentation is provided. 

Legal and Regulatory Implications 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : XXXX must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information on your credit report. Failing to process valid disputes and providing contradictory information violates this mandate. 
15 U.S.C. 1681n : Willful noncompliance with the FCRA exposes XXXX to statutory, actual, and punitive damages. 
Section 5 ( a ) of the FTC Act : Misleading consumers through contradictory communication may constitute unfair and deceptive practices, subject to enforcement by the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ). 
Consumer Financial Protection Act ( 12 U.S.C. 5536 ) : XXXX actions may violate the prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices ( UDAAP ). 

Demand for Accountability XXXX  inability to provide consistent and accurate information underscores a broader systemic failure within its dispute resolution processes. I will not tolerate the continued violation of my rights. Your contradictory communications must be resolved, and the following actions must be taken immediately : 1. Remove all unauthorized accounts and information in compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2.

2. Provide a written explanation reconciling the discrepancies between your written and verbal statements.

3. Implement internal compliance measures to prevent similar occurrences in the future. 





To Whom It May Concern, This formal complaint demands the immediate removal of unauthorized accounts and inaccurate information from my consumer report. Despite my compliance with all legal requirements under FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( Section 605C2 ), these accounts remain unlawfully reported. Furthermore, I have IRS-confirmed evidence of Form 1099-C cancellation for the debts associated with these accounts, proving they are no longer valid or collectible. 
The fact that these canceled accounts remain on my report, despite their resolution with the IRS, demonstrates not only your noncompliance with federal law but also a potential fraudulent financial intent. If these items are not promptly removed, I reserve the right to report your continued actions to the IRS under their whistleblower program, as the profit gained from unauthorized reporting constitutes tax fraud and abuse. 
Accounts to Be Removed Immediately : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Violations of Federal Law and Additional Actions : 1. FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 : All disputed information must be blocked within four ( 4 ) business days upon submission of proper documentation. Despite fulfilling all requirements, including FTC Identity Theft Report, identification, and proof of address, these accounts remain unblocked.

2. IRS Reporting Requirements : The debts associated with the accounts above have been canceled via Form 1099-C and accepted by the IRS. Continuing to report these accounts as valid debts constitutes a misrepresentation of their status. Additionally, this behavior indicates potential violations of tax laws if these debts are used for financial gain or inaccurate reporting purposes.

3. Fraudulent Intent and Misrepresentation : By retaining and profiting from inaccurate and unauthorized information, your actions may violate 18 U.S.C. 1962 ( RICO ) and 18 U.S.C. 894 ( Extortionate Credit Practices ).

4. Whistleblower and Audit Risk : If this noncompliance persists, I will report your activities to the IRS for further investigation and audit. The whistleblower program rewards accurate reporting of tax fraud and abuse, which includes the exploitation of consumer data for monetary gain.

5. Breach of Consumer Rights : Your failure to remove canceled debts constitutes ongoing harm to my financial reputation, with severe consequences for your compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681b and Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act protections. 
Immediate Demands : 1. Immediate Removal of All Accounts Listed : All canceled debts and unauthorized accounts must be removed from my credit report within seven ( 7 ) business days of receiving this notice. 
2. Written Confirmation of Compliance : Provide written confirmation that these accounts have been permanently removed and will not be re-reported. 
3. IRS Whistleblower Avoidance : Take corrective action immediately to avoid being reported for fraudulent financial practices and unauthorized profit from canceled debts. 
Conclusion : XXXX, Experian, and XXXX continued failure to comply with federal law is a direct attack on my financial stability and consumer rights. I have met all requirements under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, and the additional inclusion of 1099-C evidence further cements that these accounts have no basis for continued reporting. 
This is your final opportunity to resolve this matter. Failure to comply will result in further escalations, including filing whistleblower complaints with the IRS and pursuing legal remedies for damages under the FCRA, CFPB regulations, and RICO statutes.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Since my husband passed away, I have had a difficult time finding work. I thought I had a job lined up recently but it fell through. Therefore, I temporarily didn't have sufficient money to make my Sezzle payments. On XX/XX/year>, I contacted Sezzle using the Conversation option, which represents itself as a web chat. I asked to revoke authorization to debit my bank account. 

No chat agent ever responded and over {$200.00} was debited. I had to borrow money from my children to avoid becoming overdrawn. I attempted again today to turn off autopay so I can manually make upcoming payments. 

I was told Sezzle could not do that, only I could do reschedules ( not what I asked ) through the app. This is a violation of the law. 

I am going to repay me debts but I can't afford to pay it now. I have a new job starting soon which will help me catch up. I want autopay turned off and {$100.00} of the monies that were debited between XX/XX/year> and today so I have money to live off of.

Consumer complaint narrative: I moved out of XXXX on XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/year>XXXX  because the lease was up and the property manager didnt give me a lease renewal until 3 days before the lease was up. By that time I thought they were not renewing the lease and found another place to live. I moved everything out of the apartment there was nothing left. I hired a professional cleaning company XXXX XXXX XXXX to do a move out clean in the apartment. It was spotless. The property manager knew they had to replace the carpet because there was a flood in the apartment from the maintenance man who came to fix the washer machine and didnt plug it back in correctly. That was not my fault and there should not be charged. I also used a surety bond to secure deposit and pay for any damages if any when I signed the lease. When I spoke to the property manager XXXX XXXX she said I left the apartment trashed, which is a lie. She said they would send pictures which they didnt. The property XXXX XXXX waited almost 2 yrs to put this debt {$6700.00} on my credit report. They never tried to contact me, when I turned my keys into the leasing office they said I was good to go. The collection agency Sentry Credit Inc. is reporting false charges on my report. I will take legal action and sue them and XXXX on XXXX XXXX XXXX  for this false debt. I have photos and video as evidence.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Bank of America concerning a credit card dispute. Despite my efforts to resolve this issue directly with both the merchant and Bank of America, the matter remains unresolved. The details of my complaint are as follows : Disputed Amount : {$8800.00} Merchant : XXXX XXXX XXXX Date of Dispute Initiation : XX/XX/year> I have been a loyal Bank of America customer for 17 years and have consistently maintained an excellent payment history. However, when I encountered an issue with an unresponsive merchant, Bank of America failed to protect my interests and uphold its commitment to its customers. 

Details of the Dispute : I was charged {$8800.00} by the merchant for services/products that were not provided as agreed. Despite multiple attempts to contact the merchant, I have received no response or resolution. I subsequently raised this issue with Bank of America, expecting their support in this dispute. Unfortunately, Bank of America 's response has been inadequate, and the matter remains unresolved. 

I am seeking the CFPB 's assistance in ensuring that Bank of America fulfills its obligation to protect its customers and resolves this dispute promptly. Attached to this letter are copies of relevant documents, including my credit card statements, correspondence with the merchant and Bank of America, and any other supporting materials. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in resolving this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am curently on a forebearance and I have been alerted to some fraudulent activity surrounding the purchase of my home. While reviewing my loan disclosure and the TILA I noticed that mortgage loan was miscalculated and the amount financed should have been {$280000.00} but I was financed at {$280000.00}. I also noticed various other TILA violations that I brought to their attention such as escrow payments and appraisal value being inflated and the appraisal is invalid because I was told I would get an in person appraisal but it was performed virtually. I was not given 3 days to review my closing disclosure so I was unable to catch the errors. I recieved my closing documents on XXXX and I closed on XXXX. I even questioned walking away from the loan on closing day because they miscalculated closing cost and asked me to go get some additional funds, and when I called my mortgage broker I was misinformed and I was never told that I had the right to rescind. The seller paid the additional funds on my behalf and that amount is also not documented. I still closed on the XXXX and I was not give the 3 days prior to closing and I was not given an additional 3 days after changes had to be made to the funding or cost to close. 

I sent an letter to the escalalations department on XX/XX/year> and I have not heard from them. I have a forbearance that ended on the XXXX and I tried to wait to hear from the escalation department about the corrections but after I did not hear from them I turned in my modification application. As of today I still have not heard from either department. 

This does not outline all the errors but I have attached the letter that was sent to the escalations department along with a copy of the closing disclosure.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX EXPERIAN XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX RE : Dispute Authorization and Multiple Violations of Fair Credit Reporting Act I, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX , hereby authorize this dispute. It is important to note that this dispute was not sent by an unauthorized third party or " credit clinic. '' I am writing to address several violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) that have occurred, which require your immediate attention and resolution. The violations are as follows : FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You are reporting fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, thus infringing upon my privacy rights. I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. I insist that my hard inquiries and account information not be shared on my credit report. 
FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : The information you are reporting falsely suggests that I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts, when in reality, these were the result of a scammer 's actions. Such false reporting misleads future creditors. By reporting these unverified items, you violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and fail to comply with its fairness requirements.

FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : You accepted credit information about me without verifying its accuracy firsthand. This willful noncompliance is punishable by civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation.

FCRA Section 605B - Aggravated Identity Theft : You shared my personal information with numerous creditors without obtaining my consent, making you criminally liable for aggravated identity theft, which carries a penalty of up to 2 years of imprisonment.

FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You failed to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission was deceptive and a violation of my consumer rights.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : You furnished inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, potentially violating Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). Reporting such inaccurate information is deceptive.

Violation of Debt Collection Practices Act : You engaged in unfair practices and harassment by reporting inaccurate debts and accounts without my consent, causing me distress and unnecessary contact from creditors.

Violation of Identity Theft Laws : Creditors obtained my information without my true consent and used it to obtain credit from other financial institutions, constituting identity theft. 
Violation of Acquiring Location Information Regulations : Debt collectors contacted third-party credit reporting agencies with my information, stating that I owed a " debt. '' This is a clear violation of regulations that prohibit disclosing debt information to third parties.

Violation of Timely Payments Regulations : You reported " late payments '' on my credit report without defining what constitutes a late payment, which is deceptive and inaccurate.

Violation of Finance Charge Determination : You failed to accurately determine finance charges, which is your responsibility as a credit reporting agency.

Violation of Credit Report Permissible Purposes : You reported information on my credit report without obtaining my written consent, which is a violation of the permissible purposes outlined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

I, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, demand that you take immediate action to address these violations. I request the following actions : 1. Under 15 USC 1666b this late payment entry is a violation. I have been incorrectly billed. 

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Please update the status of this account to " paid on time. '' Remove all fraudulent and inaccurate accounts from my credit report.

Block any information resulting from identity theft, as required by FCRA.I expect a prompt response and resolution to this matter. Failure to comply will leave me with no choice but to pursue legal remedies available under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: XX/XX/XXXX, I refinanced my mortgage with XXXX XXXX XXXX under the XXXX. I was told that since I had already made the XXXX payment that it would go on the loan, and the first payment would not be due till XX/XX/XXXX, I later received a notice from XXXX XXXX  that as of XX/XX/XXXX they would be my new servicer. I made the XX/XX/XXXX payment on XX/XX/XXXX ; which was reversed by XXXX due to they didn't have the packet yet from XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX sent the payment back through. I made XX/XX/XXXX, payment, then on XX/XX/XXXX I called in to schedule XXXX with XXXX, conf # XXXX which XXXX said they never recieved, because I was told the payment was deferred and was charged {$2000.00}. I received documentation concerning the homestead exemption ; my taxes went down to {$60.00} a year. I spoke with XXXX and was given the email address to send, which was received by email on XX/XX/XXXX per email from XXXX. I called XXXX to see when the analysis would be made, and I was told on XX/XX/XXXX, I asked about the refund of the escrow because of the taxes being lowered and was told no, there's no refund. I was told account was going into foreclosure, and that I could do a modification to save my home. Which was done on XX/XX/XXXX, before then I made a payment on XX/XX/XXXX for {$1900.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX I spoke to XXXX about another VA Refinance and was told that I qualified and was given an account number, I called her several times for the status, no returned phone call. When I called again I was told that I was in a forebearance and that I couldn't refinance. The forebearance was for XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX with no payment. I then found out that the loan was transferred on XX/XX/XXXX to Carrington Mortgage. I called Carrington to see what was going on and was told I had to wait for 60 days for them to receive the packet and run an analysis, and it would be done on XX/XX/XXXX and to make sure I made my payment and I did. No analyis was ran. When I spoke with XXXX I was told it would be done on XXXX, then XXXX said that it would be XXXX or XXXX, and that the forebearance was reenstated till XX/XX/XXXX, I also asked why my payment went up I was told due to the shortage in the Escrow. I tried to call the Customer Care and was told that I was in collections byXXXX, and that I can't talk to Customer Care because the calls would only come back to collections. I have spoken with the following to make sense of what was going on : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX just to name a few. I have been given numbers to call : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, faxes XXXX, XXXX. I have called and always given the runaround like I didn't matter and I feel that XXXX and Carrington are one-in the same. I'm still reeling from XXXX XXXX and they are holding the checks from the insurance company, I need to pay contractors. I was told it takes 48 hours to upload, another 10 business days to review, and call me with the specifics. I overnighted the checks back because I had forgotten to sign. I sent them a month ago overnight, and they sent them back weeks later and I returned on XX/XX/XXXX. I feel I am being discriminated against because I am elderly XXXX, XXXX, and black. I have been under a lot of stress because of the lack of trying to help me solve this issue, pretending not to have the document from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 's office which they paid on XX/XX/XXXX the {$60.00} taxes. Your consideration and kindness in the complaint would be greatly appreciated. See attachments too many to upload.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Louisiana XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian XXXX Department XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently received a copy of my credit report from Experian, XXXX, and XXXX and I noticed some late payments posted on my report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Account number # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number # XXXX Your company ( s ) ( creditors and credit bureaus ) is in clear violation of the law. Under 15 USC 1681b-permisable purpose of consumer reports, The LAW CLEARLY STATES ( a ) In General Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

I did not give my written instructions to furnish these accounts on my credit report.

Furthermore, the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ). Exclusion from a consumer credit report clearly states : ( 2 ) Exclusions- Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ) consumer report does not include ( A ) Subject to 1681s-3 of this title any- Report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report : Delete the above late payments from my consumer report, the creditors and the credit bureaus are in violation of 15 USC 1681 Failure to respond satisfactorily with deletion of the above referred accounts and send out a free copy of my credit report after the changes have been made will result in Legal action being taken against your company, for which I will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation 1. Defamation of Character ( per se ) 2. Negligent Enablement of identity fraud 3. Fair Debt Collections Practices Act 15 USC 1692g violation 4. Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 violation for willful noncompliance-616 Civil Liability for willful non compliance ( 15 USC 1681n ) By the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I demand that these items be reinvestigated and removed from my report. Please remove any information that the creditor can not verify. I understand that under 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1681, you must complete this reinvestigation within 14 days of this receipt. I have included documents and my personal identification to prove my Identity and support my claim. 
Thank you for your time and help in this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

15 U.S.C 1681 604 A Section 2 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) 15 U.S.C 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) - A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency. 

I explained to Experian that there should be no other addresses reporting to my Experian credit report other than the XXXX XXXX XXXX. Any other addresses are incorrect. Experian is in violation of my consumer rights. 

Experian just sent me an Experian credit report to the XXXX XXXX XXXX, so this is my correct address. 

I have attached 2 documents : my credit report that Experian just sent to me with my XXXX XXXX XXXX address and the other addresses listed that are not suppose to be on my Experian credit report.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Subject : Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX Compliance Department Regarding Improper Use of My Credit File To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX for violations of federal statutes related to the improper use of my credit file, reporting of information without consent, and failure to comply with legal obligations regarding debt reporting and income recognition. 

1. Unauthorized Use and Reporting of Credit Information : XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to comply with 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which specifies permissible purposes for obtaining and using consumer credit reports. I never provided written consent for XXXX XXXX XXXX to report any information to my credit file. According to 16 CFR 313.7, financial institutions must obtain explicit authorization from consumers before sharing nonpublic personal information unless an exception applies, none of which are applicable here.

Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of their information-sharing policies and practices, which XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to do. Their actions also appear to violate 15 U.S.C. 6805, which empowers regulatory bodies to enforce these provisions.

2. Charge-Off Reporting and Misclassification : A charge-off is a bookkeeping designation used by creditors for tax purposes when they consider a debt uncollectible. Under federal tax law, a charge-off can be treated as a cancellation of debt, which may constitute income to the debtor. However, XXXX XXXX XXXX did not issue a XXXX ( Cancellation of Debt ) form to me, as required under IRS regulations XXXX to substantiate that the debt was canceled and classified as income. Without this form, their reporting of the charge-off to credit reporting agencies is not only improper but also misleading. 

Moreover, a charge-off does not represent a valid certificate of indebtedness. A certificate of indebtedness reflects a binding obligation that is enforceable ; a charge-off, by its nature, implies that the debt has been resolved or abandoned by the creditor. Reporting a charge-off to credit bureaus under these circumstances constitutes inaccurate reporting. 

XXXX. Lack of Transparency and Consumer Rights Violations : XXXX XXXX XXXX has disregarded my consumer rights by failing to provide adequate notice or obtain my written consent before furnishing information to credit reporting agencies. This omission violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). Their noncompliance with transparency requirements and failure to respect the confidentiality of my personal financial information is concerning. 

I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate XXXX XXXX XXXX practices to determine whether they are in violation of federal laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. 68026805 ( GLBAs financial privacy rules ) ; 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( FCRAs permissible purposes for credit reporting ) ; 16 CFR 313.7 ( GLBA privacy and opt-out regulations ). 

Additionally, I request clarification and appropriate remediation regarding : 1.The absence of a XXXX form to substantiate the charge-off as canceled debt. 
2.The improper classification of a charge-off as a certificate of indebtedness.

3.The unauthorized reporting of information to credit bureaus without my explicit written consent. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in ensuring compliance and protecting my rights as a consumer. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Louisiana XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly.

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately.

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA.

Please mail your response to my address listed above.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit act. The list of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

XXXX XXXX Account # XXXX XXXX  XXXX Account # XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Account # XXXX has violated my rights. 

I looked at my Experian credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. According to the fair credit reporting act whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates to according to the 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

According to 15 USC 1681i5 they are supposed to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information.

( A ) In general, in after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of information from is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer or modify that item of information, as appropriate based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

According to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are not supposed to furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Under 15 USC 6802, a financial institution is prohibited from disclosing nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the following conditions are met : The institution provides a clear and conspicuous disclosure to the consumer, in writing, electronically, or through another permitted form, stating that such information may be shared with third parties. 
The consumer is given the opportunity, prior to the initial disclosure, to opt-out of having their information shared. 
The institution provides an explanation of how the consumer can exercise this opt-out right. 
In this case, the financial institution failed to inform me of my rights or provide the required disclosures to protect my privacy. Furthermore, I have become aware that my personal information was compromised in a data breach, representing another significant violation of my privacy rights.

Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased a cell phone contract with XXXX XXXX XXXX and a new device. When I brought it home, after being told that XXXX XXXX XXXX provided service to my area, the device never was able to connect to the network and was unusable. I took it to the store, XXXX XXXX, and they assured me nothing was wrong with the device. I contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX  and they admitted that they did not cover my area and that I could pay additional money to purchase a repeater, that would be shared by other users on the XXXX XXXX XXXX network ... What? I was also not able to use the Wi-Fi calling feature that came with the device because XXXX XXXX XXXX had disabled the feature on my particular device. Due to XXXX XXXX XXXX coverage maps being false, the XXXX XXXX XXXX representative misrepresenting the service, and the carrier disabling features on my device that would have allowed it to function properly, I returned the device to the store within 30-days to exercise the money-back guarantee that was offered. After paying a restocking fee at the store and cancelling my service ( which I was not able to use ) I still received a bill in the mail for service I was never provided. I was told afterwards that " Oops it looks like the guarantee you were attempting to use was for online orders only. '' Though this was not explicitly stated in the Terms of Service at the time of my purchase.

Consumer complaint narrative: I was a XXXX wireless customer. I had 4 voice lines and a connected tablet. I ported my services to XXXX and paid off all of my remaining phone balances with XXXX. Confirming with an agent that my services were disconnected, and they were paid in full. I was assured it was. Fast forward approximately 3 months later and I notice via a secondary email that XXXX is still billing. When I called in and spoke with an agent they said " I notice the problem '' when you ported out your voice lines, you did not port your tablet data line, it became a new data only account and has been billing you. I explained that the tablet is no longer used, I want services cancelled. The agent apologized and transferred me to someone who could disconnect my account, that 2nd agent assured me I would be receive a credit, nothing was owed, and the account would be closed. Fast forward about 60 days and I receive yet another notice, this time from XXXX collections stating I owe money still. After 3 calls and the collections department refusal to let me speak with anyone else, I finally just paid the balance. 30 days later a paid collections shows up on my credit report. This should not have been a collection, XXXX created a data only account without notification, XXXX made commitments and gave false information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Louisiana XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Experian Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute Regarding Reinsertion of Information and Violations of FCRA and GLBA Dear Experian Dispute Department, I, XXXX XXXX XXXX, am writing to formally dispute the reinsertion of information concerning the account labeled " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, '' which was previously removed from my consumer report on " XX/XX/year>. '' This reinsertion violates my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and raises concerns regarding compliance with federal law.

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 1. Failure to Provide a Certificate of Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) ) Experian has
reinserted the account information for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX without providing the required certification of accuracy. According to FCRA guidelines, a certification must be provided to validate the accuracy of information before it can be reinserted into a consumer report. I demand that Experian immediately provide this certificate or remove the account from my report.

2. Identification of the Account as Other Account and Lack of Furnisher Agreement ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ) ) The account is labeled as other account on my report, which misrepresents the nature of the debt. Furthermore, the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is not a recognized furnisher with an agreement to report such information to credit bureaus. Courts do not report such accounts to consumer reporting agencies. This inaccurate reporting violates your duty to maintain the maximum possible accuracy of consumer reports.

Violations of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) 1. Improper Sharing of Personal Information ( 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( c ) and 6802 ( d ) ) Experian and the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX appear to have violated the GLBA by sharing my personal information with third-party institutions without proper authorization. I demand that you provide evidence of my consent to such sharing, as required by law, or immediately cease and rectify this unlawful practice.

Demands To resolve this matter, I demand the following actions : 1. Immediate deletion of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account from my credit report.

2. A full investigation and validation of the information, including the certificate of accuracy, pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ).

3. Evidence of any furnisher agreements allowing XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to report such information.

4. Confirmation that my personal information is not being shared with unauthorized third parties, in compliance with the GLBA.

5. Deletion of personal addresses I have never resided at : " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX MI XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX MI XXXX '' If Experian fails to address these violations promptly, I am prepared to escalate this matter by filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state attorney generals office.

Please acknowledge receipt of this letter within 30 days and confirm the specific actions taken to resolve this dispute. You may contact me in writing at the address provided above.

Experian is in clear violations of the above mentioned. I have uploaded proof of my dispute. I sent my dispute over 30 days ago. United States Postal Service tracking number is : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Thank you Consumer financial protection bureau in your assistance to resolve this dispute.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year>, I was looking at new phones on XXXX XXXX  and when I'm at the check out section there was an option to pay in full or finance. 

I clicked on finance to see more information and was led to third party bank website by www.synchrony.com, on this website it asked me to enter the last 4 numbers of my social security and phone number, WHICH I DID NOT ENTERED AND LEFT! 

a few minutes later I got emails saying that there was a credit hard inquiry on my experian from " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX this is an unauthorized credit check! no where did I allowed this, no I did not give out my social security number! 
I have tried to call the number above but it tells me to get support from their online website and I tried but it went no where, it's not easy to reach the right person! 

I request XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to fix this by contacting all the credit agencies that they pulled my information from and request that the bureau remove it from my report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 168b permissible purposes of consumer reports. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

These inquiry was not authorized Account Name : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX has violated my rights. On a list of inquiries : 15 U.S.C. 1681b - Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports : This section outlines that consumer reports can only be furnished under specific conditions. My rights to privacy and confidentiality have been violated as my report was accessed or shared without permissible purpose. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) - Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information : This statute prohibits the furnishing of any information to a consumer reporting agency that is known to be inaccurate or has not been verified. [ Name of Furnisher/Creditor ] has furnished information that is either inaccurate or unverifiable.

15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Right to Privacy : The statute emphasizes the need for consumer reporting agencies to handle consumer information with fairness, impartiality, and respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. This has not been upheld in my case.

15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Requirement for Written Consent : This section specifies that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a consumer report without the consumer 's written instruction. I did not provide written consent for the inquiry or account listed.

15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) - Prohibition of Obsolete Information : This section prohibits the reporting of adverse information older than seven years ( except for records of convictions ). The report in question contains outdated or irrelevant information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute a fraudulent account on my credit reports resulting from identity theft. This account was opened without my authorization or consent, and its reporting violates multiple provisions of U.S. law, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The account in question is : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( Experian, XXXX ) Under 15 U.S.C . 1681c-2, I have the right to block and demand removal of information resulting from identity theft. Furthermore, reporting this account without my explicit consent violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for accessing and reporting consumer information. I assert that this account was created and reported unlawfully, and I never provided consent for such reporting.

I have attached an identity theft affidavit and additional supporting documentation. Please ensure this account is removed from my credit reports immediately.

I request written confirmation of receipt of this dispute and updates regarding the resolution process. I also remind you of your obligation to address this violation promptly under 15 U.S.C. 1681i.

Thank you for your urgent attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Experian for its willful noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and to demand immediate action pursuant to my rights under federal law. 

Background The following account appear on my credit report as negative items XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX This record have been deleted from the record of the original data furnisher, XXXX XXXX This was confirmed by a direct inquiry with XXXX, which no longer maintains these records. 

Legal Basis for Dispute 1. Inaccuracy of Reported Information Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information they report. Because the source of this information, XXXX, no longer maintains these records, Experian is reporting inaccurate and incomplete information by continuing to include these items on my credit report. 

2. Obligation to Remove Information FCRA 605 ( b ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) requires the removal of inaccurate items from the credit report within 4 days of a dispute being submitted. Given that these records are demonstrably inaccurate, Experian 's failure to promptly remove them violates this statutory obligation.

3. Willful Noncompliance Under 15 U.S.C. 1681n, Experian is liable for willful noncompliance with the FCRA. This includes failing to conduct a reasonable investigation into the accuracy of the disputed items and failing to act in accordance with the law to ensure only verified and accurate information remains on my credit report. 

Demand for Resolution I demand that the following actions be taken immediately : The removal of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) from my Experian credit report within the time frame required by FCRA 605 ( b ).

Confirmation from Experian that these items have been removed, along with a revised copy of my credit report reflecting these changes.

Request for CFPB Action I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter thoroughly to ensure Experian complies with its legal obligations under the FCRA. This is a clear case of willful noncompliance, and I expect immediate corrective action. 

Enclosed are copies of supporting documents, including correspondence with XXXX confirming the deletion of these records and my dispute history with Experian. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

I purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. The first payment was due on XX/XX/XXXX, which I paid. The issue I have is that the company has not deducted my payments from the balance and it looks as if I have not made any payment on this car. I have been given extensions, and have been charged late payments even if I pay earlier in the month. 

I have been told that 11 payments were extended. I have asked for the extension paperwork which I have not received. Extensions were explained to me that they go on the back of the loan which extends the length of time that I pay for the car. 

My issue is that the balance owed is incorrect, which makes it look as if I am not paying for the car. When I looked at my XXXX credit report it states incorrectly that I have only made one payment, since XXXX, which is not correct and the car would have been repossessed. I need this corrected on my credit reports to reflect that I have been making payments which should decrease the balance. 

I am being contacted constantly by the company, but have not been able to speak to anyone higher than customer service to get this corrected. When I ask about the balance on the loan and why the payments are not being reported correctly as it should be going down, I am told about the daily interest, 11 extensions, late payments etc. That does not answer the questions I am asking. 

I need the balance reported correctly as I have been paying on this loan since XXXX and it should not reflect the same amount as the beginning balance.

As required by section 611 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. 1681i, a copy of which is enclosed, I am requesting that the item ( s ) be removed. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I did not authorized these merchants to do a hard inquiry on my credit report, an unknown person violated my identity, I did not open those credit cards in my name, and I did not open any car loan in my name and those collections accounts do not belong to me. I did not open an account XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To : Experian, XXXX and XXXX I am writing to formally address the ongoing inaccuracies and reporting violations on my credit reports. Despite my previous attempts to resolve these issues, the inaccurate information remains, and the credit bureaus have failed to respond appropriately. The continued inaction and false reporting of my personal information are direct violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other applicable federal and state laws. 

Accounts to be Corrected : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) The inaccurate information reported by XXXX on my credit report, including incorrect account status, balances, or any other erroneous reporting, must be corrected. If this account has been reported as open or active while it is closed, or if there are any discrepancies with the dates and balance reported, this must be corrected immediately. 

XXXX XXXX  XXXX, XXXX XXXX  has reported inaccurate information on my credit file. This includes any incorrect account status or outstanding balances that do not reflect the actual state of the account. The account status, dates, and balances reported by XXXX XXXX  must be verified and corrected immediately. 

Unauthorized Hard Inquiries Additionally, I have noticed multiple unauthorized hard inquiries that were made to my credit report without my consent. According to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( c ), no one may obtain a credit report or perform a hard inquiry without my written consent. These inquiries need to be removed immediately as they were made in violation of my rights under the FCRA.

Legal Violations : Failure to Correct Inaccurate Information - 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ) : Under 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ), you are required to investigate and correct any inaccuracies in my credit report upon receiving a dispute. Despite my prior notifications, the inaccuracies remain uncorrected, violating this provision. 
Failure to Provide Results of Investigation - 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( i ) : 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( i ) mandates that you conduct a reasonable investigation upon receiving notice of a dispute and provide the results of that investigation. The continued reporting of false information after I have disputed it is a violation of this statute. 
Violation of Consumer Protection Laws- HJR 192, XXXX, XXXX & XXXX : The XXXX XXXX XXXX resolution and the 1099C and 1099A guidelines require that if a debt is written off or canceled, it must be reported as such, and a 1099-C form should be issued. I have never received such documentation, and the reporting of this debt as active is a clear violation of these rules. 

Failure to Remove Inaccurate Information - FCRA Section 611 ( XXXX ) and FCRA Section 605 ( c ) : FCRA Section 611 ( XXXX ) requires the removal of inaccurate or unverifiable information upon investigation. Furthermore, FCRA Section 605 ( c ) restricts the reporting of certain negative information beyond a specific timeframe, and your continued reporting of this account is in violation of this limitation. 

Right to Rescind Credit Transactions- 15 U.S. Code 1635 : According to 15 U.S. Code 1635, I have the right to rescind credit transactions under specific circumstances. The continued erroneous reporting of my credit history disregards this right, particularly regarding debts that may be canceled or rescinded.

Debt Collection Violations- 15 U.S. Code 1692 : Under 15 U.S. Code 1692, debt collectors are prohibited from reporting false or misleading information to credit reporting agencies. The account being reported on my credit file is inaccurate, and there has been no action taken to rectify this violation.

Errors in Credit Report : I find that the following information provided on my credit report is an error. This account was never late or owed any amount ( pursuant to XXXX XXXX XXXX ). You are alleging that I owe a debt without furnishing any proof of this debt, including a full accounting ledger or proof of any 1099s that were filed on behalf of my principal. You have failed to demonstrate that you have followed all relevant laws and regulations for reporting this debt. 

Therefore, you must remove this account from my credit report immediately. 

It is against the law to report any information that has not been proven accurate. Under Georgia law, including provisions found in Georgia Code Title 7 - Banking and Finance, and under relevant statutes such as Georgias Fair Business Practices Act ( FBPA ), a deficiency claim can not be asserted unless all required notices were properly and timely given, and all allowable redemption and cure time limits were adhered to. 

Additionally, as outlined in the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are required to adhere to the following provisions : 15 U.S.C. 1692a ( 1-7 ) : Definitions and regulations governing what constitutes fair and unfair practices in debt collection.

15 U.S.C. 1692e ( 1-12 ) : Prohibits false or misleading representations in connection with debt collection.

15 U.S.C. 1692g ( a-c ) : Requires validation of debts upon request, including the provision of evidence supporting any alleged debt.

15 U.S.C. 1666 : Governs billing errors and prohibits creditors from imposing unauthorized fees.

15 U.S.C. 1681 ( a ) : Requires accurate reporting of information and protection of consumer privacy. 

Supreme Court Cases : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : The U.S. Supreme Court in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX emphasized that a consumer reporting agency must ensure the accuracy and reliability of the information it provides to others. If the information being reported is inaccurate, the consumer has the right to dispute and seek correction. This case reinforces my right to challenge and have corrected any inaccuracies that are being reported about my credit file. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : In XXXX XXXX XXXX, the Supreme Court held that a consumer must demonstrate a concrete injury in order to bring a claim under the FCRA. The Court made it clear that when a consumer 's personal information is misused, especially in ways that can harm their financial reputation, they are entitled to seek legal remedies. The inaccurate reporting and unauthorized hard inquiries on my credit report have caused harm, and I am entitled to seek remedies under these precedents. 

Consequences of Non-Compliance : The alleged claim of a deficiency is null and void, and any continued collection activities or reporting of this invalid claim on my credit reports will be considered a violation of the FDCPA and FCRA.

If you fail to comply with the above requests, I reserve all rights to seek damages against all parties involved under applicable state, federal, and Georgia-specific remedies. 

Legal Demand : Under the FCRA and Georgia law, you are required by law to ensure the accuracy of all information reported. The continued failure to correct these inaccuracies despite repeated notifications is a direct violation of federal consumer protection laws. 

In addition to correcting the inaccuracies, I am entitled to damages under the FCRA, including actual damages, punitive damages up to {$1000.00}, and attorney fees. Moreover, I am entitled to damages for mental anguish in the amount of {$10000.00} due to the ongoing distress caused by the inaccurate reporting and the misuse of my personal information. 

Total Damages : Actual Damages : To be determined based on the impact this has had on my financial health. 

Punitive Damages : Up to {$1000.00} under the FCRA. 
Attorney Fees : To be determined. 
Mental Anguish : {$10000.00} each for emotional distress caused by the continued reporting of inaccurate information, unauthorized use of my data, and the failure to correct these errors. 

Risk of Further Legal Claims : As a data furnishing company involved in the buying, selling, transferring, and securitizing accounts and personal information, you are privately profiting off my personal information. This practice not only increases the risk of data breaches but also raises concerns about identity theft. 

These activities expose you to the potential for legal claims due to mishandling consumer data and may place you at significant risk for further legal consequences. I want to make it clear that continuing these practices could expose you to claims related to past data breaches, identity theft, and violations of consumer protection laws.

If this situation is not resolved promptly, you may face additional claims for damages resulting from these violations.

Corrective Action Required : Immediate Removal of the inaccurate information from my credit reports, including the incorrect account status, dates, and balances on all three credit bureaus.

Verification of Debt : Provide proof that the reported debt is accurate, and if it is a written-off account, issue a 1099-C form as required.

Investigation Results : Provide written confirmation that a reasonable investigation has been conducted, and include the results of the investigation and any corrective actions taken.

Removal of Unauthorized Hard Inquiries : All unauthorized hard inquiries on my credit report must be immediately removed, as they were made without my written consent.

Deadline for Resolution : Please correct these errors and provide the requested documentation within 7 days of receipt of this letter. Failure to comply will leave me no choice but to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and pursue legal action to seek damages under the FCRA, Georgia law, and other applicable state and federal laws. 

Conclusion : The continued reporting of these inaccuracies, failure to respond to my disputes, and the false reporting of my personal information have caused significant harm. I expect these issues to be addressed immediately, and I look forward to your prompt resolution of this matter.
