Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation of the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against EXPERIAN regarding the inaccurate information reported in my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XXXX XX/XX/year> of Credit Report, I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( s ) : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, last verified, closed date, and last payment. 

Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, date of last activity, balance Owed, and creditor type. 

Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, including : 1. Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation.

2. Section 611 : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation.

3. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : Removal of unverifiable information dont validated for creditor Original.

4. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, EXPERIAN has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted on my creditworthiness.

In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated 30-day period, as established in 15 U.S. Code 1681i. Additionally, I referenced 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I AM OUTRAGED AND DEEPLY DISAPPOINTED THAT YOU HAVE FAILED TO REPORT MY CLAIMS IN A MANNER THAT COMPLIES WITH THE REQUIRED STANDARDS, AND I AM DEMANDING IMMEDIATE CORRECTIVE ACTION. THIS LETTER SERVES AS MY FORMAL AND UNEQUIVOCAL DISPUTE REGARDING THE CLAIMS REPORTED IN THE NOTICE. 

YOU HAVE BLATANTLY FAILED TO FOLLOW THE MANDATORY XXXX XXXX DATA-FILLED FIELD FORMATTED REPORTING STANDARDS, AND I CHALLENGE YOU TO PROVIDE CLEAR, IRREFUTABLE EVIDENCE THAT EACH CLAIM WAS REPORTED PROPERLY. 

LET ME MAKE THIS ABUNDANTLY CLEAR : I DO NOT DISPUTE THE VALIDITY OF THE CLAIMS THEMSELVES, BUT I ABSOLUTELY CONTEST YOUR FAILURE TO REPORT THEM IN FULL COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL LAW. ACCORDING TO THE LAW, YOU ARE LEGALLY OBLIGATED TO ENSURE THAT EVERY SINGLE CLAIM IS REPORTED WITH THE HIGHEST DEGREE OF ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS. THE WAY THESE CLAIMS HAVE BEEN REPORTED IS NOT ONLY XXXX IS ILLEGAL. 

UNDER XXXX XXXX, THE CLAIMS YOU HAVE REPORTED ARE QUESTIONABLE AT BEST AND LIKELY UNLAWFUL IN THEIR EXECUTION. IT IS UNACCEPTABLE FOR MY PERSONAL AND FINANCIAL REPUTATION TO BE HARMED BY YOUR NEGLIGENCE, AND I AM DEMANDING THAT YOU IMMEDIATELY CORRECT THE RECORD. 

XXXX. Under XXXX XXXX XXXX this is a billing error always paid as agreed on time this is an error this account is in violation. 
XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX Please correct/update this inaccurate information on my credit report. 

XXXX. Under XXXX XXXX XXXX this is a billing error always paid as agreed on time this is an error this account is in violation. 
XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX Please remove it from my credit report. 


THESE ACCOUNTS WERE PAID. THIS CREDITOR VIOLATES MY RIGHTS UNDER XXXX XXXX. 

Code XXXX XXXX - PROMPT AND FAIR CREDITING OF PAYMENTS. 

( a ) PAYMENTS RECEIVED FROM AN OBLIGOR UNDER AN OPEN-END CONSUMER CREDIT PLAN BY THE CREDITOR SHALL BE POSTED PROMPTLY TO THE OBLIGORS ACCOUNT AS SPECIFIED IN REGULATIONS OF THE BUREAU. 

SUCH REGULATIONS SHALL PREVENT A FINANCE CHARGE FROM BEING IMPOSED ON ANY OBLIGOR IF THE CREDITOR HAS RECEIVED THE OBLIGORS PAYMENT IN READILY IDENTIFIABLE FORM, BY XXXXXXXX XXXX ON THE DATE ON WHICH SUCH PAYMENT IS DUE, IN THE AMOUNT, MANNER, AND LOCATION INDICATED BY THE CREDITOR TO AVOID THE IMPOSITION THEREOF. 

THIS IS CLEARLY A VIOLATION OF MY RIGHTS AND I WILL TAKE FURTHER ACTION TO MAKE SURE MY RIGHTS ARE BEING PROTECTED. Under XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) ( A ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information. After any reinvestigation under paragraph ( XXXX ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

I WILL WAIT FOR YOUR RESPONSE IN WRITING.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Subject : Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX Regarding Improper Use of My Credit File To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX for violations of federal statutes related to the improper use of my credit file, reporting of information without consent, and failure to comply with legal obligations regarding debt reporting and income recognition. 
1. Unauthorized Use and Reporting of Credit Information : XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to comply with 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which specifies permissible purposes for obtaining and using consumer credit reports. I never provided written consent for XXXX XXXX XXXX to report any information to my credit file. 
According to 16 CFR 313.7, financial institutions must obtain explicit authorization from consumers before sharing nonpublic personal information unless an exception applies, none of which are applicable here. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of their information-sharing policies and practices, which XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX failed to do. Their actions also appear to violate 15 U.S.C. 6805, which empowers regulatory bodies to enforce these provisions.

2. Charge-Off Reporting and Misclassification : A charge-off is a bookkeeping designation used by creditors for tax purposes when they consider a debt uncollectible. Under federal tax law, a charge-off can be treated as a cancellation of debt, which may constitute income to the debtor. However, XXXX XXXX XXXX did not issue a 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ) form to me, as required under IRS regulations , to substantiate that the debt was canceled and classified as income. Without this form, their reporting of the charge-off to credit reporting agencies is not only improper but also misleading. 

Moreover, a charge-off does not represent a valid certificate of indebtedness. A certificate of indebtedness reflects a binding obligation that is enforceable ; a charge-off, by its nature, implies that the debt has been resolved or abandoned by the creditor. Reporting a charge-off to credit bureaus under these circumstances constitutes inaccurate reporting.

3. Lack of Transparency and Consumer Rights Violations : XXXX XXXX XXXX has disregarded my consumer rights by failing to provide adequate notice or obtain my written consent before furnishing information to credit reporting agencies. This omission violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). Their noncompliance with transparency requirements and failure to respect the confidentiality of my personal financial information is concerning. 

I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate XXXX XXXX XXXX practices to determine whether they are in violation of federal laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. XXXX ( GLBAs financial privacy rules ) ; 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( FCRAs permissible purposes for credit reporting ) ; 16 CFR 313.7 ( GLBA privacy and opt-out regulations ). Additionally, I request clarification and appropriate remediation regarding : 1. The absence of a 1099-C form to substantiate the charge-off as canceled debt.

2. The improper classification of a charge-off as a certificate of indebtedness.

3. The unauthorized reporting of information to credit bureaus without my explicit written consent. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in ensuring compliance and protecting my rights as a consumer. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute significant inaccuracies in the reporting of multiple accounts on my credit reports, as furnished by XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX. These inaccuracies, reflected by both Experian and XXXX, include false reports of late payments and conflicting information, which violate multiple provisions of U.S. law. 

The accounts in question are : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( Experian, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX ( Experian, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( Experian, XXXX ) Violations of Federal Law The reporting by these entities violates several provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports Credit reporting agencies are legally obligated to ensure that consumer information is accurate. These accounts reflect false late payments and inconsistent data, demonstrating a clear failure to comply. 

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) Dispute Resolution Obligations Experian and XXXX are required to conduct timely and reasonable investigations upon receiving disputes. Their failure to correct these inaccuracies contravenes this legal requirement. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Furnisher Responsibility to Report Accurate Information XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX are prohibited from furnishing information they know or should reasonably know is inaccurate. False late payments and inconsistent data violate this obligation. 

15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) Permissible Purposes for Reporting Consumer Information Reporting entities must ensure the accuracy and proper handling of consumer data. The discrepancies in these accounts constitute a breach of this legal duty.

15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) Exclusion of Obsolete or Inaccurate Information The inclusion of unverifiable or inaccurate late payments and inconsistent account data violates the mandate to exclude such information.

Impact of Violations These inaccuracies have adversely affected my credit score, causing significant financial harm and stress. Such reporting negligence undermines my rights under federal law and diminishes my access to fair credit opportunities.

My Requests Immediate Corrections : Remove any inaccurate late payments or conflicting data for the accounts listed above.

Ensure Accuracy : Correct all discrepancies across Experian and XXXX credit reports. 
Conduct a Full Investigation : Investigate the reporting practices of XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX for compliance with the FCRA. 
Written Confirmation : Provide written confirmation of the resolution process and actions taken.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
ACCOUNTS : XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX After I received correspondence from your agency, it stated that the accounts I disputed were verified by your agency. Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) 1 ( a ), I am demanding that your agency perform a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the status of the disputed information.

Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) please complete this inaccurate account or delete it from my consumer reports.

The Law Cleary States : ( a ) Reinvestigations of disputed information ( 1 ) Reinvestigation required ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller.

I DO NOT consent to any E-OSCAR verification as this method is not reliable or lawful, according to the standards set for by the FCRA.

I am requesting that you validate the following items non-electronically, by performing a reasonable and FAIR re-investigation : Please provide the following details of the methods by which you verified these accounts : a. Identity and position of the representative contacted?

b. Date, duration, and substance of the conversation?

c. Contact details utilized?

d. Identity, position, and tenure of your company 's employees involved?

e. Details of formal training imparted to said employee?

f. Copies of all written correspondence?

Your agency also seems to be in violation of non-compliance and negligent non-compliance with being in direct violation or the following laws : 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court.

( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater. 

These are now multiple attempts to handle this matter privately. If these accounts keep getting verified by a faulty e-Oscar system when I know these accounts are erroneous and destroying my credit worthiness, I will in fact sue your agency for the maximum monetary damages that the FCRA allows. 

Your agency has less than 30 days to respond with a fair reasonable re-investigation or I will have no choice but to seek legal action. This investigation must be validated by the information that I have listed above. If the information is not validated, then it must be deleted immediately from my consumer report!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Against XXXX, Experian, and XXXX for Reporting Inaccurate Information and Violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau From : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Complaint Against : XXXX, Experian, and XXXX -- XXXX Introduction I am submitting this updated formal complaint against XXXX, Experian, and XXXX for their repeated violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). These credit bureaus have reported inaccurate, misleading, and harmful information on my credit reports. The ongoing reporting errors, inconsistencies, and outdated information are causing significant harm to my financial stability, creditworthiness, and reputation. 

The following violations and errors must be investigated and addressed immediately. 


-- - Accounts in Question and Errors Identified XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** Reported solely by XXXX XXXX " Refinanced, '' with a " Status Mismatch, '' which creates confusion regarding the true standing of this account. 

The account was closed on XX/XX/XXXX, and the balance is {$0.00} ; however, the status mismatch remains unresolved. 

Experian and XXXX fail to report this account, leaving incomplete credit information across all bureaus. 



XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** Reported solely by XXXX XXXX marked as " Late 120 Days, '' without substantiated evidence. 

Balance discrepancies : XXXX reports a balance of {$470.00} with a {$0.00} limit, but no transactions justify the listed status. 


Payment discrepancies : The last payment is listed as {$0.00} with a date of XX/XX/XXXX, making the late payment reporting inaccurate. 




XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** XXXX and XXXX report inconsistent balances : XXXX XXXX {$9000.00} remaining from {$10000.00}. 

XXXX : {$8900.00} remaining from {$10000.00}. 


Experian fails to report this account altogether. 



XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** Utilization exceeds 100 %, reported at 103 %, which is inaccurate and misleading. 

Discrepancies in reporting payments and balances across bureaus : XXXX and XXXX report a balance of {$12000.00} with a {$12000.00} limit. 

Experian fails to report this account entirely. 




XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** This account is marked as " Paid '' and " Closed, '' but XXXX XXXX a {$1300.00} limit while XXXX XXXX a {$0.00} limit. 

Experian fails to report this account entirely, creating a reporting inconsistency. 



XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** XXXX XXXX a {$0.00} balance with a {$33000.00} limit, but Experian and XXXX fail to report this account entirely, omitting critical financial information. 



XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** Reported as " Late 90 Days '' with discrepancies in balances : XXXX XXXX {$25000.00}. 

Experian and XXXX : {$25000.00}. 




XXXX. Address Errors Correct Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TN XXXX. 

XXXX, Experian, and XXXX continue to report an outdated address, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TN XXXX, causing miscommunication and further inaccuracies. 





-- - Violations Committed by the Credit Bureaus 1. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Duty to Ensure Maximum Possible Accuracy The credit bureaus have failed to ensure the accuracy of the reported information, including address discrepancies, status mismatches, and unjustified derogatory marks.

2. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation Despite formal disputes and notifications, the credit bureaus have failed to investigate or correct the inaccuracies on my credit reports.

3. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) Duties of Furnishers of Information By allowing furnishers to report inaccurate and outdated information, the credit bureaus have enabled the violation of their duties under federal law. 



XXXX. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) Reporting of Obsolete Information Derogatory marks on closed and paid accounts, such as XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX are misleading and obsolete. 



XXXX. Failure to Properly Update Credit Files ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ) The credit bureaus have failed to update or delete inaccurate information, including outdated addresses and incorrect account statuses, despite being notified of these errors. 



XXXX. Defamation and Harm to Credit Reputation By publishing false and outdated information, the credit bureaus have defamed my creditworthiness, resulting in financial harm and denial of credit opportunities. 



XXXX. Failure to Report Data Consistently Across Bureaus The account data for XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX  is inconsistent across XXXX, Experian, and XXXX. 



XXXX. Negligence in Address Updates TXXXX and others have failed to update my current address, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TN XXXX, and continue to report an outdated address. 



XXXX. Failure to Notify Creditors of Disputes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 2 ) ) The credit bureaus have failed to notify creditors that these accounts are disputed, violating federal requirements and further damaging my financial stability. 





-- - Impact of the Violations These violations have resulted in a significant drop in my credit scores, making it challenging to access loans, credit, or favorable interest rates. 

The inaccuracies in reporting, such as address errors and mismatched account statuses, have created confusion for creditors, damaging my financial reputation. 

The continued reporting of derogatory marks on paid and closed accounts has caused both financial and emotional distress. 



-- - Requested Action I request the CFPB to investigate the repeated violations committed by XXXX, Experian, and XXXX and enforce the appropriate penalties under the FCRA. These inaccuracies must be corrected immediately to prevent further harm. 


-- - Conclusion The actions of these credit bureaus demonstrate a failure to uphold their obligations under federal law. I urge the CFPB to take swift action to ensure compliance, accountability, and the correction of my credit reports. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Repeated Charge-Off Reports and inaccurate late payment reporting. 
Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX XXXX Opened : XX/XX/XXXX. 
This account is inaccurately being reported with monthly charge-offs, potentially re-aging the debt Illegally and the statute of limitations. This constitutes a clear violation of 15 USC 1681e ( b ), Necessitating its removal immediately. 
You have a charge off in XXXX, XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX and inaccurate late payment reporting in XXXX and XXXX off XXXX. See picture of report enclosed. 
Under 1637 ( b ) of the F.C.R.A. a creditor must adopt reasonable procedures to inform the consumer by mail or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. I am requesting valid proof of this being done. I request that you delete this account now for the two violations on my report for 3 years now.

I request, pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), that you Experian credit reporting agency block all the accounts or collections identified in this CFPB complaint from my consumer credit file within 4 business days of receiving said complaint. I request that all written confirmation regarding this CFPB complaint be sent to me via email to the email address XXXX Title VI, Sections 611 ( a ) through ( d ), I am invoking my right to a detailed and meaningful investigation of disputed items listed.

In line with these provisions, I request a comprehensive description of the procedure used to verify the accuracy and completeness of the information, which should be provided within fifteen ( 15 ) days Following the completion of your investigation. This includes the name, address, and telephone number of everyone contacted regarding this alleged account, along with copies of any documents bearing my signature the purportedly established a legal binding contractual obligation to pay the amount claimed. Please be aware that the automated responses or XXXX - XXXX verifications are unacceptable for addressing this matter. A detailed investigation and explicit disclosure of your verification method are required as per the statutory guidelines. 
This communication serves as my final goodwill attempt to rectify this matter amicably. The disputed item is not only inaccurate but also incomplete and represents a significant error in your report. I am maintaining a detailed record of all communication for this issue, to be used for filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and the Attorney Generals office if necessary. Please note that failure to satisfactorily resolve this matter within 30 days of receiving this letter may prompt me to initiate a small claims action against your company, seeking {$1000.00} per violation for 1. Defamation. 2.Negligent reporting. 3. Violations of Fair Credit Reporting Act. Dependent upon your response, I may also detail any potential issues with your company via an online public press release, including documentation of any small claims action Cc : CFPB Cc : Attorney Generals office Cc : FTC Best Regards, XXXX XXXX XXXX

15 U.S. Code 1681 ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) in general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall-i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Louisiana XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against XXXX, XXXX, and Experian for two significant violations of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation of Disputed Information : On XX/XX/year>, I filed a dispute with XXXX regarding inaccuracies in my credit report. I explicitly requested a manual review of the disputed information due to its complexity. I provided clear supporting evidence, including highlighted copies of my credit report identifying the errors. However, Experian used the E-Oscar system to process my dispute electronically rather than conducting the manual review I requested. This process fails to ensure a thorough investigation, as required under the FCRA. 
The response I received was vague and did not provide sufficient detail regarding the methods, sources, or procedures used to verify the disputed information. My specific questions about the investigation process remain unanswered. 
2. Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance by a Collection Agency : Account Name Account Number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Despite my dispute, Experian, XXXX, and XXXX continue to report this collection account without verifying its validity or requiring the collection agency to issue a 1099-C. This raises questions about the legitimacy of the debt and violates federal regulations.

Key Violations : 1. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation : o Experian violated 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) by failing to conduct a manual review of my dispute as explicitly requested.

o The use of E-Oscar resulted in an inadequate and incomplete investigation.

2. Failure to Provide Details of Investigation : o Experian failed to provide the methods, sources, and documentation used in their investigation, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 4 ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ).

3. Inaccurate Reporting and Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance : o Experian, XXXX, and XXXX continue to report inaccurate information, violating my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

o The collection agencys failure to issue a 1099-C for canceled or forgiven debt violates IRS regulations and raises concerns about the accounts validity.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/year> Experian XXXX Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct XXXX XXXXXXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation of the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against EXPERIAN regarding the inaccurate information reported in my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XXXX XXXX of Credit Report, I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( s ) : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, high balance is reported differently in the credit agencies, date of last activity, last payment, and credit. 

Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, including : 1. Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation.

2. Section 611 : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation.

3. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : Removal of unverifiable information dont validated for creditor Original.

4. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, EXPERIAN has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted on my creditworthiness.

In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated 30-day period, as established in 15 U.S. Code 1681i. Additionally, I referenced 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Experian, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX 

RE : Dispute Authorization and Multiple Violations of Fair Credit Reporting Act I, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, hereby authorize this dispute. It is important to note that this dispute was not sent by an unauthorized third party or " credit clinic. '' I am writing to address several violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) that have occurred, which require your immediate attention and resolution. The violations are as follows : FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You are reporting fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, thus infringing upon my privacy rights. I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. I insist that my hard inquiries and account information not be shared on my credit report.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : The information you are reporting falsely suggests that I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts, when in reality, these were the result of a scammer 's actions. Such false reporting misleads future creditors. By reporting these unverified items, you violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and fail to comply with its fairness requirements.

FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : You accepted credit information about me without verifying its accuracy firsthand. This willful noncompliance is punishable by civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation.

FCRA Section 605B - Aggravated Identity Theft : You shared my personal information with numerous creditors without obtaining my consent, making you criminally liable for aggravated identity theft, which carries a penalty of up to 2 years of imprisonment.

FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You failed to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission was deceptive and a violation of my consumer rights.

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : You furnished inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, potentially violating Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). Reporting such inaccurate information is deceptive.

Violation of Debt Collection Practices Act : You engaged in unfair practices and harassment by reporting inaccurate debts and accounts without my consent, causing me distress and unnecessary contact from creditors. 

Violation of Identity Theft Laws : Creditors obtained my information without my true consent and used it to obtain credit from other financial institutions, constituting identity theft.

Violation of Acquiring Location Information Regulations : Debt collectors contacted third-party credit reporting agencies with my information, stating that I owed a " debt. '' This is a clear violation of regulations that prohibit disclosing debt information to third parties.

Violation of Timely Payments Regulations : You reported " late payments '' on my credit report without defining what constitutes a late payment, which is deceptive and inaccurate.

Violation of Finance Charge Determination : You failed to accurately determine finance charges, which is your responsibility as a credit reporting agency. 

Violation of Credit Report Permissible Purposes : You reported information on my credit report without obtaining my written consent, which is a violation of the permissible purposes outlined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

I, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, demand that you take immediate action to address these violations. I request the following actions : 1. Under 15 USC 1666b this late payment entry is a violation. I have been incorrectly billed. 

[ Account Name ] XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX : XXXX Please update the status of this account to " paid on time. '' Remove all fraudulent and inaccurate accounts from my credit report. 
Block any information resulting from identity theft, as required by FCRA.I expect a prompt response and resolution to this matter. Failure to comply will leave me with no choice but to pursue legal remedies available under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, I am writing to formally report and request resolution for an urgent issue concerning my CareCredit credit card account issued by Synchrony Bank. Specifically, I have identified a concerning discrepancy regarding an unfamiliar phone number associated with my account. This inconsistency raises serious questions about the accuracy and security of my personal information. 

Details of the Issue : Unauthorized Phone Number : The credit cards app displays a phone number that does not belong to me but matches my fathers number. I have confirmed with him that he has been receiving access codes for getting into my account, which is both confusing and concerning. 
Customer Service Response : Despite contacting their team multiple times, I was assured that only my phone number is on file. This directly conflicts with the evidence I have, including a picture I took of the phone number on their app. 
Potential Security Concern : This discrepancy suggests a possible breach or technical error in their system. Unauthorized access to my accounts sensitive information could lead to significant security risks and I would like them to take immediate corrective action. 
Customer Service Experience : The dismissive attitude of their customer service agents has compounded my frustration. I called the CareCredit hotline multiple times in the past week regarding various issues surrounding my card, yet each time, my concerns were met with reassurances that do not align with the facts or address the core problem. On multiple occasions, agents downplayed the issue, referring to it as a glitch and implying there was nothing more to investigate. Some even went so far as to say, " Well, the supervisor is just going to tell you the same thing I just told you, '' only for the supervisor to provide a different explanation that temporarily fixed the problem. Despite my persistence, these interactions have lacked the urgency and seriousness that this situation warrants, leaving me feeling disregarded and unsupported. 

Actions Requested : 1. Comprehensive Investigation : Please investigate how this phone number was associated with my account and provide a detailed explanation.

2. Immediate Correction : Ensure that the unauthorized phone number is removed and that all communications and access codes are directed solely to my verified contact information.

3. System Audit : Conduct a thorough review of your systems to identify and resolve any technical or procedural issues that may have contributed to this error.

4. Written Assurance : Provide written confirmation that my account information is secure and that steps have been taken to prevent future occurrences. 

Supporting Evidence : I have attached a screenshot from the app showing the unauthorized phone number. 

Additional Concerns : This is not the first issue I have encountered with CareCredit. For instance, I recently experienced a problem while traveling, despite having submitted a travel alert. My card was deactivated in XXXX, leaving me without access to funds. I explained to customer service that I would be stranded and they were initially unhelpful and unmoved, and the issue required intervention from a supervisor who easily reactivated the card and told me the complete opposite of what the agents initially told me. That was a dangerous situation. 

I've also had problems with cash advances recently. I filed a complaint against an operator who confidently told me that I'm unable to use my card for that and that getting transferred to the supervisor would yield the same results only to be told by the supervisor that I in fact can use my card in that manner. 

On top of all that, I've also been unable to access my rewards for the past month. They told me a ticket was submitted for the rewards issue but I never received confirmation. At the moment, I have more than XXXX points. These repeated incidents have further eroded my confidence in the reliability and security of this company. Moreover, this can happen to other customers. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Louisiana XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Dispute Department po box XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to dispute the reporting of a collection account by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on my credit report. It is impossible for this account to have been verified because a CFPB complaint was sent to XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/2024, and they failed to validate this alleged account. 

The response provided by your bureau to my prior dispute was insufficient. This collection account remains inaccurate and unverified. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to validation of any alleged debt reported on my credit file. 

Despite my requests, the following critical items have not been provided by XXXX XXXX XXXX : An explanation of the alleged account balance, including a complete XXXX XXXX and payment history. Documentation showing my agreement to this debt, including my signature and authorization for you to report this information. Proof of a valid agreement authorizing XXXX XXXX XXXX to collect this debt. Evidence of their state license to operate and collect debts in my state. The original promissory note and chain of custody for this account. The purchase agreement showing how and why my information was obtained without consent. This lack of documentation raises concerns about the legitimacy of this account and the accuracy of its reporting. Additionally, XXXX XXXX XXXX appears to be in violation of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, furnishing deceptive forms to create a false belief of participation in the collection of this debt, which I have not authorized.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to demand the immediate removal of fraudulent information from my credit report. The disputed items were not authorized by me and are the result of identity theft or inaccuracies that XXXX has failed to address despite its legal obligation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) These items were opened or reported without my authorization. I have previously notified XXXX of this matter and provided supporting documentation, but the erroneous entries remain, causing undue harm to my financial well-being. 



Violations of Federal Law 1. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation ( FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ) Upon receiving a dispute, XXXX is required to investigate and remove unverifiable or fraudulent information. Your failure to take corrective action violates this provision. 

2. Reporting Inaccurate Information ( FCRA 607 ( b ) ) Credit reporting agencies are required to maintain maximum accuracy in the information they report. The continued presence of fraudulent accounts on my credit file demonstrates a failure to meet this obligation.

3. Failure to Correct or Delete Fraudulent Entries ( FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ) If an item can not be verified as accurate, XXXX must delete it within 30 days of receiving the dispute. By failing to remove these fraudulent entries, XXXX has breached its legal responsibilities.

Thank you for taking the time to read this letter. I'm writing because I noticed that my most recent credit report contains a late payment reported on [ XX/XX/year> ] for my closed paid XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
I want you to know that I understand my financial obligations, and if it weren't for an oversight, l 'd have an excellent repayment record. I made a mistake in falling behind, but since then, I have diligently paid on my account. Since then, l 've had a spotless record of on-time payments. 
My wife and I are planning to apply for a mortgage, and it's come to my attention that the missed payments on my record could hurt my ability to qualify. I truly believe that it doesn't reflect my creditworthiness and commitment to repaying my debts. It would help me immensely if you could give me a second chance and make a goodwill adjustment to remove the late payments. 
Thank you for your consideration, and I hope you'll approve my request. 
Sincerely : XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation of the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against EXPERIAN regarding the inaccurate information reported in my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XXXX XX/XX/year> of Credit Report, I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( s ) : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, high balance is reported differently in the credit agencies, date of last activity, last payment, and credit. 

Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, including : 1. Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation.

2. Section 611 : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation.

3. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : Removal of unverifiable information dont validated for creditor Original.

4. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, EXPERIAN has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted on my creditworthiness. 
In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated 30-day period, as established in 15 U.S. Code 1681i. Additionally, I referenced 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION SEEKING RELIEF AND MONETARY COMPENSATION UNDER FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1692k civil liability. 

Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated information from my consumer file. I intend to pursue litigation in accordance with the FCRA to seek relief and recover all monetary damages that I may be entitled to under Section 616 and Section 617 if the INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated items listed below are not deleted immediately. A copy of this letter as well as INACCURATE ERRONEOUS ITEMS sent to you previously will also become part of a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission and shall be used as evidence in pending litigation provided you fail to comply with this offer of settlement. 

YOU ARE IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF THE FCRA, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to ... promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified.

Its very obvious that your agency doesnt know what the FCRA is because from the looks of my credit report and all the errors i see you are disregarding it so heres my breakdown.

1.The Fair Credit Reporting Act is the primary federal law that governs the collection and reporting of credit information about consumers. Its rules cover
how a consumer 's credit information is obtained, how long it is kept, and how it is shared with othersincluding consumers themselves.

2. What is a FCRA violation?

Creditors give reporting agencies inaccurate financial information about you. Reporting agencies mixing up one person 's information with another 's because of similar ( or same ) last name or social security number. Agencies fail to follow guidelines for handling disputes.

3. My rights under the fair credit reporting act Verify the accuracy of my report when it is required for employment purposes.

Receive notification if information in my file has been used against me in applying for credit or other transactions.

Disputeand have the bureaus correct and deleteinformation in my report that is incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable.

Remove outdated, negative information ( after seven years in most cases, 10 in the case of bankruptcy ). 

I demand these items be deleted immediately. I entered the items and the outcome I desire below because you are in violation and these items are not 100 % accurate and they are either INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated. I recently applied for extended credit and was denied i am in distress because of your mistakes. 

The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA. 

ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX  XXXX ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX XXXX  XXXX ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX XXXX XXXX  ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX XXXX. XXXX  ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX  XXXX  ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX XXXX XXXX  ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX XXXX XXXX  ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX ACCOUNT NAME : XXXX XXXX XXXX  ACCOUNT NUMBER : XXXX VIOLATION OF 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court. Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX TO EXPERIAN, XXXX AND XXXX Dear Sir or Madam : I am a victim of identity theft. I recently learned that my personal information was used to open XXXXP XXXX accountS IN MY NAME. I did not open or authorize this account, and I therefore request that it be closed immediately. 

I am writing to dispute fraudulent charges on my account and my EXPERIAN, XXXX, AND XXXX credit report file. I have attached a copy of the report I received. As required by section 611 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. 1681i, a copy of which is enclosed, I am requesting that the item ( s ) be removed. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX  Reported : XXXX XXXX, XXXX, {$770.00} Closed Balance {$770.00} Credit limit {$300.00} Opened XXXX. XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX yrs, XXXX mos ) ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX Reported : XXXX XXXX, XXXX Closed Opened XXXX. XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX yrs, XXXX Charged off account ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX Opened XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX yrs, XXXX mos ) Charge-off ( XXXX ) XXXXXXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX Charge-off/Collection XXXX XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX yrs, XXXX mo ) {$2500.00} XXXX  ( XXXX ) XXXX Opened XXXX XXXX, XXXX EXPERIAN, XXXX AND XXXX HARD INQUIRIES hard inquiry not XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I did not authorized these merchants to do a hard inquiry on my credit report, an unknown person violated my identity, I did not open those credit cards in my name, and I did not open any car loan in my name and those collections accounts do not belong to me. I did not open an account XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX amount XXXX phone number XXXX XXXX national XXXX XXXX XXXX amount XXXX phone number XXXX. 

I AM A VICTIM OF IDENTITY THEFT, AND I DID NOT MAKE THIS CHARGE NOR OPEN THESE ACCOUNTS. I AM REQUESTING THAT THE CHARGE AND ACCOUNTS BE REMOVED. 

ENCLOSED ARE COPIES OF A POLICE REPORT AND IDENTITY THEFT AFFIDAVIT SUPPORTING MY POSITION. PLEASE INVESTIGATE THIS MATTER AND CORRECT THE FRAUDULENT CHARGES AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. 

IN ADDITION, AS A VICTIM OF IDENTITY THEFT, I AM REQUESTING THAT YOU PROVIDE ME WITH COPIES OF ANY APPLICATIONS AND BUSINESS TRANSACTION RECORDS RELATED TO THE FRAUDULENT ACCOUNTS. I AM REQUESTING ALL SIGNED CONTRACTS THAT I SIGNED FOR THESE ACCOUNTS. THE COPIES OF THE RECORDS CAN BE MAILED TO ME AT THE ABOVE ADDRESS. 

IN ADDITION, I HAVE MADE A COMPLAINT TO THE CITY OF XXXX POLICE DEPARTMENT. 

SINCERELY, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation of the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against EXPERIAN regarding the inaccurate information reported in my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XXXX XX/XX/year> of Credit Report, I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( s ) : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, last verified, closed date, and last payment. 

Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, date of last activity, balance Owed, and creditor type. 

Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, including : 1. Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation.

2. Section 611 : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation.

3. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : Removal of unverifiable information dont validated for creditor Original.

4. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, EXPERIAN has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted on my creditworthiness.

In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated 30-day period, as established in 15 U.S. Code 1681i. Additionally, I referenced 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the list of accounts has violated my Federally protected Consumer right to privacy and confidentiality under USC 1681. 

XXXX ACCT NUMBER XXXX XXXX  ACCT NUMBER XXXX XXXX ACCT NUMBER XXXX XXXX  ACCT NUMBER XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCT NUMBER XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCT NUMBER XXXX 15 USC 1681 Section 602 ( A ) affirms a right to privacy.

15 USC 1681 Section 604 ( A ) affirms that a Consumer Reporting Agency ( CRA ) can not furnish account information ( or status ) without written permission. To date, no such permission has been granted or authorized.

15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) affirms that no Consumer Reporting Agency ( CRA ) may make any consumer report containing the following items of information : other adverse items of information or records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report more than seven years.

15 USC 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) affirms that a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer reporting agency if a person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an alleged late payment reported on my account. This late payment was reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX for account number XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  account number XXXX to your agency. 
( Experian, XXXX, XXXX ) and I believe that the entry is inaccurate, The payment in question is identified as } late but I do not believe that the creditor has followed the legal requirements to report it as such under the fair Credit reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related laws Legal Basis for Dispute : Under 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ), the term " consumer report " does not include reports that solely contain information regarding transactions or experience between a consumer and the person making the report. As such, any transaction or experience between myself and the company regarding this account should not be included in my consumer credit report.

U.S Code 1681 a ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), 1666b, and 1637 ( b ), the information reported to the credit bureau is invalid, and there is no basis for it to remain on my credit report. 

Request for action If XXXX can not provide the necessary proof of mailing or delivery of the required information, i request that the late payments and charge offs be deleted from my credit report. Failure to do so will be considered a violation of US code 1681s-2, which prohibits the reporting of inaccurate or unverifiable information. 
I respectfully request that you take the appropriate action to remove the inaccurate late payment entry from my credit report within 10 calendar days of receiving this notice. 
Late Payments in Question : XXXX XXXX current. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. i look forward to your response and consideration that the disputed late payment entry has been removed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Louisiana XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian XXXX Department XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Account Information Request for Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the following account information listed on my credit report. The details are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : Partial Acct # XXXX Verify the following issues with this account for completeness and accuracy : -Balance -Entire payment history -Date of last activity -Date of last payment -High balance -Recent balance -Credit limit or original balance -Status -Actual Amount Paid I am requesting that you investigate and verify the accuracy and completeness of this account. If you are unable to verify the information and provide me proof of the information verified, according to the FCRA. I respectfully request that the account be Deleted from my credit file under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Please provide me with the results of your investigation and an updated credit report reflecting any changes made to my file. If this account can not be verified, I expect it to be Deleted from my credit report promptly. 

If the account can not be verified in full compliance with the FCRA, I respectfully request that it be Deleted from my credit file immediately. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation of your findings and all actions taken as a result of this dispute within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Please mail your response to my address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute fraudulent accounts on my credit reports resulting from identity theft. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent, and their reporting violates multiple provisions of U.S. law, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The accounts in question are : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, Experian, XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX, Experian, XXXX ) XXXX ( XXXX, Experian, XXXX ) XXXX  XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, Experian ) XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, Experian, XXXX ) Under 15 U.S.C . 1681c-2, I have the right to block and demand removal of information resulting from identity theft. Furthermore, reporting these accounts without my explicit consent violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for accessing and reporting consumer information. I assert that these accounts were created and reported unlawfully, and I never provided consent for such reporting.

I have attached an identity theft affidavit and additional supporting documentation. Please ensure these accounts are removed from my credit reports immediately. 

I request written confirmation of receipt of this dispute and updates regarding the resolution process. I also remind you of your obligation to address these violations promptly under 15 U.S.C. 1681i. 

Thank you for your urgent attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Dispute and Demand for Removal of Unauthorized/Inaccurate Credit Inquiries To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute and demand the removal of several credit inquiries listed on my credit report that are not attached to any open account and/or were not authorized by me. The presence of these inquiries violates my rights under federal law, specifically the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., which governs the permissible use and accuracy of consumer credit information. 

1. Violation of FCRA Inaccurate Credit Reporting The credit inquiries listed below are not connected to any open or active account, nor were they authorized in compliance with permissible purposes under : 15 U.S.C. 1681b : Permissible purposes of consumer reports. 
Credit inquiries should only appear on a consumers report if they were authorized or resulted from a transaction initiated by the consumer. Reporting unauthorized or inaccurate inquiries constitutes a violation of : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Duty to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer credit information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Under 15 USC 6802, a financial institution is prohibited from disclosing nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the following conditions are met : The institution provides a clear and conspicuous disclosure to the consumer, in writing, electronically, or through another permitted form, stating that such information may be shared with third parties.

The consumer is given the opportunity, prior to the initial disclosure, to opt-out of having their information shared.

The institution provides an explanation of how the consumer can exercise this opt-out right.

In this case, the financial institution failed to inform me of my rights or provide the required disclosures to protect my privacy. Furthermore, I have become aware that my personal information was compromised in a data breach, representing another significant violation of my privacy rights.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Experian has failed to conduct a proper and thorough investigation as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. The reporting of XXXX XXXX collection/Closed account on my credit report does not satisfy the FCRA 's requirement for maximum possible accuracy under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). To date, I have seen no evidence that a reasonable investigation was conducted, nor has any proof documented proof has been provided to determine the verification of such information Experian is reporting.

According to Section 611 of the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), Experian is required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information. This investigation must involve obtaining sufficient documentation to verify the validity and accuracy of the collection account. To ensure compliance with federal law, Experian must Obtain Original Source Documentation : This includes the original contract. Simply relying on information provided by the furnisher without reviewing original source documentation is insufficient to meet the statutory requirements. 

In XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ), the court held that a credit reporting agency has an obligation to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy in consumer reports. Failure to verify the accuracy of disputed information and reliance solely on the furnishers ( XXXX XXXX ) response is not considered a reasonable procedure. This case sets a precedent for requiring independent verification of reported information. 

The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX case further emphasizes this requirement, as it established that a credit reporting agency can not simply accept a furnisher 's response without conducting an independent review. If documentation supporting the account 's accuracy is not obtained, the information must be deleted.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, I called PNC to report a compromised credit card. The card was closed, but the access to all credit card statements was precipitously removed from my online banking. I had a cash reward due to me but was unable to redeem it. After multiple calls, I did not receive any new card or information about the account until XXXX, when I was notified of a balance due and a late fee. On XX/XX/XXXX, I paid a balance of {$47.00}, and the late fee was waved, due to all the problems with receiving the card and the lack of access to any statements. I was told access to my online statements would be restored. However, it never was restored, so I never used the new card after I finally received and activated it. 

Today ( XX/XX/XXXX ) I received an email stating I owe a {$25.00} late fee. After several more calls, I was told that no one could se the old credit card statements, and that I already had online access and nothing could be done because " we can't waive XXXX late fees '' from XXXX. I was told to use a username from XXXX years ago and create a new password because PNC is no longer linking the credit card to my business account, even though my personal and business accounts have been linked since inception. I did as instructed and was STILL UNABLE to access the credit card statement. I refuse to pay a second late fee when I have never been able to access the account information, have not been able to redeem credit due me, have not used the new card, and no one has restored online access, NOR snail-mailed me ANYTHING about this account.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against Upstart and its lending partners due to concerns over their denial of my loan application in a manner that I believe violates the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) and Regulation B. 
Details of the Issue : Applicant Name : XXXX XXXX Reference Number : XXXX Date of Adverse Action Notice : XX/XX/year> I applied for a loan through Upstart, providing secured collateral as part of the transaction. Despite this, my application was denied based on factors such as credit score, credit history, and income, as outlined in their Adverse Action Notice. I believe this decision and the evaluation process violate federal laws for the following reasons : 1. Failure to Properly Consider Secured Collateral : As a secured creditor, my application should not have been denied based solely on credit score or other traditional metrics when sufficient collateral was provided. Under ECOA ( 15 U.S.C. 1691 ), it is illegal to discriminate in credit transactions, including failing to appropriately assess applications involving secured collateral. 
2. Lack of Transparency in Decision-Making : Upstarts Adverse Action Notice does not explain how the collateral provided was factored into the decision or why my application was denied despite it. This lack of clarity does not align with Regulation B ( 12 CFR 1002 ), which requires creditors to provide specific and detailed reasons for adverse actions.

3. Potential Discrimination : The denial appears to have been based on traditional credit metrics that disproportionately impact certain consumers, particularly those with limited credit histories or non-traditional financial profiles. This may constitute an unfair practice under ECOA, which prohibits credit discrimination. 
Desired Resolution : I am seeking the following resolutions to address this matter : XXXX. Reconsideration of My Application : Request a re-evaluation of my application, taking into full account the collateral provided and my status as a secured creditor, rather than solely relying on traditional credit metrics. 
XXXX. Detailed Explanation of Decision : A clear, written explanation of how my application was evaluated, including how the collateral was considered and how the decision complies with ECOA and Regulation B.

3. Policy Review and Compliance Assurance : I request that Upstart review its credit decision-making policies and practices to ensure compliance with ECOA and Regulation B. This includes providing better transparency and accountability in evaluating secured transactions. 
XXXX. Removal of Any Adverse Credit Impact : If the denial resulted in negative impacts on my credit report ( e.g., inquiries or reporting of the denial ), I request corrective action to remove such entries. 
5. Assurances of Non-Discriminatory Practices : Upstart should commit to addressing any potential discriminatory practices in its lending decisions and provide evidence of corrective measures. 
Supporting Documents Enclosed : Adverse Action Notice dated XX/XX/year> Correspondence regarding the application ( if applicable ) [ Any other relevant documents ] I request that the CFPB investigate this matter to ensure compliance with federal laws and to promote fair and equitable lending practices. 
Thank you for your attention to this complaint. Please let me know if additional information or documentation is needed. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
