Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Can't use card to make purchases
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally notify Synchrony Bank of several serious violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), IRS Guidelines ( XXXX ), and other applicable laws. Additionally, I am demanding immediate corrective action regarding the misuse of my personal information, including its use in securities and stock trading, without my consent or any distribution of profits from such activities.

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Other Laws Right to Privacy - 15 U.S. Code 1681, Section 602 ( a ) : Under Section 602 ( a ) of the FCRA, I have the right to privacy with regard to my credit information. Synchrony Bank has violated this right by improperly disclosing or mishandling my personal financial information without my consent.

Prohibition on Furnishing Account Information Without Written Consent - 15 U.S. Code 1681, Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) : Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) of the FCRA clearly states that no consumer reporting agency may furnish my account information to third parties without my written authorization. Synchrony Bank has violated this provision by providing my account information to third parties without my express written consent. 

Exclusion of Certain Types of Information - 15 U.S. Code 1681a : According to Section 1681a, a consumer report does not include information solely related to transactions or experiences between a consumer and the entity making the report. Synchrony Bank appears to be reporting this type of information in my credit file, which is in direct violation of the statute. 

Late Payment Reporting Prohibited - 15 U.S. Code 1666b : Section 1666b prohibits a creditor from reporting a payment on an open-end consumer credit account as late unless the payment is genuinely overdue. Synchrony Bank has incorrectly reported a payment as late on my account, violating this provision. 

IRS Guidelines ( XXXX ) - Requirement for Issuing Form XXXX for Canceled Debt : IRS Guidelines XXXX XXXX ) define canceled debt as gross income and require the issuance of a Form 1099-C for any canceled debt. If my debt has been written off, Synchrony Bank has failed to issue this form, which is a violation of the Internal Revenue Code and further complicates the inaccuracies in your reporting. 

Unauthorized Use of Personal Information in Securities and Trading It has come to my attention that Synchrony Bank continues to use my personal financial information in securities, stocks, and other trade instruments, including securitization of accounts. This activity has been conducted without my consent or knowledge, and no portion of any profits generated has been returned to me. 

Per Synchrony 's filings and the continuous trade of my information until maturity, I assert that I, as the rightful owner of this personal data and associated rights, hereby claim all rights, title, and interest to the profits generated by such activities. These profits must be delivered back to me, or alternatively, I demand that you provide an open-ended credit card that will allow me to access these profits for my own financial gain. 

Failure to provide a remedy will result in a full securitization audit of your entire accounting ledger. This will include a review of all transactions, trades, and uses of my personal information. If Synchrony Bank has not disclosed these practices fully or transparently, this may result in further legal actions and penalties.

Legal Grounds for Demand and Remedies GAAP Accounting Standards : Under Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ), companies are required to disclose the use and profitability of assets, including securitized accounts and personal information. If Synchrony Bank has been using my personal data as an asset in these transactions, you are required to disclose such actions and allocate profits to the rightful owner ( me ). Failure to do so violates GAAP, specifically the principles of disclosure and revenue recognition.

Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : Under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), creditors are required to disclose all terms of credit, including any financial instruments or practices involving securitization of accounts and the use of consumer data. Synchrony Bank has failed to disclose this information adequately and transparently. This is a direct violation of the TILA, and I demand full transparency regarding any securities, investments, or other financial activities involving my personal data. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) : The Court ruled that a consumer 's personal data is an asset, and any misuse or improper reporting can be grounds for damages, including emotional distress and punitive damages under the FCRA. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : The Court confirmed that the unauthorized use of personal data, especially in the context of securities and trading, constitutes a violation of privacy rights and may subject a company to both civil liability and damages. 

Immediate Actions Required Given the violations outlined above, I am requesting that Synchrony Bank take the following actions : Immediate Correction of Inaccurate Information : Correct all inaccuracies reported to the credit bureaus regarding my account, including the removal of any late payment markings that were incorrectly applied to my account. 

Issue a 1099-C Form : If any portion of my debt has been canceled, you are required by law to issue a Form 1099-C, reporting the canceled debt as gross income, as per IRS Guidelines ( XXXX ). 

Reinstatement of Privacy : Take immediate action to ensure that my personal data is no longer used for securities or trading without my consent and that any profits generated are returned to me or made available for my financial gain.

Full Disclosure : Provide full transparency regarding the use of my personal data in securities or stock trades and furnish a securitization audit if necessary. If no profits have been shared with me, I demand an open-ended credit card to access any potential profits derived from these activities.

Deadline for Resolution Please correct the inaccurate information, provide the requested documentation, and comply with my demands within 15 days of receiving this letter. Failure to do so will result in my filing complaints with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), SEC and pursuing legal action, including seeking damages under the FCRA, GAAP accounting rules, TILA, and the relevant Supreme Court cases.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Navy Federal Credit Union XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Reporting Request for Removal, 1099-C Issuance, and Cease-and-Desist Notice Account Number : 1. XXXX - NAVY FEDERAL CR UNION - DATE OPENED XXXX XXXX. XXXX - NAVY FEDERAL CR UNION - DATE OPENED XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of the above-referenced account and to demand immediate corrective action pursuant to federal consumer protection laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq. 

1. Dispute of Account Reporting This account has been reported as written off as a profit/loss ( charge-off ). However, I have identified that the account is being repeatedly reported as a new charge-off account with an outstanding balance, despite being previously written off. This constitutes inaccurate and misleading reporting in violation of the FCRA, specifically : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Duty to ensure maximum possible accuracy of information. 
15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Duty to investigate disputes regarding furnished information.

By continuing to report this account inaccurately, Navy Federal Credit Union is damaging my creditworthiness, resulting in defamation of character and material harm to my financial reputation.

2. Request for 1099-C Issuance As the account has been charged off, I am requesting that you provide a copy of the IRS Form 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ). The issuance of this form is required when a debt is canceled or written off and no longer collectible. Failure to provide the required documentation further demonstrates non-compliance with applicable consumer protection laws.

3. Cease-and-Desist Notification Under the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), this letter serves as a formal cease-and-desist notice regarding all collection efforts related to this account. You are instructed to cease all forms of communication with me, including but not limited to phone calls, emails, or letters, regarding this account.

4. Demand for Resolution To resolve this matter, I demand the following actions be taken within 30 days : Immediately correct and remove the inaccurate information from all credit reporting agencies.

Provide a copy of the IRS Form 1099-C for the cancellation of this account, if applicable. 
Confirm in writing that you have ceased all collection activities and communications related to this account. 

Sincerly, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
on XX/XX/year> I was contacted by someone from the doctor 's office I was going to be seeing in the future for a consultation for a procedure. This person was very pushy and was selling on a promotion for up to 50 % off if they check to see what I qualify for. I informed him that I had already check and was qualified for another card. I figured it could not hurt if they just check since I already know I qualify for the other card. I all of a sudden feel a lot of pressure to get the XXXX scheduled now so that I can save money. That the XXXX schedule was filling up fast so I needed to act. It was a very high pressure sell that I immediately regretted. Here I was signing up for a procedure before even having any consultation. 

The initial consultation was scheduled for XX/XX/year> and I had the XXXX scheduled for XX/XX/year> that was made on XX/XX/year> on that phone call with the solicitor from the doctor 's office. This meant that I was now scheduled for a procedure in 3 weeks when I hadn't even had my first consultation. I had scheduled consultations with 3 doctors so that way I was confident I made the right decision. I immediately contacted the doctor 's office to let them know that I did not want to move forward with the procedure. 

That I felt it was a very high pressure sale designed to get me locked into a contract. I immediately wrote them a termination of contract letter based on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Code Sec. XXXX using my statutory right to terminate the contract and get a full refund for services not rendered. I sent this via certified mail within the time allowed by Texas law. In short, I disputed the {$7800.00} charge on my credit card because I terminated the contract in a legal manner based on the manner of how credit was extended to fund this purchase. 

XXXX, part of Comenity Capital Bank, has a policy that if you are not satisfied with the services then I many not be held financially responsible for the remaining balance. I informed them that I was indeed not satisfied and wanted a full refund. The doctor 's office agreed to refund {$5800.00} after telling me that I would not get a refund if I did not remove any complaints about the doctor 's office. I am not satisfied with them wanting me to pay the remaining balance when I canceled the contract and never received any services.

Consumer complaint narrative: I used the Synchrony pay later option during checkout with the lowesXXXX order for a washer and dryer. Upon completion of the order, there was an issue on Lowes end with the delivery method for the dryer, so they had to change the order to ensure that both the washer and dryer will be delivered together. When I made those changes I had to reapply with the Synchrony pay later feature and pay an additional deposit, I hadnt already paid a deposit for both the washer and dryer on the first order. Now the two accounts are separated one account for the washer and one account for the dryer. I paid an original deposit for the set of washer and dryer and during the delivery mixup I had to pay another deposit for the dryer again and they couldnt fix that. So I paid {$190.00} for the deposit on the set and then an additional deposit of {$99.00} for the dryer order due to the error. The orders should not be over {$86.00} per month over a 12 month period for the purchases. However, the washer account has a monthly payment of {$160.00} as if im paying for the set, and the dryer account has a payment due of {$86.00}. Synchrony told me I had to pay the {$160.00} even though I didnt borrow the amount reflected on rhe washer account, even though I would no longer be paying a monthly payment over 12 months at the rate of {$160.00} per month. They told me to still pay that amount to avoid adversities on my credit, as of now they still have not fixed the loan account documentation to reflect the actual amount borrowed to correct the payments over a 12 month timeline and instead they have charged me late fees, additional interest, and they have yet to rectify the account to reflect what I actually borrowed, even after me calling and speaking with a manager. They said it was an issue that their back office has to correct and its been a month and theyve yet to do so.

Product: Credit card
Sub-issue: Credit card company won't work with you while you're going through financial hardship
Consumer complaint narrative:
Ive had the card for almost two years and began making late payments about 5 months ago. After the second or third late payment, the credit card company closed the credit card citing ridiculous explanations. When I called to try and have the payments lowered and late fees waived they declined and I continued to make payments on the card anyway. The card is closed and unable for me to make anymore purchases on top of them lowering the limit prior to closing the card ; however, they have the card marked as open on my credit profiles so that they can mark derogatory payment information. 

I just this month went over 30 days late payment for the first time and they marked it as derogatory on my credit. This is fraudulent information because companies are not allowed to mark late payments on closed accounts meanwhile deceptively reporting the card as open.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Lender filed on my credit report that I was late when I was in active Loss Mitigation with them. Their fraudulent filing of my account status occurred after I followed all of their requests to the letter post Hurricane disaster declaration in Florida, as of XX/XX/XXXX when I filed a request with XXXX XXXX ( VA Loan Servicer ) for Hurricane Relief after Hurricane Idalia hit our area and disaster declared by state FL. I was granted 6 months of payments relief with understanding of sending updated information to Lender/servicer of personal financials and did so 5 times from XX/XX/XXXX- XX/XX/XXXX. Lender deleted my account portal information from their system twice during this time and in turn claimed in XX/XX/XXXX I was not on active Loss Mitigation status after XX/XX/XXXX. However that is untrue and I have the phone call records, portal copies of my uploads of compliant information they needed to rebuild their records however to date XXXX Loss Mitigation department continues to deny they made multiple errors by filing my loan to be late as of XX/XX/XXXX. I paid the full amount due in XX/XX/XXXX in question for the Loss Mitigation status period of time from XX/XX/XXXX to the last submission of my personal information to XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX. Again I have a record of all correspondences sent to the lender portal on the line, a record of all those files sent, a record of who I spoke to each time I spoke to the Loss Mitigation department on the phone. XX/XX/XXXX I received a call from VA representative asking if I was working through the information needed to get my loan caught up through adding on the Loss Mitigation period of time to my loan balance. They claimed they had not heard from XXXXXXXX XXXX with the facts and asked that I send them an email outline which I did. I then sent financial information to XXXX just as XXXX asked me to do the first time being XX/XX/XXXX. 
I requested a review from XXXXXXXX XXXX customer service 7 times in XXXX so far, told them their information is incorrect to file on my credit report in XX/XX/XXXX that I was late, when in fact I was declared by their own staff I was in Loss Mitigation and no late payment reporting would occur. I submitted my personal information through the portal on the line with XXXXXXXX XXXX  5 times. Each time I submitted the requested information from the lender I would receive a phone call approximately 1 week later telling me they are working on my file. I would also receive a mailing in the same time frame they are actively working on my file for Loss Mitigation. As of XX/XX/XXXX roughly 3 months into the relief time period of months I was given I began sending updated financials to the lender showing all of the details they needed to allow me to add a balance of missed payments from during Loss Mitigation to the back side of my loan balance. That is what was offered and that is what I was working towards. After that phone call from the VA rep XXXXXXXX XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX I made sure i was to follow all requests to the letter by the book so this would stay on track and the relief I sought be resolved properly. 
However, after sending my details to the lender 5 times submitted, following all instructions, waiting for the lender to make decisions if they would allow me to add a balance to the backside of my loan, they came up with an offer that would not work for my existing loan of which I already had for 10 years of the 30 year term paid down. 
It was XX/XX/XXXX I received a less than valid offer to change my interest rate and get hammered by even higher loan rates than I would be comfortable with. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I called XXXX Loss Mitigation again for what would be the 10th time I spoke to them on the phone and let them know their offer was no good and I would pay the remaining 3 months off from the Loss Mitigation period of time by no later than XX/XX/XXXX XXXX.I paid the loan current on the date agreed and received confirmation from XXXX they received my funds and credited the account as agreed. I was told Loss Mitigation is over and went on my way making payments as was normal for me to do. You see I began paying the loan on time again as I agreed to do with XXXX XXXX starting in XXXX XXXX when they continued to agree with Loss Mitigation , I would submit the information they requested from me, I spoke with XXXX Loss Mitigation and customer service at least 5 times from XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX regarding keeping the payments to restart around XX/XX/XXXX while I was in active Loss Mitigation. I wanted to make sure I stayed in touch and informed so my file would stay current and I asked many times that my credit is not going to be given any late fee notes etc. while we worked through the process ; to which I was assured I would not receive late notices, no late penalties and no late fees. In turn I began all information submissions as XXXX  requested, and I restarted payments in XXXX which was 2 months earlier than the 6 months I was granted of payment forgiveness/forbearance as they agreed to allow me during the Hurricane Relief act. 
However little did I know that XXXX filed my Loss Mitigation request as a Covid Relief Act request ; which it clearly was not and when I found that out from their customer service in XX/XX/XXXX I immediately demanded they fix the record to show I was in the post Hurricane Idalia Relief Loss Mitigation program ; NOT a Covid relief. That was the first time I realized something did not seem right about XXXXXXXX XXXX and their apparent lack of integrity. I began making regular monthly mortgage payments again as stated in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX which XXXX happily accepted my money over the phone via call-in payments as they requested. 
I have all the documents of all the correspondences from and to XXXXXXXX XXXX and VA rep XXXX XXXX whom I made aware of my problems with XXXX again in XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX because I did not want my mortgage to be at risk nor my exemplary credit rating of XXXX in the same time period we are talking about. 
I received the new financing offer from XXXXXXXX XXXX to subjugate my mortgage balance to add the three Loss Mitigation months of payments remained due as of when I restarted making the regular monthly payments as stated above in XXXX XXXX. The offer was horrible and contained additional fees and a terrible interest rate I was in no way going to agree to. As stated above I called them within 5 days of receiving the letter and told their team I would be paying the past Loss Mitigation period payments off XXXX XX/XX/XXXX as stated and I did so. 
All the while I was making the payments from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX and I was told each time I called in the payments that my loan is reported as been paid on time and all was good. The entire time I relied on the statements from XXXX XXXX  staff members as stated above. As well I received many continued requests for information of my financial details which I repeatedly agreed to do and provided to the staff immediately upon receiving their requests. 
The problem comes in that also in XX/XX/XXXX when XXXX took it upon themselves to file three credit report updates stating my loan was 150 days late, 120 days late, 30 days late then not late all within 2 weeks of one another. My Experian credit monitoring report shows all these details, I have tried a half dozen times to get XXXX to fix this. I have called their teams, I have sent them 12 messages through the portal on my account profile and they continue to refuse to fix their mistakes. The key proving that XXXX XXXX  is not only liable for filing fraudulent account statuses during their agreement I was in active Loss Mitigation, is the fact they removed my online portal access twice during the Loss mitigation period, deleted 4 months worth of messages from my profile where they received my financial details, they agreed to me sending this information through their portal as that is where they requested it since it is secure comm 's for this purpose of sending them my personal financial details. I have screen shots of my missing communications from their website portal, they deny any wrongdoing and they deny they deleted my files. However, the proof they received my files when I sent them is because their system auto generates an account email to state " we have received your message ( XXXX ) '' and this is their request to send them the information the was I was sending it to them. 
The damage has been done to my credit rating as soon as XXXX filed their fraudulent statement of my account status after I paid them the Loss Mitigation amounts. My rating went from XXXX as I said above to roughly XXXX, and on the day they filed the experian report on my credit my score dropped at that moment XXXX points alone on that one day, then dropped again when they failed to update it correctly and allowing my account to get hammered and score dropped like a rock as I said. 
In XXXX if I had known that XXXX would intentionally have done this fraudulent filing of which affected my credit score as it did described herein I would not have been so nice to their staff as I have been since that time demanding they fix their incorrect filings and get my record straightened out rather than allow it reported late of 150 days within two weeks of my paying the account Loss Mitigation time period payments up to date. Why would I have agreed to allow them to do this, I wouldn't that is what the issue is. They did this after I paid them up from this forbearance period of time. Why else would their system continue to ask me for information and why would I receive their correspondence during the time frame I was told I was in Loss Mitigation status and my loan would not be reported late at all. But the proof is they would not arbitrarily send me this type correspondence had they not been receiving my details over and over each time they received my updated financials. Why else would they allow Loss Mitigation to continue to occur if they were not receiving my information, why else would I have 12 phone calls with their staff and the VA rep XXXXXXXX XXXX if I weren't in active Loss Mitigation? The answer is simple and it's XXXX XXXXXXXX lying about my Payments status, my Loss Mitigation Status, lying to me about deleting my account portal documents and details I sent them from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX. As soon as I found this file information was missing from my portal, I immediately contacted them and told them it was missing and they needed to get it put back on my account because it is the proof I was complying with all requests. 
The further proof I can prove XXXX XXXX is scheming and lying about this is why else would they have continued to send me documents requests I updated my files with based on their received information on the portal, but they then scrubbed the portal of the information and files I sent them during this time. They still ahve the time prior to XX/XX/XXXX and after XX/XX/XXXX on my portal dashboard which includes all of my requests they need to fix my credit reporting and also that I agreed to pay up the Loss Mitigation period of time payments. They scrubbed this information from the portal only when I sent them a request to answer why they suddenly reported my loan 150 days late a month after I paid them up to date on the Loss Mitigation amount due. Paid up and followed their every demand, their staff answered me each time I spoke to them and said my account was in Loss Mitigation status, was not being reported late. I have all of these documents, and all of these details in hand. 
I have warned XXXXXXXX XXXX via secure messaging on the portal since XXXX more than enough times and they claim they are not changing their credit reporting even after they were told they filed the Covid relief incorrectly, and all other things incorrectly. That is why I think they scrubbed the messaging file of my data for those months in question because they fraudulently collected Covid funds on my behalf and that can be a problem for them. 
I would hate to file a fraud claim against XXXX XXXX with the FBI for wire fraud but I will do so as I am well aware of my rights against this malpractice they are guilty of doing to me and costing my credit score to be damaged in dramatic fashion as I have stated. 
All of these statements have the paperwork to back them up, and I have warned XXXXXXXX XXXX  staff I was going to proceed with this claim because they offer me no other alternative to get my credit reporting corrected. 
This is the second instance of a fatal error on my account by XXXXXXXX XXXX when they took over servicing my mortgage in XX/XX/XXXX from XXXXXXXX XXXX. XXXX failed to timely pay my property flood insurance policy in XX/XX/XXXX even after they were warned they needed to send the remittance, when my agent reached out to them, they have the calling records to prove it, and the email threads with XXXXXXXX XXXX Insurance department personnel as proof. When this occurred the missed payments caused my flood insurance to lapse ( my insurance is escrowed in my payments ), and turn my policy with its grandfathered parameters was then cancelled and I received a 3 times more expensive flood insurance policy from the same carrier because XXXXXXXX XXXX made these mistakes and we have the proof of all of these details as well. 
To date XXXXXXXX XXXX has cost me more than XXXX credit points on my credit rating, and cost me more than {$5000.00} per year in additional insurance costs due to them not paying my premiums on time for renewal as of XX/XX/XXXX caused the policy to lapse even after being warned repeatedly by my insurance agents, and also by my phone calls to their customer service department. This again has not been mitigated by XXXXXXXX XXXX nor will they do anything about it. I have a feeling they need to be sued to get them to respond to all of this with an effective solution. 
I feel they are dismissing my rights, misrepresenting my credit worthiness by not correcting my personal credit file ( also the same issue on my wife 's credit reporting has been done and her score dropped just the same at the same exact times as stated above ). I want XXXXXXXX XXXX to be investigated fully, as I can only imagine they have done this same thing to others along the way. The problem I have with changing to another lender is my loan interest rate is 3.5 % and you know I can not get that rate any longer. 
Please help me, please get the lender to fix my credit reporting, have them fix my customer account portal and return all of my files and information promptly, go back review their files for missed payments on my flood insurance policy from XXXX and make it right to fix all of their mistakes on my account information promptly. I will hold off filing a fraudulent inducement, and wire fraud complaint against them with the FBI pending the outcome of your investigation. 
Many thanks, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: Dispute Reason : Inaccuracy, do not own Dispute Instructions : Please delete immediately Dispute Reason : lack verification of debt, inaccuracies, do not own Account Name : nationwide capital S Account # : XXXX Please delete all of this immediately Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 USC 1681G I have the right to demand that you disclose to me all of the documents that you have recorded and retained in your file at the time of this request concerning the accounts that you are reporting on my credit report. Send me copies of the documents that you have in your files that were used to verify them. If you do not have any documentation in your files to verify the accuracy of these disputed accounts then please delete them immediately as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( 1 ). By publishing these inaccurate and unverified items on my credit report and distributing them to 3rd parties you are damaging my reputation and credit worthiness. Under the FCRA 15 USC 1681i all unverified accounts must be promptly deleted.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear ( Debt Collector ) ecently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you ha intacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming th Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor. 
2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed. 
3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor 4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt. 
5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor. 
Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 
Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 
Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so. 
Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, FL XXXX XX/XX/XXXX To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
TransUnion LLC Subject : Urgent Demand for Removal of Unauthorized Accounts and Violations of Federal Law XXXX  has demonstrated a clear failure to maintain consistency and transparency in its handling of your dispute, further compounding the harm caused by its already unlawful practices. On one hand, XXXX sent written correspondence stating that your disputes were deemed frivolous because they were previously verified or lacked new relevant information. Yet, when you called XXXX representatives, they contradicted this claim by asserting that the FTC report you submitted, along with other supporting documents, was invalid or not reflected in their system. This blatant inconsistency in communication highlights systemic negligence, internal disorganization, and possibly intentional efforts to delay or obstruct dispute resolution. 

Key Issues with XXXX Contradictions 1. Misleading Written Statements : The letter implied that your disputes were frivolous, suggesting there was no new information to warrant further investigation. However, the supporting documentation you submitted, including proof of identification, proof of address, and the FTC Identity Theft Report, satisfies the requirements under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 for blocking disputed items. 
2. Disregard of Submitted Documents : XXXX  claim during your phone call that the FTC report was invalid reflects either a failure to properly process submitted documents or intentional misrepresentation of its obligations under federal law. 
XXXX. Obstruction of Consumer Rights : The conflicting statements prevent you from effectively resolving the dispute and exercising your rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). By sending contradictory information, XXXX undermines its obligation to provide a clear and efficient dispute resolution process. 
4. Possible Profit-Driven Motives : The delays caused by these contradictory statements may be a tactic to continue profiting from unauthorized or inaccurate information on your credit report, as credit reporting agencies often benefit financially from retaining more data on consumers. 
5. Violation of FCRA Procedures : According to 15 U.S.C. 1681i, XXXX must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information and can not arbitrarily declare disputes frivolous, especially when documentation is provided. 

Legal and Regulatory Implications 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : XXXX must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information on your credit report. Failing to process valid disputes and providing contradictory information violates this mandate. 
15 U.S.C. 1681n : Willful noncompliance with the FCRA exposes XXXX to statutory, actual, and punitive damages. 
Section 5 ( a ) of the FTC Act : Misleading consumers through contradictory communication may constitute unfair and deceptive practices, subject to enforcement by the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ). 
Consumer Financial Protection Act ( 12 U.S.C. 5536 ) : XXXX actions may violate the prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices ( UDAAP ). 

Demand for Accountability XXXX  inability to provide consistent and accurate information underscores a broader systemic failure within its dispute resolution processes. I will not tolerate the continued violation of my rights. Your contradictory communications must be resolved, and the following actions must be taken immediately : 1. Remove all unauthorized accounts and information in compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2.

2. Provide a written explanation reconciling the discrepancies between your written and verbal statements.

3. Implement internal compliance measures to prevent similar occurrences in the future. 





To Whom It May Concern, This formal complaint demands the immediate removal of unauthorized accounts and inaccurate information from my consumer report. Despite my compliance with all legal requirements under FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( Section 605C2 ), these accounts remain unlawfully reported. Furthermore, I have IRS-confirmed evidence of Form 1099-C cancellation for the debts associated with these accounts, proving they are no longer valid or collectible. 
The fact that these canceled accounts remain on my report, despite their resolution with the IRS, demonstrates not only your noncompliance with federal law but also a potential fraudulent financial intent. If these items are not promptly removed, I reserve the right to report your continued actions to the IRS under their whistleblower program, as the profit gained from unauthorized reporting constitutes tax fraud and abuse. 
Accounts to Be Removed Immediately : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  : Account XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Account XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX : Account XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX : Account XXXX XXXX. XXXXXXXX XXXX : Account XXXX Violations of Federal Law and Additional Actions : 1. FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 : All disputed information must be blocked within four ( 4 ) business days upon submission of proper documentation. Despite fulfilling all requirements, including FTC Identity Theft Report, identification, and proof of address, these accounts remain unblocked.

2. IRS Reporting Requirements : The debts associated with the accounts above have been canceled via Form 1099-C and accepted by the IRS. Continuing to report these accounts as valid debts constitutes a misrepresentation of their status. Additionally, this behavior indicates potential violations of tax laws if these debts are used for financial gain or inaccurate reporting purposes.

3. Fraudulent Intent and Misrepresentation : By retaining and profiting from inaccurate and unauthorized information, your actions may violate 18 U.S.C. 1962 ( RICO ) and 18 U.S.C. 894 ( Extortionate Credit Practices ).

4. Whistleblower and Audit Risk : If this noncompliance persists, I will report your activities to the IRS for further investigation and audit. The whistleblower program rewards accurate reporting of tax fraud and abuse, which includes the exploitation of consumer data for monetary gain.

5. Breach of Consumer Rights : Your failure to remove canceled debts constitutes ongoing harm to my financial reputation, with severe consequences for your compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681b and Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act protections. 
Immediate Demands : 1. Immediate Removal of All Accounts Listed : All canceled debts and unauthorized accounts must be removed from my credit report within seven ( 7 ) business days of receiving this notice. 
2. Written Confirmation of Compliance : Provide written confirmation that these accounts have been permanently removed and will not be re-reported. 
3. IRS Whistleblower Avoidance : Take corrective action immediately to avoid being reported for fraudulent financial practices and unauthorized profit from canceled debts. 
Conclusion : XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX continued failure to comply with federal law is a direct attack on my financial stability and consumer rights. I have met all requirements under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, and the additional inclusion of 1099-C evidence further cements that these accounts have no basis for continued reporting. 
This is your final opportunity to resolve this matter. Failure to comply will result in further escalations, including filing whistleblower complaints with the IRS and pursuing legal remedies for damages under the FCRA, CFPB regulations, and RICO statutes.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom it May Concern ; This is in reference to the Consumer Report sent by your Company via mail dated XXXX, XXXX. While checking the above report, it came to my notice that your Company has furnished an account on my report. 

According to 15 USC 1692a ( 2 ), the term Communication means the conveying of informa- tion regarding a debt directly or indirectly to any person through any medium.

As per the literal interpretation Any medium includes any oral, written, electronic, or other medium. Therefore, furnishing of the Consumer Report ( bearing information regarding the al- leged debt ) by the Company will amount to Communication as per Fair Debt Collection Prac- tices Act ( FDCPA ).

Pursuant to my rights as per 15 USC 1692c ( c ) I am hereby providing you formal notice to cease any further communications regarding this account immediately. This includes but not limited to telephone calls, emails, social media, or any Consumer Reporting Agency. 

Any further contact by your Agent or Company, except a communication confirming your ac- knowledgment of this letter, is in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

If you do not cease communication with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX because there is no FEDERAL OR GOVERNMENT LAW STATING IT IS MANDATORY TO TALK TO A THIRD PARTY a lawsuit will be commenced against you.Remove this account from my consumer report asap

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint regarding inaccuracies on my credit report related to the Capital One account ( Account XXXX XXXX ). Despite my disputes, these errors remain unresolved, causing harm to my credit profile and financial stability. The details of the inaccuracies and violations are outlined below : Inaccuracies Identified : Payment Status : The account is listed as Collection/Charge-off, with a past due amount of {$2900.00}, even though the account shows a closed date of XX/XX/XXXX. 
The account status should not reflect ongoing derogatory reporting for a balance that was charged off over four years ago. 
Discrepancy in Reporting Date : The date of last activity is listed as XX/XX/XXXX, but the last payment date is shown as XX/XX/XXXX, which is inconsistent and impossible. 
This discrepancy violates the requirement for accurate and consistent reporting under the FCRA. 
Balance Owed and Payment Amount : The balance owed is reported as {$2900.00}, yet the payment amount is listed as {$0.00}, indicating no payment activity.

FCRA Violations : Failure to Report Accurate Information ( 607 ( b ) ) : Credit reporting agencies must ensure maximum possible accuracy. The conflicting dates and payment status indicate a failure to meet this obligation. 
Failure to Correct Errors After Dispute ( 611 ) : Despite my previous disputes, the inaccuracies remain unresolved, violating the FCRA requirement to correct or delete inaccurate information within 30 days. 
Supporting Evidence : I have documentation, including dispute letters and proof of delivery, that demonstrate my attempts to resolve these errors. 

Requested Action : Deletion of the Capital One account due to the conflicting information and unresolved inaccuracies. 
Correction of all reporting discrepancies to ensure compliance with the FCRA. 
These inaccuracies are significantly impacting my creditworthiness and financial goals. I request immediate investigation and resolution. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am filing a complaint against IC System XXXX for improperly reporting a fraudulent medical debt to credit bureaus and failing to contact me or verify the accuracy of the debt before sending it to collections. I believe their actions violate fair debt collection practices and have caused undue harm to my credit. 

Details of the Complaint Debt Collection Account : IC System XXXX opened a collection account on my credit on XX/XX/year>, for a medical debt. The agency never contacted me by mail, email, or telephone before reporting the debt to the credit bureaus, despite having all my correct contact information. 

Inaccurate XXXX XXXX : The amount reported by IC System XXXX does not match the amount billed by the medical provider. The collection agency admitted they did not verify the accuracy of the debt before sending it to collections. They stated that they don't have a copy of the bill for review. 

Underlying XXXX XXXX XXXX The medical debt in question arises from fraudulent billing practices by the medical provider, including : - Billing for unauthorized services that my PCP never ordered. 
- Billing for services not rendered or performed. 
- Billing for unnecessary services. 
- Bill for unbundling ( e.g., splitting services into separate bills to inflate costs ). 
- Falsifying my medical records to support unnecessary charges. 

Concerns of XXXX fraud at XXXX Imaging Specialists ( XXXX XXXX, CA ) : My PCP ordered XXXX ultrasound and one preventative mammogram but the radiologist, XXXX XXXX, billed for XXXX services in a single visit. For example, radiologist billed for a sonogram that was unauthorized and unnecessary, in addition to the authorized ultrasound that came out negative. Radiologist charged for a diagnostic mammogram in addition to the preventative mammogram for the same XXXX during the same visit. She billed me for the preventative mammogram by using unauthorized codes to inflate the bill. She created a second, false bill by alleging a second visit, which never occurred. She falsified my medical record to support her unauthorized services, by claiming that she found a suspicious lump. However, my PCP examined my XXXX after her report, and found that there was no XXXX lump of any kind. The medical provider has refused to correct the bill and has threatened to double the amount if unpaid, a practice I believe is illegal. This provider is currently under FBI investigation, with over XXXX other patients reporting similar fraudulent schemes. 

Impact on My Credit : The medical debt was reported to credit bureaus without my knowledge and began affecting my XXXX XXXX before I was notified. 

IC System XXXX failed to : - Verify the debt with the medical provider to ensure it was accurate or legitimate. 
- Attempt to contact me before or after reporting the debt. 
- When I contacted IC System XXXX, they confirmed they lacked a copy of the bill and had not verified its accuracy. Their failure to follow proper procedures has compounded the harm caused by the fraudulent medical provider.

I informed them I did not owe them a debt and refused to pay them, that I never signed a contract with them, and citing15 USC 1c92c ( if a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer ). Putting anything on my credit report is a form of communication and is a violation of the law. I sent XXXX a copy of the letter ( along with identity verification ), and citXXXXd 15 USC 1692c as well as 15 USC 1681 ( a ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. I also requested documentation from them to show they were allowed to work in the state of North Carolina since they are out of state. The violations on my credit report is from the following agency : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
To : XXXX, XXXX and TransUnion I am writing to formally address the ongoing inaccuracies and reporting violations on my credit reports. Despite my previous attempts to resolve these issues, the inaccurate information remains, and the credit bureaus have failed to respond appropriately. The continued inaction and false reporting of my personal information are direct violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other applicable federal and state laws. 

Accounts to be Corrected : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) The inaccurate information reported by XXXX on my credit report, including incorrect account status, balances, or any other erroneous reporting, must be corrected. If this account has been reported as open or active while it is closed, or if there are any discrepancies with the dates and balance reported, this must be corrected immediately. 

XXXX XXXX  Similarly XXXX XXXX XXXX  has reported inaccurate information on my credit file. This includes any incorrect account status or outstanding balances that do not reflect the actual state of the account. The account status, dates, and balances reported by XXXX XXXX  must be verified and corrected immediately. 

Unauthorized Hard Inquiries Additionally, I have noticed multiple unauthorized hard inquiries that were made to my credit report without my consent. According to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( c ), no one may obtain a credit report or perform a hard inquiry without my written consent. These inquiries need to be removed immediately as they were made in violation of my rights under the FCRA.

Legal Violations : Failure to Correct Inaccurate Information - 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ) : Under 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ), you are required to investigate and correct any inaccuracies in my credit report upon receiving a dispute. Despite my prior notifications, the inaccuracies remain uncorrected, violating this provision.

Failure to Provide Results of Investigation - 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( i ) : 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( i ) mandates that you conduct a reasonable investigation upon receiving notice of a dispute and provide the results of that investigation. The continued reporting of false information after I have disputed it is a violation of this statute.

Violation of Consumer Protection Laws- HJR 192, REMED, 1099C & 1099A : The HJR 192 REMED resolution and the 1099C and 1099A guidelines require that if a debt is written off or canceled, it must be reported as such, and a 1099-C form should be issued. I have never received such documentation, and the reporting of this debt as active is a clear violation of these rules.

Failure to Remove Inaccurate Information - FCRA Section 611 ( AX1 ) and FCRA Section 605 ( c ) : FCRA Section 611 ( AX1 ) requires the removal of inaccurate or unverifiable information upon investigation. Furthermore, FCRA Section 605 ( c ) restricts the reporting of certain negative information beyond a specific timeframe, and your continued reporting of this account is in violation of this limitation.

Right to Rescind Credit Transactions- 15 U.S. Code 1635 : According to 15 U.S. Code 1635, I have the right to rescind credit transactions under specific circumstances. The continued erroneous reporting of my credit history disregards this right, particularly regarding debts that may be canceled or rescinded.

Debt Collection Violations- 15 U.S. Code 1692 : Under 15 U.S. Code 1692, debt collectors are prohibited from reporting false or misleading information to credit reporting agencies. The account being reported on my credit file is inaccurate, and there has been no action taken to rectify this violation.

Errors in Credit Report : I find that the following information provided on my credit report is an error. This account was never late or owed any amount ( pursuant to HJR 192 REMED ). You are alleging that I owe a debt without furnishing any proof of this debt, including a full accounting ledger or proof of any 1099s that were filed on behalf of my principal. You have failed to demonstrate that you have followed all relevant laws and regulations for reporting this debt.

Therefore, you must remove this account from my credit report immediately.

It is against the law to report any information that has not been proven accurate. Under Georgia law, including provisions found in Georgia Code Title 7 - Banking and Finance, and under relevant statutes such as Georgias Fair Business Practices Act ( FBPA ), a deficiency claim can not be asserted unless all required notices were properly and timely given, and all allowable redemption and cure time limits were adhered to.

Additionally, as outlined in the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are required to adhere to the following provisions : 15 U.S.C. 1692a ( 1-7 ) : Definitions and regulations governing what constitutes fair and unfair practices in debt collection.

15 U.S.C. 1692e ( 1-12 ) : Prohibits false or misleading representations in connection with debt collection.

15 U.S.C. 1692g ( a-c ) : Requires validation of debts upon request, including the provision of evidence supporting any alleged debt.

15 U.S.C. 1666 : Governs billing errors and prohibits creditors from imposing unauthorized fees.

15 U.S.C. 1681 ( a ) : Requires accurate reporting of information and protection of consumer privacy.

Supreme Court Cases : TransUnion LLC XXXX XXXX, 141 S. Ct. 2190 ( 2021 ) : The U.S. Supreme Court in TransUnion LLC XXXX XXXX emphasized that a consumer reporting agency must ensure the accuracy and reliability of the information it provides to others. If the information being reported is inaccurate, the consumer has the right to dispute and seek correction. This case reinforces my right to challenge and have corrected any inaccuracies that are being reported about my credit file.

Spokeo , Inc. v. Robins, 136 S. Ct. 1540 ( 2016 ) : In Spokeo v. Robins, the Supreme Court held that a consumer must demonstrate a concrete injury in order to bring a claim under the FCRA. The Court made it clear that when a consumer 's personal information is misused, especially in ways that can harm their financial reputation, they are entitled to seek legal remedies. The inaccurate reporting and unauthorized hard inquiries on my credit report have caused harm, and I am entitled to seek remedies under these precedents.

Consequences of Non-Compliance : The alleged claim of a deficiency is null and void, and any continued collection activities or reporting of this invalid claim on my credit reports will be considered a violation of the FDCPA and FCRA.

If you fail to comply with the above requests, I reserve all rights to seek damages against all parties involved under applicable state, federal, and Georgia-specific remedies.

Legal Demand : Under the FCRA and Georgia law, you are required by law to ensure the accuracy of all information reported. The continued failure to correct these inaccuracies despite repeated notifications is a direct violation of federal consumer protection laws.

In addition to correcting the inaccuracies, I am entitled to damages under the FCRA, including actual damages, punitive damages up to {$1000.00}, and attorney fees. Moreover, I am entitled to damages for XXXX XXXX  in the amount of {$10000.00} due to the ongoing distress caused by the inaccurate reporting and the misuse of my personal information. 

Total Damages : Actual Damages : To be determined based on the impact this has had on my financial health. 

Punitive Damages : Up to {$1000.00} under the FCRA. 
Attorney Fees : To be determined. 
XXXX XXXX : {$10000.00} each for emotional distress caused by the continued reporting of inaccurate information, unauthorized use of my data, and the failure to correct these errors. 

Risk of Further Legal Claims : As a data furnishing company involved in the buying, selling, transferring, and securitizing accounts and personal information, you are privately profiting off my personal information. This practice not only increases the risk of data breaches but also raises concerns about identity theft. 

These activities expose you to the potential for legal claims due to mishandling consumer data and may place you at significant risk for further legal consequences. I want to make it clear that continuing these practices could expose you to claims related to past data breaches, identity theft, and violations of consumer protection laws.

If this situation is not resolved promptly, you may face additional claims for damages resulting from these violations.

Corrective Action Required : Immediate Removal of the inaccurate information from my credit reports, including the incorrect account status, dates, and balances on all three credit bureaus.

Verification of Debt : Provide proof that the reported debt is accurate, and if it is a written-off account, issue a 1099-C form as required.

Investigation Results : Provide written confirmation that a reasonable investigation has been conducted, and include the results of the investigation and any corrective actions taken.

Removal of Unauthorized Hard Inquiries : All unauthorized hard inquiries on my credit report must be immediately removed, as they were made without my written consent.

Deadline for Resolution : Please correct these errors and provide the requested documentation within 7 days of receipt of this letter. Failure to comply will leave me no choice but to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and pursue legal action to seek damages under the FCRA, Georgia law, and other applicable state and federal laws.

Conclusion : The continued reporting of these inaccuracies, failure to respond to my disputes, and the false reporting of my personal information have caused significant harm. I expect these issues to be addressed immediately, and I look forward to your prompt resolution of this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Dispute and Demand for Removal of Unauthorized/Inaccurate Credit Inquiries To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute and demand the removal of several credit inquiries listed on my credit report that are not attached to any open account and/or were not authorized by me. The presence of these inquiries violates my rights under federal law, specifically the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., which governs the permissible use and accuracy of consumer credit information. 

1. Violation of FCRA Inaccurate Credit Reporting The credit inquiries listed below are not connected to any open or active account, nor were they authorized in compliance with permissible purposes under : 15 U.S.C. 1681b : Permissible purposes of consumer reports. 
Credit inquiries should only appear on a consumers report if they were authorized or resulted from a transaction initiated by the consumer. Reporting unauthorized or inaccurate inquiries constitutes a violation of : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Duty to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer credit information. 
2. Credit Inquiries in Question The following inquiries are inaccurate and must be removed : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 3. Negative Impact on Credit Profile These inaccurate inquiries are unfairly affecting my credit score and overall creditworthiness, resulting in material harm to my financial reputation. 

4. Request for Immediate Removal of Disputed Inquiries To resolve this matter, I demand that your agency : Investigate and verify each disputed inquiry listed above. 
Immediately remove any inquiry that can not be verified as authorized or attached to an open account. 
Provide a written statement confirming the removal of these inquiries and an updated copy of my credit report reflecting the changes. 

5. Legal Consequences for Non-Compliance Failure to investigate and correct these inaccuracies within the time frame required by law ( 30 days ) may result in legal action to enforce my rights under the FCRA. I will not hesitate to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my states Attorney General if these inquiries are not promptly removed. 

XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation of the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against TRANSUNION regarding the inaccurate information reported in my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XXXX XX/XX/2024 of Credit Report, I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( s ) : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, high balance is reported differently in the credit agencies, date of last activity, last payment, and credit. 

Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, including : 1. Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation. 
2. Section 611 : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation. 
3. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : Removal of unverifiable information dont validated for creditor Original. 
4. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, TRANSUNION has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted on my creditworthiness. 
In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated 30-day period, as established in 15 U.S. Code 1681i. Additionally, I referenced 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Consumer complaint narrative:
After pulling a copy of my Consumer credit report I noticed that your agency is in multiple violations and Im entitled to monetary compensation under FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( c ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ) FURNISHING reports in connection with credit or insurance transactions that are not initiated by consumer ( Inquires ) - ( 1 ) In general A consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report relating to any consumer pursuant to subparagraph ( A ) or ( C ) of subsection ( a ) ( 3 ) in connection with any credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by the consumer only if ( A ) the consumer authorizes the agency to provide such report to such person or ( B ) ( i ) the transaction consists of a firm offer of credit or insurance.

( 3 ) INFORMATION regarding inquiries Except as provided in section 1681g ( a ) ( 5 ) of this title, a consumer reporting agency shall not furnish to any person a record of inquiries in connection with a credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by a consumer.

Under FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( b ) ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ( 2 ) such number of punitive damages as the court may allow.

I did not initiate any of these inquires furthermore if you feel like I did please send me copies of my written signature giving consent to this matter please.

The items below should all be removed from my consumer report under 15 US Code 1681 ( c ) ( XXXX ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( XXXX ). 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Under 15 US Code 1681n ( b ) civil liability of a natural person Ive been violated. Also, we already involved and sent this letter to the Complaint portal for ( Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, State Attorney Generals OfficeXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and Federal Trade Commission ).

This is an unfair system to be ignored and taken advantage of while plenty of laws are broken due to malpractice and the severity of not taking my situation seriously. Has caused Financial injury and defamation of character along with XXXX plus days of no response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Significant Credit Score Discrepancy Reported by TransUnion. 
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding an unresolved significant dip in my credit score as reported by TransUnion on XX/XX/year>. Despite maintaining excellent credit habits, my TransUnion credit score dropped by over XXXX points and has not been restored even after seven months. 

Details of the Issue : On XX/XX/year>, my TransUnion credit score dropped significantly from XXXX to XXXX. 
I have had no missed payments, no delinquent accounts, no significant changes in credit utilization ( which is at 0-1 % ), and no outstanding balances. 
My credit score with other bureaus remains stable and reflects my excellent credit habits. 
Despite multiple attempts to resolve this directly with TransUnion, I have been subjected to the " runaround '' and have not received a satisfactory explanation or resolution. 
This unexplained credit score drop is adversely impacting my financial reputation and may affect future financial opportunities. XXXX lack of response and resolution over a seven-month period is unacceptable. 

Supporting Documents : I have attached screenshots of my credit reports and scores from various platforms to demonstrate the discrepancy and consistency in my credit behavior.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 168b permissible purposes of consumer reports. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

These inquiry was not authorized Account Name : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXXXXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX has violated my rights. On a list of inquiries : 15 U.S.C. 1681b - Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports : This section outlines that consumer reports can only be furnished under specific conditions. My rights to privacy and confidentiality have been violated as my report was accessed or shared without permissible purpose.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) - Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information : This statute prohibits the furnishing of any information to a consumer reporting agency that is known to be inaccurate or has not been verified. [ Name of Furnisher/Creditor ] has furnished information that is either inaccurate or unverifiable.

15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Right to Privacy : The statute emphasizes the need for consumer reporting agencies to handle consumer information with fairness, impartiality, and respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. This has not been upheld in my case.

15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Requirement for Written Consent : This section specifies that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a consumer report without the consumer 's written instruction. I did not provide written consent for the inquiry or account listed.

15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) - Prohibition of Obsolete Information : This section prohibits the reporting of adverse information older than seven years ( except for records of convictions ). The report in question contains outdated or irrelevant information.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I wrote all 3 credit bureaus a certified letter requesting that XXXX XXXX validate the debit on my credit files. They are saying this is a debit from XXXX. I requested validation of the debit showing that this was in fact my debit but never received any documentation, only an update from the credit bureaus saying it was validated. The account number that was provided on my credit file is XXXX in the amount of {$220.00}. The credit bureaus said the accounts were verified but never provided how they verified the account with the documentation that I requested in my letter to them within 30 days. I received no correspondence from XXXX XXXX regarding the debit validation that was sent. I am asking that this debit be completely removed if you are not able to validate the with the information I requested. How are you able to validate the account but not provide me with the documents I requested? This was my request : Please send me copies of the documents that you have in your files as of this date that you used to verify the accuracy of the accounts listed below. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. 1681g I have the right to demand that you disclose to me all of the documents that you have recorded and retained in your file at the time of this request concerning the accounts that you are reporting in my credit report. Please dont respond to my request by saying that these accounts have been verified. Send me copies of the documents that you have in your files that were used to verify them. If you do not have any documentation in your files to verify the accuracy of these disputed accounts then please delete them immediately as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( i ). By publishing these inaccurate and unverified items on my credit report and distributing them to 3rd parties you are damaging my reputation and creditworthiness. Under the FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i, all unverified accounts must be promptly deleted. Therefore, if you are unable to provide me with a copy of the verifiable proof that you have on file for each of the accounts listed below within 30 days of receipt of this letter then you must remove these accounts from my credit report. Thank you, XXXX XXXX I have filed a complaint against the XXXX XXXX XXXX with the cfpb and they have still not provide information and my rights as a consumer are being violated. It was deleted from XXXX  yet you continue to report. Please provide me the verification the company provided you that validated this debit

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation of the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against TRANSUNION regarding the inaccurate information reported in my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XXXX XX/XX/year> of Credit Report, I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( s ) : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, high balance is reported differently in the credit agencies, date of last activity, last payment, and credit. 

Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, including : 1. Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation. 
2. Section 611 : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation. 
3. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : Removal of unverifiable information dont validated for creditor Original. 
4. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, TRANSUNION has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted on my creditworthiness. 
In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated 30-day period, as established in 15 U.S. Code 1681i. Additionally, I referenced 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Under 15 USC 6802, a financial institution is prohibited from disclosing nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the following conditions are met : The institution provides a clear and conspicuous disclosure to the consumer, in writing, electronically, or through another permitted form, stating that such information may be shared with third parties. 
The consumer is given the opportunity, prior to the initial disclosure, to opt-out of having their information shared. 
The institution provides an explanation of how the consumer can exercise this opt-out right. 
In this case, the financial institution failed to inform me of my rights or provide the required disclosures to protect my privacy. Furthermore, I have become aware that my personal information was compromised in a data breach, representing another significant violation of my privacy rights.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against XXXX, Transunion, and XXXX for two significant violations of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation of Disputed Information : On XX/XX/year>, I filed a dispute with TransUnion regarding inaccuracies in my credit report. I explicitly requested a manual review of the disputed information due to its complexity. I provided clear supporting evidence, including highlighted copies of my credit report identifying the errors. However, XXXX used the E-Oscar system to process my dispute electronically rather than conducting the manual review I requested. This process fails to ensure a thorough investigation, as required under the FCRA. 
The response I received was vague and did not provide sufficient detail regarding the methods, sources, or procedures used to verify the disputed information. My specific questions about the investigation process remain unanswered. 
2. Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance by a Collection Agency : Account Name Account Number XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Despite my dispute, XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion continue to report this collection account without verifying its validity or requiring the collection agency to issue a 1099-C. This raises questions about the legitimacy of the debt and violates federal regulations. 
Key Violations : 1. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation : o XXXX violated 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) by failing to conduct a manual review of my dispute as explicitly requested. 
o The use of E-Oscar resulted in an inadequate and incomplete investigation. 
2. Failure to Provide Details of Investigation : o XXXX failed to provide the methods, sources, and documentation used in their investigation, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 4 ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ).

3. Inaccurate Reporting and Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance : o XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion continue to report inaccurate information, violating my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

o The collection agencys failure to issue a 1099-C for canceled or forgiven debt violates IRS regulations and raises concerns about the accounts validity.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally dispute the reporting and handling of account, as it contains several violations of my rights under federal law. Specifically, under 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to privacy, which has been violated by furnishing or sharing my account information without my express written consent. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish account information without my explicit written instructions, which I have not provided. Furthermore, per 15 U.S.C. 1681a paragraph ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), transactions improperly reported that do not meet consumer reporting standards should be excluded from my consumer report. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1666b, a creditor may not treat payments on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose unless proper notice is mailed to the consumer at least 21 days before the due date. To my knowledge, I did not receive any such notice or statement. Lastly, 15 U.S.C. 1637b requires that creditors provide clear and timely disclosures of payment terms, which I did not receive in relation to this account. Based on these violations, I demand the immediate removal of all late payments associated with this account from my credit report, written confirmation that any improperly included transactions have been removed, and proof that all required notices and disclosures were properly sent.
