Consumer complaint narrative:
Under 15 USC 6802, a financial institution is prohibited from disclosing nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the following conditions are met : The institution provides a clear and conspicuous disclosure to the consumer, in writing, electronically, or through another permitted form, stating that such information may be shared with third parties.

The consumer is given the opportunity, prior to the initial disclosure, to opt-out of having their information shared.

The institution provides an explanation of how the consumer can exercise this opt-out right.

In this case, the financial institution failed to inform me of my rights or provide the required disclosures to protect my privacy. Furthermore, I have become aware that my personal information was compromised in a data breach, representing another significant violation of my privacy rights.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. The first payment was due on XX/XX/XXXX, which I paid. The issue I have is that the company has not deducted my payments from the balance and it looks as if I have not made any payment on this car. I have been given extensions, and have been charged late payments even if I pay earlier in the month. 

I have been told that 11 payments were extended. I have asked for the extension paperwork which I have not received. Extensions were explained to me that they go on the back of the loan which extends the length of time that I pay for the car. 

My issue is that the balance owed is incorrect, which makes it look as if I am not paying for the car. When I looked at my XXXX credit report it states incorrectly that I have only made one payment, since XXXX, which is not correct and the car would have been repossessed. I need this corrected on my credit reports to reflect that I have been making payments which should decrease the balance. 

I am being contacted constantly by the company, but have not been able to speak to anyone higher than customer service to get this corrected. When I ask about the balance on the loan and why the payments are not being reported correctly as it should be going down, I am told about the daily interest, 11 extensions, late payments etc. That does not answer the questions I am asking. 

I need the balance reported correctly as I have been paying on this loan since XXXX and it should not reflect the same amount as the beginning balance.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I looked at my report and noticed some things are incomplete and inaccurate I sent a letter to all XXXX credit bureaus ( XXXX XXXX and TransUnion ) I asked them to investigate the completeness and accuracy. I received the results and noticed that they did not fix nothing. There are breaking FEDERAL LAW!

According to 15usc 1681e ( b ) it states this ( b ) accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedure to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

So I then asked them to provide me a description of the investigation according to 15 usc 1681i ( 7 ) : ( 7 ) description of reinvestigation procedure. A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a description referred to in a paragraph ( 6 ) ( b ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description.

But they did not do that as well either.

They also are breaking these laws as well below 15 usc 1681i ( 5 ) it states this ( 5 ) treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) in general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified the consumer reporting agency shall..

( I ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer or modify that item of information as appropriate based on the results of the reinvestigation and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer According to 15 usc 1681s-2 it states this ( A ) reporting information with actual knowledge of errors This is unfair and if they doing it to me imagine who else they are doing this too. Can please fix ( Method of verification/the process and procedure used to verify information/name and contact information of person contacted/any contracts bearing my wet signature ) IT TOOK LONGER THAN 30 days on my investigation therefore these items by law have to be deleted

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to dispute the reporting of a collection account by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on my credit report. It is impossible for this account to have been verified because a CFPB complaint was sent to XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/2024, and they failed to validate this alleged account. 

The response provided by your bureau to my prior dispute was insufficient. This collection account remains inaccurate and unverified. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to validation of any alleged debt reported on my credit file. 

Despite my requests, the following critical items have not been provided by XXXX XXXX XXXX : An explanation of the alleged account balance, including a complete XXXX XXXX and payment history. Documentation showing my agreement to this debt, including my signature and authorization for you to report this information. Proof of a valid agreement authorizing XXXX XXXX XXXX to collect this debt. Evidence of their state license to operate and collect debts in my state. The original promissory note and chain of custody for this account. The purchase agreement showing how and why my information was obtained without consent. This lack of documentation raises concerns about the legitimacy of this account and the accuracy of its reporting. Additionally, XXXX XXXX XXXX appears to be in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1692j, furnishing deceptive forms to create a false belief of participation in the collection of this debt, which I have not authorized.

Consumer complaint narrative: I was a XXXX wireless customer. I had 4 voice lines and a connected tablet. I ported my services to XXXX and paid off all of my remaining phone balances with XXXX. Confirming with an agent that my services were disconnected, and they were paid in full. I was assured it was. Fast forward approximately 3 months later and I notice via a secondary email that XXXX is still billing. When I called in and spoke with an agent they said " I notice the problem '' when you ported out your voice lines, you did not port your tablet data line, it became a new data only account and has been billing you. I explained that the tablet is no longer used, I want services cancelled. The agent apologized and transferred me to someone who could disconnect my account, that 2nd agent assured me I would be receive a credit, nothing was owed, and the account would be closed. Fast forward about 60 days and I receive yet another notice, this time from XXXX collections stating I owe money still. After 3 calls and the collections department refusal to let me speak with anyone else, I finally just paid the balance. 30 days later a paid collections shows up on my credit report. This should not have been a collection, XXXX created a data only account without notification, XXXX made commitments and gave false information.

Under the FDCPA, I requested : Explanation of the account balance. 
Full payment history and audit trail.

Documentation of my consent to this debt and its reporting.

Proof of authorization to collect in my state.

Chain of custody, master bill of sale, purchase agreement, and promissory note for the alleged debt.

Despite allowing ample time, none of these items were provided. The lack of response is a clear violation of FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) and FDCPA regulations. Reporting unverifiable information is prohibited, and failure to validate these accounts obligates their removal from my credit report.

I demand the immediate deletion of the aforementioned accounts. Continued non-compliance will result in legal action for monetary damages as permitted under federal law.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
XXXX XXXX : # XXXX, XXXX  : # XXXX, XXXX : # XXXX, XXXX : # XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX  XXXX  ) : # XXXX, XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX ) # XXXX, XXXX # XXXX, XXXX XXXX # XXXX, XXXX  # XXXX, XXXX # XXXX, XXXX # XXXX, XXXX XXXX # XXXX has violated my rights. 

I looked at my XXXX credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to demand the immediate removal of fraudulent information from my credit report. The disputed items were not authorized by me and are the result of identity theft or inaccuracies that XXXX has failed to address despite its legal obligation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) These items were opened or reported without my authorization. I have previously notified XXXX of this matter and provided supporting documentation, but the erroneous entries remain, causing undue harm to my financial well-being. 



Violations of XXXX XXXX XXXX. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation ( FCRA XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) ( A ) ) Upon receiving a dispute, XXXX is required to investigate and remove unverifiable or fraudulent information. Your failure to take corrective action violates this provision. 

XXXX. Reporting Inaccurate Information ( FCRA 607 ( b ) ) Credit reporting agencies are required to maintain maximum accuracy in the information they report. The continued presence of fraudulent accounts on my credit file demonstrates a failure to meet this obligation.

3. Failure to Correct or Delete Fraudulent Entries ( FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ) If an item can not be verified as accurate, XXXX must delete it within 30 days of receiving the dispute. By failing to remove these fraudulent entries, XXXX has breached its legal responsibilities.

XXXX. Violation of 15 USC 1681 e ( b ) COMPLIANCE PROCEDURES XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Please remove it from my credit report. 


FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information. 

in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4.

business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer.

( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report.

( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer. 

( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( XXXX ) that the information may be a result of identity theft.

( 2 ) that an identity theft report has been filed.

( 3 ) that a block has been requested under this section; and ( 4 ) of the effective dates of the block.

( c ) Authority to decline or rescind.

( 1 ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error, or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions. 

( 2 ) Notification to consumer. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer.

shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i.

( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) of this title.

( 3 ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew.

or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block.

( d ) Exception for resellers.

( 1 ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller.

( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft.

( 2 ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information.

( 3 ) Notice In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( 2 ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting.

agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale.

( e ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negatable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning 4 business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 3 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section.

1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft.

( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation of the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against TRANSUNION regarding the inaccurate information reported in my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XXXX XX/XX/year> of Credit Report, I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( s ) : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, high balance is reported differently in the credit agencies, date of last activity, last payment, and credit. 

Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, including : 1. Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation. 
2. Section 611 : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation. 
3. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : Removal of unverifiable information dont validated for creditor Original. 
4. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, TRANSUNION has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted on my creditworthiness. 
In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated 30-day period, as established in 15 U.S. Code 1681i. Additionally, I referenced 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request a 1099-C form ( Cancellation of Debt ) related to the account associated with [ Account NumberXXXX XXXX ] that is currently being reported on my credit report. If this debt has been forgiven, canceled, or settled for less than the full balance, the IRS 1099-C form is required to be filed under 26 U.S.C. 6050P if the amount of canceled debt exceeds {$600.00}. 
In addition to the 1099-C form, I am disputing the accuracy of the debt and requesting verification in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Reinvestigation of Disputed Information ), and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information ) . I am entitled to request and receive complete documentation to verify the accuracy and legality of this account 's reporting, and I am invoking my rights under [ Mississippi ] law to receive proper validation of this debt. 
Written Communication Only : Please be advised that I am requesting written communication only regarding this matter. 
I do not wish to receive any phone calls or other forms of communication. Any correspondence should be directed to the address listed above. This request is made pursuant to my right under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ) of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), which entitles me to request that all communication from you be in writing. 
Requests for Documentation : 1. 1099-C Form : 2. If the debt has been discharged, forgiven, or settled for less than the full amount, I request that you provide a copy of the 1099-C form filed with the IRS. This form is required when the forgiven amount exceeds {$600.00}. If you have not filed this form, or if you can not provide it, I will assume that the debt has been discharged and should no longer be reported as owed on my credit report. Failure to file the 1099-C may constitute fraudulent reporting of the debt. 
3. Authenticated Double Entry Accounting Records : In addition to the 1099-C, I am requesting full double-entry accounting records for the account in question. This should include a detailed breakdown that shows all transactions, including the original balance, payments, interest, fees, and any other adjustments made to the account. Please ensure that the records comply with standard accounting practices, and provide authenticated evidence of the debt, rather than a simple list of charges or account statements. The court ruling in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX 
XXXX ), states that debt collectors must provide verified and authenticated documentation, not merely conclusory statements. 
4. Proof of Legal Right to Report and Collect the Debt : I also request authenticated evidence, in compliance with [ Your State ] law, that you have the legal right to report and collect this debt. This should include the original signed contract or agreement showing my obligation to pay the debt and your legal right to enforce collection and report it to the credit bureaus. In XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX. XXXX ), the court held that creditors must provide original signed documentation to prove the validity of a debt. Failure to provide this evidence could result in violations of both state and federal consumer protection laws. 
Request for Deletion if Evidence is Not Provided : If you are unable to provide the requested documentation or proof of the debt, I request that you immediately delete this account from my credit report in compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2. Under these provisions, you are required to investigate and correct any inaccuracies in the information you report to consumer reporting agencies. 
Failure to respond to this request, or failure to provide the required documentation, will compel me to take further action.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XX/XX/XXXX SS # XXXX TransUnion Consumer Solutions XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX XXXX : Dispute Authorization and Multiple Violations of Fair Credit Reporting Act I, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX hereby authorize this dispute. It is important to note that this dispute was not sent by an unauthorized third party or " credit clinic. '' I am writing to address several violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) that have occurred, which require your immediate attention and resolution. The violations are as follows : FCRA Section 607 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Consumer Right to Privacy : You are reporting fraudulent accounts on my credit report that do not belong to me, thus infringing upon my privacy rights. I have the sole authority to determine what information should be considered private. I insist that my hard inquiries and account information not be shared on my credit report. 

FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Misleading False Reporting : The information you are reporting falsely suggests that I applied for multiple inquiries and accounts, when in reality, these were the result of a scammer 's actions. Such false reporting misleads future creditors. By reporting these unverified items, you violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and fail to comply with its fairness requirements.

FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : You accepted credit information about me without verifying its accuracy firsthand. This willful noncompliance is punishable by civil liability of up to {$1000.00} per violation.

FCRA Section 605B - Aggravated Identity Theft : You shared my personal information with numerous creditors without obtaining my consent, making you criminally liable for aggravated identity theft, which carries a penalty of up to 2 years of imprisonment.

FCRA Section 603 ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information : You failed to disclose my right to opt out of sharing my personal information. This omission was deceptive and a violation of my consumer rights. 
FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms : You furnished inaccurate inquiries and accounts without proper validation, potentially violating Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ). Reporting such inaccurate information is deceptive.

Violation of Debt Collection Practices Act : You engaged in unfair practices and harassment by reporting inaccurate debts and accounts without my consent, causing me distress and unnecessary contact from creditors. 

Violation of Identity Theft Laws : Creditors obtained my information without my true consent and used it to obtain credit from other financial institutions, constituting identity theft. 

Violation of Acquiring Location Information Regulations : Debt collectors contacted third-party credit reporting agencies with my information, stating that I owed a " debt. '' This is a clear violation of regulations that prohibit disclosing debt information to third parties.

Violation of Timely Payments Regulations : You reported " late payments '' on my credit report without defining what constitutes a late payment, which is deceptive and inaccurate.

Violation of Finance Charge Determination : You failed to accurately determine finance charges, which is your responsibility as a credit reporting agency.

Violation of Credit Report Permissible Purposes : You reported information on my credit report without obtaining my written consent, which is a violation of the permissible purposes outlined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

I, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, demand that you take immediate action to address these violations. I request the following actions : 1. Under 15 USC 1666b this late payment entry is a violation. I have been incorrectly billed. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Please update the status of this account to " paid on time. '' Remove all fraudulent and inaccurate accounts from my credit report. 
Block any information resulting from identity theft, as required by FCRA.I expect a prompt response and resolution to this matter. Failure to comply will leave me with no choice but to pursue legal remedies available under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX Compliance Department Regarding Improper Use of My Credit File To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX for violations of federal statutes related to the improper use of my credit file, reporting of information without consent, and failure to comply with legal obligations regarding debt reporting and income recognition.

1. Unauthorized Use and Reporting of Credit Information : XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to comply with 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which specifies permissible purposes for obtaining and using consumer credit reports. I never provided written consent for XXXX XXXX XXXX to report any information to my credit file. According to 16 CFR 313.7, financial institutions must obtain explicit authorization from consumers before sharing nonpublic personal information unless an exception applies, none of which are applicable here.

Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of their information-sharing policies and practices, which XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to do. Their actions also appear to violate 15 U.S.C. 6805, which empowers regulatory bodies to enforce these provisions.

2. Charge-Off Reporting and Misclassification : A charge-off is a bookkeeping designation used by creditors for tax purposes when they consider a debt uncollectible. Under federal tax law, a charge-off can be treated as a cancellation of debt, which may constitute income to the debtor. However, XXXX XXXX XXXX did not issue a XXXX ( Cancellation of Debt ) form to me, as required under IRS regulations XXXX to substantiate that the debt was canceled and classified as income. Without this form, their reporting of the charge-off to credit reporting agencies is not only improper but also misleading. 

Moreover, a charge-off does not represent a valid certificate of indebtedness. A certificate of indebtedness reflects a binding obligation that is enforceable ; a charge-off, by its nature, implies that the debt has been resolved or abandoned by the creditor. Reporting a charge-off to credit bureaus under these circumstances constitutes inaccurate reporting. 

XXXX. Lack of Transparency and Consumer Rights Violations : XXXX XXXX XXXX has disregarded my consumer rights by failing to provide adequate notice or obtain my written consent before furnishing information to credit reporting agencies. This omission violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). Their noncompliance with transparency requirements and failure to respect the confidentiality of my personal financial information is concerning. 

I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate XXXX XXXX XXXX practices to determine whether they are in violation of federal laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. 68026805 ( GLBAs financial privacy rules ) ; 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( FCRAs permissible purposes for credit reporting ) ; 16 CFR 313.7 ( GLBA privacy and opt-out regulations ).

Additionally, I request clarification and appropriate remediation regarding : 1.The absence of a XXXX form to substantiate the charge-off as canceled debt. 
2.The improper classification of a charge-off as a certificate of indebtedness.

3.The unauthorized reporting of information to credit bureaus without my explicit written consent. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in ensuring compliance and protecting my rights as a consumer. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681 ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) in general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall-i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of XXXX personal credit card accounts opened at XXXX XXXXXXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number ( private ), XXXX XXXX XXXX opened XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  opened XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX  opened XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX opened XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX opened XX/XX/XXXX An auto loan account opened at XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number ( private ) and XXXX personal loan accounts at XXXX XXXX XXXX opened XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX opened XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX opened XXXX XXXXThese accounts have resulted in several fraudulent charge offs appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I've attached a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently received a copy of my credit report from XXXX, XXXX, and Transunion and I noticed some late payments posted on my report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Account number # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number # XXXX Your company ( s ) ( creditors and credit bureaus ) is in clear violation of the law. Under 15 USC 1681b-permisable purpose of consumer reports, The LAW CLEARLY STATES ( a ) In General Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. 
I did not give my written instructions to furnish these accounts on my credit report. 
Furthermore, the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ). Exclusion from a consumer credit report clearly states : ( 2 ) Exclusions- Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ) consumer report does not include ( A ) Subject to 1681s-3 of this title any- Report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report : Delete the above late payments from my consumer report, the creditors and the credit bureaus are in violation of 15 USC 1681 Failure to respond satisfactorily with deletion of the above referred accounts and send out a free copy of my credit report after the changes have been made will result in Legal action being taken against your company, for which I will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation 1. Defamation of Character ( per se ) 2. Negligent Enablement of identity fraud 3. Fair Debt Collections Practices Act 15 USC 1692g violation 4. Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 violation for willful noncompliance-616 Civil Liability for willful non compliance ( 15 USC 1681n ) By the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I demand that these items be reinvestigated and removed from my report. Please remove any information that the creditor can not verify. I understand that under 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1681, you must complete this reinvestigation within 14 days of this receipt. I have included documents and my personal identification to prove my Identity and support my claim. 
Thank you for your time and help in this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I AM OUTRAGED AND DEEPLY DISAPPOINTED THAT YOU HAVE FAILED TO REPORT MY CLAIMS IN A MANNER THAT COMPLIES WITH THE REQUIRED STANDARDS, AND I AM DEMANDING IMMEDIATE CORRECTIVE ACTION. THIS LETTER SERVES AS MY FORMAL AND UNEQUIVOCAL DISPUTE REGARDING THE CLAIMS REPORTED IN THE NOTICE. 

YOU HAVE BLATANTLY FAILED TO FOLLOW THE MANDATORY XXXX XXXX DATA-FILLED FIELD FORMATTED REPORTING STANDARDS, AND I CHALLENGE YOU TO PROVIDE CLEAR, IRREFUTABLE EVIDENCE THAT EACH CLAIM WAS REPORTED PROPERLY. 

LET ME MAKE THIS ABUNDANTLY CLEAR : I DO NOT DISPUTE THE VALIDITY OF THE CLAIMS THEMSELVES, BUT I ABSOLUTELY CONTEST YOUR FAILURE TO REPORT THEM IN FULL COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL LAW. ACCORDING TO THE LAW, YOU ARE LEGALLY OBLIGATED TO ENSURE THAT EVERY SINGLE CLAIM IS REPORTED WITH THE HIGHEST DEGREE OF ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS. THE WAY THESE CLAIMS HAVE BEEN REPORTED IS NOT ONLY XXXX IS ILLEGAL. 

UNDER XXXX XXXX, THE CLAIMS YOU HAVE REPORTED ARE QUESTIONABLE AT BEST AND LIKELY UNLAWFUL IN THEIR EXECUTION. IT IS UNACCEPTABLE FOR MY PERSONAL AND FINANCIAL REPUTATION TO BE HARMED BY YOUR NEGLIGENCE, AND I AM DEMANDING THAT YOU IMMEDIATELY CORRECT THE RECORD. 

XXXX. Under XXXX XXXX XXXX this is a billing error always paid as agreed on time this is an error this account is in violation. 
XXXX XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX Please correct/update this inaccurate information on my credit report. 


THESE ACCOUNTS WERE PAID. THIS CREDITOR VIOLATES MY RIGHTS UNDER XXXX XXXX. 

Code XXXX XXXX - PROMPT AND FAIR CREDITING OF PAYMENTS. 

( a ) PAYMENTS RECEIVED FROM AN OBLIGOR UNDER AN OPEN-END CONSUMER CREDIT PLAN BY THE CREDITOR SHALL BE POSTED PROMPTLY TO THE OBLIGORS ACCOUNT AS SPECIFIED IN REGULATIONS OF THE BUREAU. 

SUCH REGULATIONS SHALL PREVENT A FINANCE CHARGE FROM BEING IMPOSED ON ANY OBLIGOR IF THE CREDITOR HAS RECEIVED THE OBLIGORS PAYMENT IN READILY IDENTIFIABLE FORM, BY XXXXXXXX XXXX. ON THE DATE ON WHICH SUCH PAYMENT IS DUE, IN THE AMOUNT, MANNER, AND LOCATION INDICATED BY THE CREDITOR TO AVOID THE IMPOSITION THEREOF. 
THIS IS CLEARLY A VIOLATION OF MY RIGHTS AND I WILL TAKE FURTHER ACTION TO MAKE SURE MY RIGHTS ARE BEING PROTECTED. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information. After any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

I WILL WAIT FOR YOUR RESPONSE IN WRITING.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute fraudulent accounts on my credit reports resulting from identity theft. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent, and their reporting violates multiple provisions of U.S. law, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The accounts in question are : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( TransUnion, XXXX, XXXX ) Under 15 U.S.C . 1681c-2, I have the right to block and demand removal of information resulting from identity theft. Furthermore, reporting these accounts without my explicit consent violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for accessing and reporting consumer information. I assert that these accounts were created and reported unlawfully, and I never provided consent for such reporting. 

I have attached an identity theft affidavit and additional supporting documentation. Please ensure these accounts are removed from my credit reports immediately. 

I request written confirmation of receipt of this dispute and updates regarding the resolution process. I also remind you of your obligation to address these violations promptly under 15 U.S.C. 1681i. 

Thank you for your urgent attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against TransUnion for failing to validate and correct inaccuracies in my credit report regarding the following accounts : XXXX Account # XXXX XXXX  XXXX Account # XXXX Despite submitting disputes since XX/XX/XXXX, and providing clear evidence of inaccuracies, TransUnion has repeatedly closed my disputes, stating the accounts were verified as reported. However, no documentation or validation has been provided to support this claim. 

Specific Issues : Inconsistent and Impossible Dates : The XXXX account shows discrepancies in the Date of Last Activity and Closed Date. 
The XXXX XXXX account has a future reporting date ( XX/XX/XXXX ), which is impossible. 
Contradictory Payment Status : The XXXX account is marked Current but shows late payments, which is inaccurate and misleading. 
Missing Creditor Information : The original creditor for the XXXX account is not listed, violating my right to know the source of the information under FCRA Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ).

Failure to Validate : TransUnion has not provided any proof to substantiate these accounts, violating FCRA Section 611. 

Furthermore I have asked you to delete XXXX, XXXX, XXXX from my report as this is not my name and not correct. I have supplied you with my contact information, identification and the correct spelling of my name for six months but yet this still remains. REMOVE this as it is not my information. 
Repeated Disputes Ignored : I have disputed these accounts for six months, and no corrections or valid explanations have been provided. This is a clear violation of my rights under the FCRA. 
I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) investigate TransUnions failure to comply with the FCRA and mandate the immediate deletion of these accounts from my credit report. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the ( Transunion ) credit reporting agency, block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint.

I am filing this to report five fraudulent accounts and one fraudulent inquiry appearing on my consumer FICO TransUnion credit report, which I do not recognize as reported and which are the result of identity theft and fraud. These fraudulent accounts consist of a credit card account opened at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX, a credit card account opened at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX, and XXXX credit card accounts opened at XXXX XXXX  XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX. Additionally, a fraudulent inquiry by XXXX was made on XX/XX/XXXX. These accounts and the associated inquiry have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I demand that the fraudulent items be removed from each of my consumer credit reports and that all collection activity related to said items. 

I am filing this to report XXXX fraudulent accounts and XXXX fraudulent inquiries appearing on my consumer TransUnion credit report, which I do not recognize as reported and which are the result of identity theft and fraud. These fraudulent accounts consist of a credit card account opened at XXXX XXXX  XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX, a credit card account opened at XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX, a credit card account opened at XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX, and a credit card account opened at XXXX  XXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX includes a fraudulent XXXX late payment reported on XX/XX/XXXX. Fraudulent inquiries include XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX via XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I demand that the aforementioned fraudulent items be removed from each of my credit report. 


These accounts have resulted in several fraudulent chargeoffs, fraudulent late payments, and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, late payments, or chargeoffs as reported. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and chargeoffs appearing on my consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, late payments, and charge-offs are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # ( XXXX ), ( XXXX ) as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I demand that the aforementioned fraudulent items be removed from my consumer credit report and that all collection activity related to said items cease pursuant to my rights within the FCRA and FDCPA laws.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I, XXXX XXXX XXXX, declare that the information listed below is a result of identity theft and is fraudulent. I have never authorized, or opened the accounts listed. This information is frivolous. I request an investigation into fraudulent activities related with my SSN and personal information. Pursuant to the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611 ) ; Formal Request for Information : I am formally requesting the names and business addresses of each individual or entity you communicated with for verification purposes in relation to the fraudulent transactions identified in my credit report. This request aligns with my right to follow up on the information provided and to assist in this identity theft investigation. Attached is a copy of my government-issued identification and a copy of the identity theft report. I am requesting these fraudulent items removed immediately from my credit files. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX : # XXXX : Balance : {$1500.00} ; Opened Date : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : # XXXX : Balance : {$880.00} : Opened Date : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Hard Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  & XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  ) Model Finance ( Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX ) XXXX XXXX ( Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX ) XXXX  XXXX ( Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX & XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  ) XXXX  ( Inquiry : XXXX XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX  ( Inquiry : XXXX XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX  ( Inquiry : XXXX XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX  XXXX ( Inquiry : XXXX XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX ( Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX ) XXXX XXXXXXXX ( Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX ) XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX ( Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXX ) XXXX  ( Inquiry Date : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  ) It is unacceptable, and a violation of federal consumer protection laws, that I continue to face harassment and fictitious debts due to the unauthorized account and unauthorized inquiries. Your agency failure to delete these fraudulent entries will be direct violation of my rights under FCRA Section 605B ( 15 USC 1681c-2 ) ( a ). The FCRA requires immediate removal of fraudulent information from credit reports following a valid identity theft report, which I have provided. Such inaction is further aggravating the distress caused by this identity theft. The fraudulent information has impacted my credit report, causing considerable XXXX  stress. I request assistance in investigating this matter and taking the necessary steps to resolve it promptly. Please inform me of any actions required on my part in response to this dispute. I am aware of my rights under federal laws relating to credit reporting and identity theft. Failure to act in accordance with legal obligations will force me to get an attorney.

Consumer complaint narrative:
ACCOUNTS : XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX After I received correspondence from your agency, it stated that the accounts I disputed were verified by your agency. Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) 1 ( a ), I am demanding that your agency perform a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the status of the disputed information.

Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) please complete this inaccurate account or delete it from my consumer reports.

The Law Cleary States : ( a ) Reinvestigations of disputed information ( 1 ) Reinvestigation required ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller.

I DO NOT consent to any E-OSCAR verification as this method is not reliable or lawful, according to the standards set for by the FCRA.

I am requesting that you validate the following items non-electronically, by performing a reasonable and FAIR re-investigation : Please provide the following details of the methods by which you verified these accounts : a. Identity and position of the representative contacted?

b. Date, duration, and substance of the conversation?

c. Contact details utilized?

d. Identity, position, and tenure of your company 's employees involved?

e. Details of formal training imparted to said employee?

f. Copies of all written correspondence?

Your agency also seems to be in violation of non-compliance and negligent non-compliance with being in direct violation or the following laws : 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court.

( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater.

These are now multiple attempts to handle this matter privately. If these accounts keep getting verified by a faulty e-Oscar system when I know these accounts are erroneous and destroying my credit worthiness, I will in fact sue your agency for the maximum monetary damages that the FCRA allows. 

Your agency has less than 30 days to respond with a fair reasonable re-investigation or I will have no choice but to seek legal action. This investigation must be validated by the information that I have listed above. If the information is not validated, then it must be deleted immediately from my consumer report!

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Subject : Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX Regarding Improper Use of My Credit File To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX for violations of federal statutes related to the improper use of my credit file, reporting of information without consent, and failure to comply with legal obligations regarding debt reporting and income recognition.

1. Unauthorized Use and Reporting of Credit Information : XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to comply with 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which specifies permissible purposes for obtaining and using consumer credit reports. I never provided written consent for XXXX XXXX XXXX to report any information to my credit file. 
According to 16 CFR 313.7, financial institutions must obtain explicit authorization from consumers before sharing nonpublic personal information unless an exception applies, none of which are applicable here. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of their information-sharing policies and practices, which XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX failed to do. Their actions also appear to violate 15 U.S.C. 6805, which empowers regulatory bodies to enforce these provisions.

2. Charge-Off Reporting and Misclassification : A charge-off is a bookkeeping designation used by creditors for tax purposes when they consider a debt uncollectible. Under federal tax law, a charge-off can be treated as a cancellation of debt, which may constitute income to the debtor. However, XXXX XXXX XXXX did not issue a 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ) form to me, as required under IRS regulations , to substantiate that the debt was canceled and classified as income. Without this form, their reporting of the charge-off to credit reporting agencies is not only improper but also misleading.

Moreover, a charge-off does not represent a valid certificate of indebtedness. A certificate of indebtedness reflects a binding obligation that is enforceable ; a charge-off, by its nature, implies that the debt has been resolved or abandoned by the creditor. Reporting a charge-off to credit bureaus under these circumstances constitutes inaccurate reporting.

3. Lack of Transparency and Consumer Rights Violations : XXXX XXXX XXXX has disregarded my consumer rights by failing to provide adequate notice or obtain my written consent before furnishing information to credit reporting agencies. This omission violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). Their noncompliance with transparency requirements and failure to respect the confidentiality of my personal financial information is concerning. 

I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate XXXX XXXX XXXX practices to determine whether they are in violation of federal laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. XXXX ( GLBAs financial privacy rules ) ; 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( FCRAs permissible purposes for credit reporting ) ; 16 CFR 313.7 ( GLBA privacy and opt-out regulations ). Additionally, I request clarification and appropriate remediation regarding : 1. The absence of a 1099-C form to substantiate the charge-off as canceled debt.

2. The improper classification of a charge-off as a certificate of indebtedness.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Under 15 USC 6802, a financial institution is prohibited from disclosing nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the following conditions are met : The institution provides a clear and conspicuous disclosure to the consumer, in writing, electronically, or through another permitted form, stating that such information may be shared with third parties.

The consumer is given the opportunity, prior to the initial disclosure, to opt-out of having their information shared.

The institution provides an explanation of how the consumer can exercise this opt-out right. 
In this case, the financial institution failed to inform me of my rights or provide the required disclosures to protect my privacy. Furthermore, I have become aware that my personal information was compromised in a data breach, representing another significant violation of my privacy rights.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XX/XX/XXXX To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
XXXX XXXX Subject : Urgent Demand for Removal of Unauthorized Accounts and Violations of Federal Law Equifax has demonstrated a clear failure to maintain consistency and transparency in its handling of your dispute, further compounding the harm caused by its already unlawful practices. On one hand, Equifax sent written correspondence stating that your disputes were deemed frivolous because they were previously verified or lacked new relevant information. Yet, when you called Equifaxs representatives, they contradicted this claim by asserting that the FTC report you submitted, along with other supporting documents, was invalid or not reflected in their system. This blatant inconsistency in communication highlights systemic negligence, internal disorganization, and possibly intentional efforts to delay or obstruct dispute resolution. 

Key Issues with Equifaxs Contradictions 1. Misleading Written Statements : The letter implied that your disputes were frivolous, suggesting there was no new information to warrant further investigation. However, the supporting documentation you submitted, including proof of identification, proof of address, and the FTC Identity Theft Report, satisfies the requirements under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 for blocking disputed items. 
2. Disregard of Submitted Documents : Equifaxs claim during your phone call that the FTC report was invalid reflects either a failure to properly process submitted documents or intentional misrepresentation of its obligations under federal law. 
3. Obstruction of Consumer Rights : The conflicting statements prevent you from effectively resolving the dispute and exercising your rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). By sending contradictory information, Equifax undermines its obligation to provide a clear and efficient dispute resolution process. 
4. Possible Profit-Driven Motives : The delays caused by these contradictory statements may be a tactic to continue profiting from unauthorized or inaccurate information on your credit report, as credit reporting agencies often benefit financially from retaining more data on consumers. 
5. Violation of FCRA Procedures : According to 15 U.S.C. 1681i, Equifax must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information and can not arbitrarily declare disputes frivolous, especially when documentation is provided. 

Legal and Regulatory Implications 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Equifax must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information on your credit report. Failing to process valid disputes and providing contradictory information violates this mandate. 
15 U.S.C. 1681n : Willful noncompliance with the FCRA exposes Equifax to statutory, actual, and punitive damages. 
Section 5 ( a ) of the FTC Act : Misleading consumers through contradictory communication may constitute unfair and deceptive practices, subject to enforcement by the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ). 
Consumer Financial Protection Act ( 12 U.S.C. 5536 ) : Equifaxs actions may violate the prohibition against unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices ( UDAAP ). 

Demand for Accountability Equifaxs inability to provide consistent and accurate information underscores a broader systemic failure within its dispute resolution processes. I will not tolerate the continued violation of my rights. Your contradictory communications must be resolved, and the following actions must be taken immediately : 1. Remove all unauthorized accounts and information in compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2.

2. Provide a written explanation reconciling the discrepancies between your written and verbal statements.

3. Implement internal compliance measures to prevent similar occurrences in the future. 





To Whom It May Concern, This formal complaint demands the immediate removal of unauthorized accounts and inaccurate information from my consumer report. Despite my compliance with all legal requirements under FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( Section 605C2 ), these accounts remain unlawfully reported. Furthermore, I have IRS-confirmed evidence of Form 1099-C cancellation for the debts associated with these accounts, proving they are no longer valid or collectible. 
The fact that these canceled accounts remain on my report, despite their resolution with the IRS, demonstrates not only your noncompliance with federal law but also a potential fraudulent financial intent. If these items are not promptly removed, I reserve the right to report your continued actions to the IRS under their whistleblower program, as the profit gained from unauthorized reporting constitutes tax fraud and abuse. 
Accounts to Be Removed Immediately XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Violations of Federal Law and Additional Actions : 1. FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 : All disputed information must be blocked within four ( 4 ) business days upon submission of proper documentation. Despite fulfilling all requirements, including FTC Identity Theft Report, identification, and proof of address, these accounts remain unblocked.

2. IRS Reporting Requirements : The debts associated with the accounts above have been canceled via Form 1099-C and accepted by the IRS. Continuing to report these accounts as valid debts constitutes a misrepresentation of their status. Additionally, this behavior indicates potential violations of tax laws if these debts are used for financial gain or inaccurate reporting purposes.

3. Fraudulent Intent and Misrepresentation : By retaining and profiting from inaccurate and unauthorized information, your actions may violate 18 U.S.C. 1962 ( RICO ) and 18 U.S.C. 894 ( Extortionate Credit Practices ).

4. Whistleblower and Audit Risk : If this noncompliance persists, I will report your activities to the IRS for further investigation and audit. The whistleblower program rewards accurate reporting of tax fraud and abuse, which includes the exploitation of consumer data for monetary gain.

5. Breach of Consumer Rights : Your failure to remove canceled debts constitutes ongoing harm to my financial reputation, with severe consequences for your compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681b and Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act protections. 
Immediate Demands : 1. Immediate Removal of All Accounts Listed : All canceled debts and unauthorized accounts must be removed from my credit report within seven ( 7 ) business days of receiving this notice.

2. Written Confirmation of Compliance : Provide written confirmation that these accounts have been permanently removed and will not be re-reported.

3. IRS Whistleblower Avoidance : Take corrective action immediately to avoid being reported for fraudulent financial practices and unauthorized profit from canceled debts. 
Conclusion : Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX continued failure to comply with federal law is a direct attack on my financial stability and consumer rights. I have met all requirements under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, and the additional inclusion of 1099-C evidence further cements that these accounts have no basis for continued reporting. 
This is your final opportunity to resolve this matter. Failure to comply will result in further escalations, including filing whistleblower complaints with the IRS and pursuing legal remedies for damages under the FCRA, CFPB regulations, and RICO statutes.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. The first payment was due on XX/XX/XXXX, which I paid. The issue I have is that the company has not deducted my payments from the balance and it looks as if I have not made any payment on this car. I have been given extensions, and have been charged late payments even if I pay earlier in the month. 

I have been told that 11 payments were extended. I have asked for the extension paperwork which I have not received. Extensions were explained to me that they go on the back of the loan which extends the length of time that I pay for the car. 

My issue is that the balance owed is incorrect, which makes it look as if I am not paying for the car. When I looked at my Equifax credit report it states incorrectly that I have only made one payment, since XXXX, which is not correct and the car would have been repossessed. I need this corrected on my credit reports to reflect that I have been making payments which should decrease the balance. 

I am being contacted constantly by the company, but have not been able to speak to anyone higher than customer service to get this corrected. When I ask about the balance on the loan and why the payments are not being reported correctly as it should be going down, I am told about the daily interest, 11 extensions, late payments etc. That does not answer the questions I am asking. 

I need the balance reported correctly as I have been paying on this loan since XXXX and it should not reflect the same amount as the beginning balance.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation of the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against EQUIFAX regarding the inaccurate information reported in my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XXXX XX/XX/year> of Credit Report, I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( s ) : Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, last verified, closed date, and last payment. 
Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, date of last activity, balance Owed, and creditor type. 

Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, includi

ng : 1. Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation. 2. Section 611 : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation. 3. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : Removal of unv
erifiable information dont validated for creditor Original.

4. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, EQUIFAX has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted on my creditworthiness. 
In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated 30-day period, as established in 15 U.S. Code 1681i. Additionally, I referenced 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Since these inquiries are not valid, I kindly request your immediate removal from my credit report. 
I previously filed a formal complaint with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) regarding unauthorized inquiries on my credit report. The reference number for that complaint is [ FTC Complaint Number XXXX, filed on FTC Complaint Date XX/XX/XXXX " I am attaching the report of the formal complaint filed with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) as additional support for this claim. This report reinforces my request for the removal of unauthorized inquiries from my credit report, as it details the lack of authorization for these inquiries and the inadequate response from the credit bureau involved. '' Details of Disputed Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX **Additional Legal Support : Cases such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) reinforce that inquiries must meet the FCRA 's permissible purposes requirements. 
Formal Request : I am formally requesting a thorough and manual investigation of the disputed inquiries and their removal if there is no verifiable documentation. I reserve the right to take legal action and file an additional complaint with the CFPB and my state 's Attorney General. 
Sincerely XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently received a copy of my credit report from XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX and I noticed some late payments posted on my report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Account number # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account XXXX # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account XXXX # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account XXXX # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account XXXX # XXXX I m am actively disputing this account across all three credit bureaus Please remove this inaccurate information from my credit report. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number # XXXX Your company ( s ) ( creditors and credit bureaus ) is in clear violation of the law. Under 15 USC 1681b-permisable purpose of consumer reports, The LAW CLEARLY STATES ( a ) In General Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. 
I did not give my written instructions to furnish these accounts on my credit report. 
Furthermore, the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ). Exclusion from a consumer credit report clearly states : ( 2 ) Exclusions- Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ) consumer report does not include ( A ) Subject to 1681s-3 of this title any- Report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report : Delete the above late payments from my consumer report, the creditors and the credit bureaus are in violation of 15 USC 1681 Failure to respond satisfactorily with deletion of the above referred accounts and send out a free copy of my credit report after the changes have been made will result in Legal action being taken against your company, for which I will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation 1. Defamation of Character ( per se ) 2. Negligent Enablement of identity fraud 3. Fair Debt Collections Practices Act 15 USC 1692g violation 4. Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 violation for willful noncompliance-616 Civil Liability for willful non compliance ( 15 USC 1681n ) By the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I demand that these items be reinvestigated and removed from my report. Please remove any information that the creditor can not verify. I understand that under 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1681, you must complete this reinvestigation within 14 days of this receipt. I have included documents and my personal identification to prove my Identity and support my claim. 
Thank you for your time and help in this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

The response provided by your bureau to my prior dispute was insufficient. This collection account remains inaccurate and unverified. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to validation of any alleged debt reported on my credit file. 

Despite my requests, the following critical items have not been provided by XXXX XXXX XXXX : An explanation of the alleged account balance, including a complete XXXX XXXX and payment history. Documentation showing my agreement to this debt, including my signature and authorization for you to report this information. Proof of a valid agreement authorizing XXXX XXXX XXXX to collect this debt. Evidence of their state license to operate and collect debts in my state. The original promissory note and chain of custody for this account. The purchase agreement showing how and why my information was obtained without consent. This lack of documentation raises concerns about the legitimacy of this account and the accuracy of its reporting. Additionally, XXXX XXXX XXXX appears to be in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1692j, furnishing deceptive forms to create a false belief of participation in the collection of this debt, which I have not authorized.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 168b permissible purposes of consumer reports. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

These inquiry was not authorized Account Name : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX has violated my rights. On a list of inquiries : 15 U.S.C. 1681b - Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports : This section outlines that consumer reports can only be furnished under specific conditions. My rights to privacy and confidentiality have been violated as my report was accessed or shared without permissible purpose.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) - Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information : This statute prohibits the furnishing of any information to a consumer reporting agency that is known to be inaccurate or has not been verified. [ Name of Furnisher/Creditor ] has furnished information that is either inaccurate or unverifiable.

15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Right to Privacy : The statute emphasizes the need for consumer reporting agencies to handle consumer information with fairness, impartiality, and respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. This has not been upheld in my case.

15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Requirement for Written Consent : This section specifies that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a consumer report without the consumer 's written instruction. I did not provide written consent for the inquiry or account listed.

15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) - Prohibition of Obsolete Information : This section prohibits the reporting of adverse information older than seven years ( except for records of convictions ). The report in question contains outdated or irrelevant information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this dispute regarding the following accounts, which remain unverified despite my repeated efforts : XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ) : XXXX On XX/XX/year>, I notified the alleged collection agency of their FCRA and FDCPA violations via a CFPB complaint ( # XXXX ). The CFPB has since informed me that the companys response is overdue, and I have attached their email confirmation for reference. 

Under the FDCPA, I requested : Explanation of the account balance. 
Full payment history and audit trail.

Documentation of my consent to this debt and its reporting.

Proof of authorization to collect in my state.

Chain of custody, master bill of sale, purchase agreement, and promissory note for the alleged debt.

Despite allowing ample time, none of these items were provided. The lack of response is a clear violation of FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) and FDCPA regulations. Reporting unverifiable information is prohibited, and failure to validate these accounts obligates their removal from my credit report. 

I demand the immediate deletion of the aforementioned accounts. Continued non-compliance will result in legal action for monetary damages as permitted under federal law.
