Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

Please remove the following items from my credit report, immediately : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation of the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against EQUIFAX regarding the inaccurate information reported in my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XXXX XX/XX/year> of Credit Report, I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( s ) : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, high balance is reported differently in the credit agencies, date of last activity, last payment, and credit. 

Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, including : 1. Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation.

2. Section 611 : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation.

3. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : Removal of unverifiable information dont validated for creditor Original.

4. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, EQUIFAX has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted on my creditworthiness.

In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated 30-day period, as established in 15 U.S. Code 1681i. Additionally, I referenced 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am filing this complaint regarding serious inaccuracies in the reporting of my account with XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) ** by XXXX and Equifax . Specifically, this account falsely reflects late payments in XXXX and XXXX of last year, along with inconsistencies in the reporting details across both credit bureaus. I have taken screenshots documenting these discrepancies as evidence. 

The reporting practices of XXXX XXXX and the credit bureaus violate several provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related U.S. laws. I demand immediate action to address and rectify these violations.

Violations of Federal Law 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports Credit reporting agencies are required to maintain and report accurate consumer information. The blatant inconsistencies and inaccuracies in this case demonstrate a failure to uphold this obligation, resulting in harm to my creditworthiness.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) Dispute Resolution Obligations Upon disputing inaccuracies, credit bureaus must conduct a timely and reasonable investigation. Past attempts to resolve this matter have been ignored or mishandled, failing to meet legal standards for a proper investigation.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Furnisher Responsibility to Report Accurate Information XXXX XXXX , as a furnisher of information, is prohibited from reporting information it knows or should reasonably know to be inaccurate. False late payments violate this provision.

15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) Obsolete Information The inclusion of unverifiable or false late payments contravenes the mandate to exclude inaccurate or outdated information.

15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) Permissible Purposes for Reporting Consumer Information Reporting entities must comply with permissible purposes and ensure consumer data is not misrepresented or mishandled. XXXX XXXX false and conflicting data breaches this obligation. 

Impact of Violations The inaccurate late payments have adversely affected my credit score, jeopardizing my ability to obtain credit on fair terms. This financial and emotional harm is a direct result of negligent and unlawful reporting practices. The FCRA provides consumers with protection against such actions, yet XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax have collectively failed to comply. 

My Requests Immediate Removal of Late Payments : Remove the false late payments reported for XXXX and XXXX of last year from my credit reports. 
Corrections Across All Bureaus : Ensure that my account is accurately reflected across all reporting agencies.

Full Investigation : Conduct a thorough investigation into XXXX XXXX reporting practices and ensure compliance with FCRA standards.

Written Confirmation : Provide written confirmation of receipt of this dispute and resolution updates.

Evidence Provided I have attached screenshots of the inconsistent and inaccurate reporting for your review.

I urge the CFPB to address this matter promptly. The continued disregard for federal law by XXXX XXXX and the credit bureaus demands immediate accountability. I trust that the CFPB will ensure my rights under the FCRA and related statutes are protected. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Unauthorized Credit Inquiries What Happened? 
I have noticed unauthorized inquiries on my credit report that I did not consent to. Upon reaching out to the creditors responsible, they confirmed that they have no record of my initiating these inquiries or providing any verbal or written authorization. Since these inquiries are not valid, I kindly request your immediate removal from my credit report. 
I previously filed a formal complaint with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) regarding unauthorized inquiries on my credit report. The reference number for that complaint is [ FTC Complaint Number XXXX, filed on FTC Complaint Date XX/XX/XXXX " I am attaching the report of the formal complaint filed with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) as additional support for this claim. This report reinforces my request for the removal of unauthorized inquiries from my credit report, as it details the lack of authorization for these inquiries and the inadequate response from the credit bureau involved. The credit bureaus said the accounts were verified but never provided how they verified the account with the documentation that I requested in my letter to them within 30 days. I received no correspondence from XXXX XXXX regarding the debit validation that was sent. How are you able to validate the account but not provide me with the documents I requested? Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit act. The list of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

XXXX XXXX  Account # XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account # XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Account # XXXX has violated my rights. 

I looked at my XXXX credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. According to the fair credit reporting act whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates to according to the 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

According to 15 USC 1681i5 they are supposed to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information.

( A ) In general, in after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of information from is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer or modify that item of information, as appropriate based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 
According to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are not supposed to furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of several derogatory accounts on my consumer report. These inaccuracies violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), XXXX XXXX. XXXX et seq., and the Privacy Protection Act, XXXX XXXX. XXXX. I demand the immediate investigation and correction of these errors. 

Accounts in Dispute XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Balance : {$1000.00} as of XX/XX/2024 Discrepancies : Repeated reporting of the same delinquency months and lack of documentation for the first delinquency date. 
XXXX XXXX ( Secured Loan ) Original Balance : {$1000.00} ; {$290.00} written off Discrepancies : Overlapping charge-off entries without explanation and missing last payment date information. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Credit Card ) Balance : {$1300.00} past due as of XX/XX/2024 Discrepancies : Repeated charge-off reporting over multiple months and missing documentation of the last payment. 
Violations Identified Failure to Ensure Accuracy Under the FCRA, XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( b ), credit reporting agencies must ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information they report. The inaccuracies in payment history, delinquency dates, and balances fail to meet these requirements. 

XXXX of Privacy Reporting inaccurate information violates the Privacy Protection Act, XXXX XXXX. XXXX, by failing to safeguard and verify my nonpublic personal information. 

Rights of Survivors of XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I am protected under federal law, including XXXX XXXX. XXXX. This law invalidates obligations incurred under coercion or duress. Reporting these debts without acknowledgment of these circumstances further harms me and violates consumer protection principles. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  established that XXXX XXXX XXXX  are not obligated to repay debts tied to coercion or exploitation. 
Demands XXXX and Correction of Errors I demand an immediate reinvestigation under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) to correct the inaccuracies in these accounts. This includes : Removal of duplicative and inconsistent payment history.

Verification and documentation of the first delinquency date and last payment date.

Cease-and-Desist Reporting These accounts must be removed from my consumer report until they are validated in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2.

Response Timeline I require acknowledgment of this dispute within five ( 5 ) days and resolution within 30 days, as mandated by the FCRA.

Notice of Limited Communication Under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), I demand a cease-and-desist of all communications regarding these accounts, including reporting to my consumer report. You may contact me solely through written correspondence or via the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) portal. 

Failure to comply with these demands will result in further action, including arbitration, complaints to the CFPB, or legal proceedings under the applicable laws.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute significant inaccuracies in the reporting of multiple accounts on my credit reports, as furnished by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. These inaccuracies, reflected by both XXXX and Equifax, include false reports of late payments and conflicting information, which violate multiple provisions of U.S. law. 

The accounts in question are : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Equifax XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX, Equifax ) Violations of Federal Law The reporting by these entities violates several provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports Credit reporting agencies are legally obligated to ensure that consumer information is accurate. These accounts reflect false late payments and inconsistent data, demonstrating a clear failure to comply. 

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) Dispute Resolution Obligations XXXX and Equifax are required to conduct timely and reasonable investigations upon receiving disputes. Their failure to correct these inaccuracies contravenes this legal requirement. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Furnisher Responsibility to Report Accurate Information XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX are prohibited from furnishing information they know or should reasonably know is inaccurate. False late payments and inconsistent data violate this obligation. 

15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) Permissible Purposes for Reporting Consumer Information Reporting entities must ensure the accuracy and proper handling of consumer data. The discrepancies in these accounts constitute a breach of this legal duty. 

15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) Exclusion of Obsolete or Inaccurate Information The inclusion of unverifiable or inaccurate late payments and inconsistent account data violates the mandate to exclude such information. 

Impact of Violations These inaccuracies have adversely affected my credit score, causing significant financial harm and stress. Such reporting negligence undermines my rights under federal law and diminishes my access to fair credit opportunities. 

My Requests Immediate Corrections : Remove any inaccurate late payments or conflicting data for the accounts listed above. 
Ensure Accuracy : Correct all discrepancies across XXXX and Equifax credit reports. 
Conduct a Full Investigation : Investigate the reporting practices of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for compliance with the FCRA. 
Written Confirmation : Provide written confirmation of the resolution process and actions taken.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against Equifax for failing to verify and correct inaccuracies related to the following accounts on my credit report : XXXX Account # XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # XXXX For the past XXXX months, I have repeatedly disputed these accounts and requested verification, yet Equifax has closed my disputes, claiming the accounts are verified as reported without providing any documentation to support these claims. 

Key Issues and Violations : Failure to Provide Validation : Despite multiple requests, Equifax has not provided any proof that these accounts belong to me, violating my rights under FCRA Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ).

Inconsistent and Contradictory Reporting : The XXXX account is marked as Current but shows late payments, which is contradictory. The late payments make absolutely no logical sense ( attached ) The XXXX XXXX XXXX account has inconsistent high balances and a future reporting date ( XX/XX/2024 ), which is impossible. 
Inaccurate Dates and Balances : The dates of last activity and reported balances vary between bureaus, violating FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ), which mandates accurate reporting.

Failure to Delete Unverified Information : Under FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ), if Equifax can not verify these accounts, they are required to delete them. Their failure to do so is a clear violation.

I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) investigate XXXX failure to comply with the FCRA and mandate the immediate deletion of these accounts from my credit report. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the ( Equifax ) credit reporting agency, block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint.

I am filing this FTC Identity Theft Affidavit to report two fraudulent accounts appearing on my consumer FICO Equifax credit report, which I do not recognize as reported and which are the result of identity theft and fraud. These fraudulent accounts consist of a cellular account opened at XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX and another cellular account opened at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX. Additionally, the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX account includes a fraudulent XXXX late payment reported on XX/XX/XXXX. These accounts and the associated fraudulent late payment have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I demand that the aforementioned fraudulent items be removed from each of my consumer credit reports and that all collection activity related to said items cease pursuant to my rights within the FCRA and FDCPA laws. 

These accounts have resulted in several fraudulent chargeoffs, fraudulent late payments, and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, late payments, or chargeoffs as reported. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and chargeoffs appearing on my consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, late payments, and charge-offs are the result of identity theft and fraud. I demand that the aforementioned fraudulent items be removed from my consumer credit report and that all collection activity related to said items cease pursuant to my rights within the FCRA and FDCPA laws.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
To : XXXX, Equifax and XXXX I am writing to formally address the ongoing inaccuracies and reporting violations on my credit reports. Despite my previous attempts to resolve these issues, the inaccurate information remains, and the credit bureaus have failed to respond appropriately. The continued inaction and false reporting of my personal information are direct violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other applicable federal and state laws. 

Accounts to be Corrected : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) The inaccurate information reported by XXXX on my credit report, including incorrect account status, balances, or any other erroneous reporting, must be corrected. If this account has been reported as open or active while it is closed, or if there are any discrepancies with the dates and balance reported, this must be corrected immediately. 

XXXX XXXX  Similarly XXXX XXXX XXXX  has reported inaccurate information on my credit file. This includes any incorrect account status or outstanding balances that do not reflect the actual state of the account. The account status, dates, and balances reported by XXXX XXXX  must be verified and corrected immediately. 

Unauthorized Hard Inquiries Additionally, I have noticed multiple unauthorized hard inquiries that were made to my credit report without my consent. According to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( c ), no one may obtain a credit report or perform a hard inquiry without my written consent. These inquiries need to be removed immediately as they were made in violation of my rights under the FCRA.

Legal Violations : Failure to Correct Inaccurate Information - 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ) : Under 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ), you are required to investigate and correct any inaccuracies in my credit report upon receiving a dispute. Despite my prior notifications, the inaccuracies remain uncorrected, violating this provision.

Failure to Provide Results of Investigation - 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( i ) : 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( i ) mandates that you conduct a reasonable investigation upon receiving notice of a dispute and provide the results of that investigation. The continued reporting of false information after I have disputed it is a violation of this statute.

Violation of Consumer Protection Laws- HJR 192, REMED, 1099C & 1099A : The HJR 192 REMED resolution and the 1099C and 1099A guidelines require that if a debt is written off or canceled, it must be reported as such, and a 1099-C form should be issued. I have never received such documentation, and the reporting of this debt as active is a clear violation of these rules.

Failure to Remove Inaccurate Information - FCRA Section 611 ( AX1 ) and FCRA Section 605 ( c ) : FCRA Section 611 ( AX1 ) requires the removal of inaccurate or unverifiable information upon investigation. Furthermore, FCRA Section 605 ( c ) restricts the reporting of certain negative information beyond a specific timeframe, and your continued reporting of this account is in violation of this limitation.

Right to Rescind Credit Transactions- 15 U.S. Code 1635 : According to 15 U.S. Code 1635, I have the right to rescind credit transactions under specific circumstances. The continued erroneous reporting of my credit history disregards this right, particularly regarding debts that may be canceled or rescinded.

Debt Collection Violations- 15 U.S. Code 1692 : Under 15 U.S. Code 1692, debt collectors are prohibited from reporting false or misleading information to credit reporting agencies. The account being reported on my credit file is inaccurate, and there has been no action taken to rectify this violation.

Errors in Credit Report : I find that the following information provided on my credit report is an error. This account was never late or owed any amount ( pursuant to HJR 192 REMED ). You are alleging that I owe a debt without furnishing any proof of this debt, including a full accounting ledger or proof of any 1099s that were filed on behalf of my principal. You have failed to demonstrate that you have followed all relevant laws and regulations for reporting this debt.

Therefore, you must remove this account from my credit report immediately.

It is against the law to report any information that has not been proven accurate. Under Georgia law, including provisions found in Georgia Code Title 7 - Banking and Finance, and under relevant statutes such as Georgias Fair Business Practices Act ( FBPA ), a deficiency claim can not be asserted unless all required notices were properly and timely given, and all allowable redemption and cure time limits were adhered to.

Additionally, as outlined in the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are required to adhere to the following provisions : 15 U.S.C. 1692a ( 1-7 ) : Definitions and regulations governing what constitutes fair and unfair practices in debt collection.

15 U.S.C. 1692e ( 1-12 ) : Prohibits false or misleading representations in connection with debt collection.

15 U.S.C. 1692g ( a-c ) : Requires validation of debts upon request, including the provision of evidence supporting any alleged debt.

15 U.S.C. 1666 : Governs billing errors and prohibits creditors from imposing unauthorized fees.

15 U.S.C. 1681 ( a ) : Requires accurate reporting of information and protection of consumer privacy. 

Supreme Court Cases : XXXX XXXX XXXX. Ramirez, 141 S. Ct. 2190 ( 2021 ) : The U.S. Supreme Court XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Ramirez emphasized that a consumer reporting agency must ensure the accuracy and reliability of the information it provides to others. If the information being reported is inaccurate, the consumer has the right to dispute and seek correction. This case reinforces my right to challenge and have corrected any inaccuracies that are being reported about my credit file.

Spokeo , Inc. v. Robins, 136 S. Ct. 1540 ( 2016 ) : In Spokeo v. Robins, the Supreme Court held that a consumer must demonstrate a concrete injury in order to bring a claim under the FCRA. The Court made it clear that when a consumer 's personal information is misused, especially in ways that can harm their financial reputation, they are entitled to seek legal remedies. The inaccurate reporting and unauthorized hard inquiries on my credit report have caused harm, and I am entitled to seek remedies under these precedents.

Consequences of Non-Compliance : The alleged claim of a deficiency is null and void, and any continued collection activities or reporting of this invalid claim on my credit reports will be considered a violation of the FDCPA and FCRA.

If you fail to comply with the above requests, I reserve all rights to seek damages against all parties involved under applicable state, federal, and Georgia-specific remedies.

Legal Demand : Under the FCRA and Georgia law, you are required by law to ensure the accuracy of all information reported. The continued failure to correct these inaccuracies despite repeated notifications is a direct violation of federal consumer protection laws. 

In addition to correcting the inaccuracies, I am entitled to damages under the FCRA, including actual damages, punitive damages up to {$1000.00}, and attorney fees. Moreover, I am entitled to damages for XXXX XXXX  in the amount of {$10000.00} due to the ongoing distress caused by the inaccurate reporting and the misuse of my personal information. 

Total Damages : Actual Damages : To be determined based on the impact this has had on my financial health. 

Punitive Damages : Up to {$1000.00} under the FCRA. 
Attorney Fees : To be determined. 
XXXX XXXX : {$10000.00} each for emotional distress caused by the continued reporting of inaccurate information, unauthorized use of my data, and the failure to correct these errors. 

Risk of Further Legal Claims : As a data furnishing company involved in the buying, selling, transferring, and securitizing accounts and personal information, you are privately profiting off my personal information. This practice not only increases the risk of data breaches but also raises concerns about identity theft. 

These activities expose you to the potential for legal claims due to mishandling consumer data and may place you at significant risk for further legal consequences. I want to make it clear that continuing these practices could expose you to claims related to past data breaches, identity theft, and violations of consumer protection laws.

If this situation is not resolved promptly, you may face additional claims for damages resulting from these violations.

Corrective Action Required : Immediate Removal of the inaccurate information from my credit reports, including the incorrect account status, dates, and balances on all three credit bureaus.

Verification of Debt : Provide proof that the reported debt is accurate, and if it is a written-off account, issue a 1099-C form as required.

Investigation Results : Provide written confirmation that a reasonable investigation has been conducted, and include the results of the investigation and any corrective actions taken.

Removal of Unauthorized Hard Inquiries : All unauthorized hard inquiries on my credit report must be immediately removed, as they were made without my written consent.

Deadline for Resolution : Please correct these errors and provide the requested documentation within 7 days of receipt of this letter. Failure to comply will leave me no choice but to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and pursue legal action to seek damages under the FCRA, Georgia law, and other applicable state and federal laws. 

Conclusion : The continued reporting of these inaccuracies, failure to respond to my disputes, and the false reporting of my personal information have caused significant harm. I expect these issues to be addressed immediately, and I look forward to your prompt resolution of this matter.

Late Payments in XXXX : XXXX XXXX current.

'' So then I gave customer service a call. The phone operator informed me to mail specific documents. So told me to mail a copy of government ID or driver license and the provide a a copy of social security card and then provide a cover letter talking about issue I want resolved. After I mail that the issue should be resolved. Then asked how will you guys contact me or notify me when is issue is resolved are in the process of being resolved. I said should I provide email or phone number she said no. I said how will I know if documents got to thecompany or if you resolved the issue or not. She said just send the documents and you should be good and issue resolved. She Then provided this address to mail documents to Equifax Information Services, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. Documents have been mailed but issue not resloved yet. I've been hearing many other complaints from other consumers online with similar issue I'm having about mailing needed to documents that equifax request to resolve the issue and get your account back and see credit score again but nothing has been done after other consumers mail documents to equifax many weeks to months later. Also many complaints about numerous phone calls given issue still not being resolved. I heard from many other customers easiest and fastest way to resolve issue is to a file CFPB complaint.

Consumer complaint narrative: I cant get a second, updated copy of my credit report in a year I need for a legal proceeding. The only options they give me for a full report is the free credit report option, which Ive already used this year, or call their automated voice input system. I cant get past the automated system which only uses voice input. Ive had speech therapy and I have an unusual pitch range, kind of between male and female that obviously this system has not been trained on. So it cant understand me and it hangs up on me. I have no way to contact customer service without this automated voice system.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Sir/Madam : I am writing in regard to the above-referenced debt to inform you that I am disputing this debt. Please verify the debt as required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. 

I am disputing this debt because I do not owe it. 

Because I am disputing this debt, you should not report it to the credit reporting agencies. If you have already reported it, please contact the credit reporting agencies, inform them that the debt is disputed, and ask them to delete it from my credit report. Reporting information that you know to be inaccurate, or failing to report information correctly, violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 

Finally, please note that I do not wish to receive further telephone calls or letters concerning this debt that I do not owe to your client. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act requires you to respect this request. See 15 U.S.C. 1692 ( c ). Thank you for your attention to this matter. 



Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Dispute and Demand for Removal of Unauthorized/Inaccurate Credit Inquiries To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute and demand the removal of several credit inquiries listed on my credit report that are not attached to any open account and/or were not authorized by me. The presence of these inquiries violates my rights under federal law, specifically the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., which governs the permissible use and accuracy of consumer credit information. 

1. Violation of FCRA Inaccurate Credit Reporting The credit inquiries listed below are not connected to any open or active account, nor were they authorized in compliance with permissible purposes under : 15 U.S.C. 1681b : Permissible purposes of consumer reports. 
Credit inquiries should only appear on a consumers report if they were authorized or resulted from a transaction initiated by the consumer. Reporting unauthorized or inaccurate inquiries constitutes a violation of : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Duty to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer credit information. 
2. Credit Inquiries in Question The following inquiries are inaccurate and must be removed : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Equifax 3. Negative Impact on Credit Profile These inaccurate inquiries are unfairly affecting my credit score and overall creditworthiness, resulting in material harm to my financial reputation. 

4. Request for Immediate Removal of Disputed Inquiries To resolve this matter, I demand that your agency : Investigate and verify each disputed inquiry listed above. 
Immediately remove any inquiry that can not be verified as authorized or attached to an open account. 
Provide a written statement confirming the removal of these inquiries and an updated copy of my credit report reflecting the changes. 

5. Legal Consequences for Non-Compliance Failure to investigate and correct these inaccuracies within the time frame required by law ( 30 days ) may result in legal action to enforce my rights under the FCRA. I will not hesitate to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my states Attorney General if these inquiries are not promptly removed. 

XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am disputing inaccurate and unnecessary personal information on my Equifax credit report, including my name, Social Security number, and date of birth. I requested that Equifax : Correct inaccuracies in my reported name to match my legal documentation. 
Remove my Social Security number and date of birth from the public view of my credit file for privacy and identity protection purposes. 
Equifax responded, stating that my information is accurate. However, they failed to address my request to remove the Social Security number and date of birth for privacy reasons. Additionally, they did not clarify what version of my name is currently being reported, making it unclear whether any correction is necessary. 

This lack of clarity and failure to address my concerns violates my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to dispute inaccuracies and ensure my credit file reflects only necessary information. 

I have attached supporting documentation, including my drivers license and Social Security card, to validate my claims and request.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute fraudulent accounts on my credit reports resulting from identity theft. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent, and their reporting violates multiple provisions of U.S. law, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The accounts in question are : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Account Numbers XXXX XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ) XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ) XXXX  XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX Account Number : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ) Under 15 U.S.C . 1681c-2, I have the right to block and demand removal of information resulting from identity theft. Furthermore, reporting these accounts without my explicit consent violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for accessing and reporting consumer information. I assert that these accounts were created and reported unlawfully, and I never provided consent for such reporting. 

I have attached an identity theft affidavit and additional supporting documentation. Please ensure these accounts are removed from my credit reports immediately. 

I request written confirmation of receipt of this dispute and updates regarding the resolution process. I also remind you of your obligation to address these violations promptly under 15 U.S.C. 1681i. 

Thank you for your urgent attention to this matter.

I informed them I did not owe them a debt and refused to pay them, that I never signed a contract with them, and citing15 USC 1c92c ( if a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer ). Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax for Reporting Inaccurate Information and Violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau From : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Complaint Against : XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax -- XXXX Introduction I am submitting this updated formal complaint against XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax for their repeated violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). These credit bureaus have reported inaccurate, misleading, and harmful information on my credit reports. The ongoing reporting errors, inconsistencies, and outdated information are causing significant harm to my financial stability, creditworthiness, and reputation. 

The following violations and errors must be investigated and addressed immediately. 


-- - Accounts in XXXX and Errors Identified XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** Reported solely by XXXX XXXX " Refinanced, '' with a " XXXX XXXX, '' which creates confusion regarding the true standing of this account. 

The account was closed on XX/XX/XXXX, and the balance is {$0.00} ; however, the status mismatch remains unresolved. 

XXXX and Equifax fail to report this account, leaving XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 



XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** Reported solely by Equifax XXXX marked as " Late 120 Days, '' without substantiated evidence. 

Balance discrepancies : Equifax reports a balance of {$470.00} with a {$0.00} limit, but no transactions justify the listed status. 


Payment discrepancies : The last payment is listed as {$0.00} with a date of XX/XX/XXXX, making the late payment reporting inaccurate. 




XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) ** XXXX and Equifax report inconsistent balances : XXXX XXXX {$9000.00} remaining from {$10000.00}. 

Equifax : {$8900.00} remaining from {$10000.00}. 


XXXX fails to report this account altogether. 



XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** Utilization exceeds XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which is inaccurate and misleading. 

Discrepancies in reporting payments and balances across bureaus : XXXX and Equifax report a balance of {$12000.00} with a {$12000.00} limit. 

XXXX fails to report this account entirely. 




XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** This account is marked as " XXXX '' and " Closed, '' but Equifax XXXX a {$1300.00} limit while XXXX XXXX a {$0.00} limit. 

XXXX fails to report this account entirely, creating a reporting inconsistency. 



XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** XXXX XXXX a {$0.00} balance with a {$33000.00} limit, but XXXX and Equifax XXXX to report this account entirely, omitting critical financial information. 



XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) ** Reported as " Late 90 Days '' with discrepancies in balances : XXXX XXXX {$25000.00}. 

XXXX and Equifax : {$25000.00}. 




XXXX. Address Errors Correct Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TN XXXX. 

XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax continue to report an outdated address, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TN XXXX, causing miscommunication and further inaccuracies. 





-- - Violations Committed by the Credit Bureaus 1. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Duty to Ensure Maximum Possible Accuracy The credit bureaus have failed to ensure the accuracy of the reported information, including address discrepancies, status mismatches, and unjustified derogatory marks.

2. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation Despite formal disputes and notifications, the credit bureaus have failed to investigate or correct the inaccuracies on my credit reports.

3. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) Duties of Furnishers of Information By allowing furnishers to report inaccurate and outdated information, the credit bureaus have enabled the violation of their duties under federal law.

4. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) Reporting of Obsolete Information Derogatory marks on closed and paid accounts, such as XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX are misleading and obsolete. 



XXXX. Failure to XXXX Update Credit Files ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) ) The credit bureaus have failed to update or delete inaccurate information, including outdated addresses and incorrect account statuses, despite being notified of these errors. 



XXXX. Defamation and Harm to Credit Reputation By publishing false and outdated information, the credit bureaus have defamed my creditworthiness, resulting in financial harm and denial of credit opportunities. 



XXXX. Failure to Report Data Consistently Across Bureaus The account data for XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX Card is inconsistent across XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax. 



XXXX. Negligence in XXXX XXXX XXXX and others have failed to update my current address, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TN XXXX, and continue to report an outdated address. 



XXXX. Failure to Notify Creditors of Disputes ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) ) The credit bureaus have failed to notify creditors that these accounts are disputed, violating federal requirements and further damaging my financial stability. 





-- - Impact of the Violations These violations have resulted in a significant drop in my credit scores, making it challenging to access loans, credit, or favorable interest rates. 

The inaccuracies in reporting, such as address errors and mismatched account statuses, have created confusion for creditors, damaging my financial reputation. 

The continued reporting of derogatory marks on paid and closed accounts has caused both financial and emotional distress. 



-- - Requested Action I request the CFPB to investigate the repeated violations committed by XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax and enforce the appropriate penalties under the FCRA. These inaccuracies must be corrected immediately to prevent further harm. 


-- - Conclusion The actions of these credit bureaus demonstrate a failure to uphold their obligations under federal law. I urge the CFPB to take swift action to ensure compliance, accountability, and the correction of my credit reports. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation of the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against EQUIFAX regarding the inaccurate information reported in my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XXXX XX/XX/year> of Credit Report, I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( XXXX ) : Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, last verified, closed date, and last payment. 
Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, date of last activity, balance Owed, and creditor type. 

Under Section XXXX of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, including : XXXX. Section XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation. 
XXXX. Section XXXX : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation. 
XXXX. Section XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) : Removal of unverifiable information dont validated for creditor XXXX. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, EQUIFAX has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted on my creditworthiness. 
In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated XXXX period, as established in XXXX XXXX Code XXXX. Additionally, I referenced XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I AM OUTRAGED AND DEEPLY DISAPPOINTED THAT YOU HAVE FAILED TO REPORT MY CLAIMS IN A MANNER THAT COMPLIES WITH THE REQUIRED STANDARDS, AND I AM DEMANDING IMMEDIATE CORRECTIVE ACTION. THIS LETTER SERVES AS MY FORMAL AND UNEQUIVOCAL DISPUTE REGARDING THE CLAIMS REPORTED IN THE NOTICE. 
YOU HAVE BLATANTLY FAILED TO FOLLOW THE MANDATORY METRO 2 DATA-FILLED FIELD FORMATTED REPORTING STANDARDS, AND I CHALLENGE YOU TO PROVIDE CLEAR, IRREFUTABLE EVIDENCE THAT EACH CLAIM WAS REPORTED PROPERLY. 
LET ME MAKE THIS ABUNDANTLY CLEAR : I DO NOT DISPUTE THE VALIDITY OF THE CLAIMS THEMSELVES, BUT I ABSOLUTELY CONTEST YOUR FAILURE TO REPORT THEM IN FULL COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL LAW. ACCORDING TO THE LAW, YOU ARE LEGALLY OBLIGATED TO ENSURE THAT EVERY SINGLE CLAIM IS REPORTED WITH THE HIGHEST DEGREE OF ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS. THE WAY THESE CLAIMS HAVE BEEN REPORTED IS NOT ONLY INADEQUATEIT IS ILLEGAL.

UNDER CRRG 3-4, THE CLAIMS YOU HAVE REPORTED ARE QUESTIONABLE AT BEST AND LIKELY UNLAWFUL IN THEIR EXECUTION. IT IS UNACCEPTABLE FOR MY PERSONAL AND FINANCIAL REPUTATION TO BE HARMED BY YOUR NEGLIGENCE, AND I AM DEMANDING THAT YOU IMMEDIATELY CORRECT THE RECORD. 
Account : XXXX Account # XXXX I was never late on this account. Reporting accurate on other bureaus but late on this one. Under 15 USC 1666B this is a billing error. Always paid as agreed. 
Account : XXXX XXXX Account XXXX XXXX I was never late on this account. Under 15 USC 1666B this is a billing error. Always paid as agreed.

THESE ACCOUNTS WERE PAID. THIS CREDITOR VIOLATES MY RIGHTS UNDER 15 U.S.

Code 1 1666c - PROMPT AND FAIR CREDITING OF PAYMENTS.

( a ) PAYMENTS RECEIVED FROM AN OBLIGOR UNDER AN OPEN-END CONSUMER CREDIT PLAN BY THE CREDITOR SHALL BE POSTED PROMPTLY TO THE OBLIGORS ACCOUNT AS SPECIFIED IN REGULATIONS OF THE BUREAU. 
SUCH REGULATIONS SHALL PREVENT A FINANCE CHARGE FROM BEING IMPOSED ON ANY OBLIGOR IF THE CREDITOR HAS RECEIVED THE OBLIGORS PAYMENT IN READILY IDENTIFIABLE FORM, BY XXXXXXXX XXXX ON THE DATE ON WHICH SUCH PAYMENT IS DUE, IN THE AMOUNT, MANNER, AND LOCATION INDICATED BY THE CREDITOR TO AVOID THE IMPOSITION THEREOF. 
THIS IS CLEARLY A VIOLATION OF MY RIGHTS AND I WILL TAKE FURTHER ACTION TO MAKE SURE MY RIGHTS ARE BEING PROTECTED. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information. After any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 
I WILL WAIT FOR YOUR RESPONSE IN WRITING.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation of the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against EQUIFAX regarding the inaccurate information reported in my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On XXXX XX/XX/2024 of Credit Report, I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( XXXX ) : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, last verified, closed date, and last payment. 
Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : Inaccuracies, account number is reported as incomplete, date of last activity, balance Owed, and creditor type. 

Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, including : 1. Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation.

2. Section 611 : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation.

3. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : Removal of unverifiable information dont validated for creditor Original.

4. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, EQUIFAX has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted on my creditworthiness.

In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated 30-day period, as established in 15 U.S. Code 1681i. Additionally, I referenced 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My Robinhood has been locked and restricted since the XXXX of XXXX. It is now XX/XX/XXXX. 

I have XXXX $ in there that they have locked from me that is mine for some unknown reason. Originally it said once I turned in documents that the next day it would unlock my account. So I uploaded the documents that very day. 

Friday the XXXX of XXXX comes and it says they are reviewing my docs I submitted and they would get back to me on XX/XX/year>. 

So I waited then on the XXXX it said the second and on the second it said the third and it has just kept pushing back the review date and they havent let me access my own money. 

I called Robinhood and they make it so difficult to get a hold of the. I got in a queue for them to call my about my issue. They call me XX/XX/XXXX and ask me what the inquiry was about. I explained to them my account has been frozen and that the day my docs are supposed to be review the date just keep getting pushed back. 

Then she started asking me about crypto transfers I have been making and if I plan on making more transfers in the future. I answered all the questions and then they said that they would review the info and get back to me. Well since that Wednesday it still says they are in the process of reviewing everything but I turned in my necessary docs a long time ago and they are just holding money that is mine and not letting me withdraw it. Could you guys please resolve this for me.

Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I opened a Robinhood account. Between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX i made three instant deposits/transfers from my checking accounts to my Robinhood account totaling {$1300.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to do make an instant transfer of {$1000.00} to my XXXX account and it didn't show on my available balance on XXXX. I tried to make several more attempts and they never showed up available as purchasing power. Worried that I did something wrong, I looked at my history and it had them as deposits, not instant deposits and they were set to be available in 4-5 days. I cancelled all but one of those deposits and left one {$1000.00} deposit that was set to be available out in 4-5 days. When I got home later in the day, I did some reading on why the instant deposits were not available. In my reading I found that only {$2000.00} were available for instant deposits in the beginning. I then understood that I could use my debit card for instant deposits from then forward. So, I entered my debit card, provided my ID and set of live selfies when prompted. My debit card was then authorized, and I used it to deposit another {$1000.00} into my Robinhood account. Shortly after I purchased another {$250.00} of crypto. After that I turned on two factor authorization using my phone for more protection. Around, XXXX I set up XXXX transfers on the Robinhood app. Around XXXX I sent a small amount of crypto to my secure storage/wallet to make sure there were no hiccups. Shortly after that I attempted to transfer the remainder of my crypto at the time to the same storage wallet. It was declined and within 5 mins my account was restricted. I can genuinely state that I am thankful for security. However, what Robinhood is doing now is nothing less than fraud. When the account was restricted, it asked for a copy of my ID and three more live selfies. I promptly provided the documentation. I received a message on the app stating that Robinhood would review the documents and get back with me by XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX the date was changed to XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX it was changed to XX/XX/XXXX and so on. I will provide screenshots of this showing the XXXX giving an example. Every time I attempt to contact support it gives a message to take action. Then at the bottom there is only one response available, " Yes, that's all ''. This is the response i have gotten every day since XX/XX/XXXX, what a joke? I have attempted to request a call back, Robinhoods support system stated it did not recognize my telephone number. I will provide a screen shot of me using two factor authorization and them using my telephone number showing that there is no reason to claim they don't recognize the number. I have reached out on XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  to their support bot, that's been no help. I have received four emails with case numbers ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ), when I call the provided number ( XXXX ) in the email, it states they can not verify the case numbers. I have screenshots from the Help bot stating they will call. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a pop-up text stating that Robinhood had attempted to call me. My phone had never rung, and my call log will prove that through my telephone service provider. I checked my email, and I received an email at XXXX XXXX XXXX stating that Robinhood noticed some unusual activity on my account and tried to call me on XX/XX/XXXX, it gave instructions on how to request a call through the app. I have attempted to do exactly as instructed and there is no option to request a call with their instructions given. On the app and there was a message for me to request a call. When I tap the request a call area it does absolutely nothing. Look Robinhood has had my info for over a week, they have received no less than three copies of my ID both front and back as well as 5 sets of live selfies though the app and computer. They are giving me the run around and I know that this isn't the only occurrence. There are people on social media talking about it. If any other emails, screenshots, records are needed, please let me know. After recently researching Robinhoods past they are known to do shady stuff and are not consumer friendly at all. There is no live or even live email support. I've lost opportunity and money as a result of their actions. I am just thankful that it wasn't a huge sum of money tied up with them and can wait them out to do the right thing. Either by choice or through the legal system as I am filing a complaint with my State AG this week as well. The fact that I am offering copies of all correspondence, screenshots, and making a complaint through a GOVERNMENT WEBSITE should state that I am who I say I am and have nothing to hide. I have yet to be told why my account is restricted other than unusual activity. I am inclined to say it was my attempt to transfer my crypto out of Robinhood. Or it may be that i cancelled some deposits and used my debit card. Again, their communication is leading me to believe that something illegal or shady is going on with Robinhood as I am reading similar occurrences happening more and more and this no communication game is their MO.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX for XXXX significant violations of my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation of Disputed Information : On XX/XX/2024, I filed a dispute with XXXX regarding inaccuracies in my credit report. I explicitly requested a manual review of the disputed information due to its complexity. I provided clear supporting evidence, including highlighted copies of my credit report identifying the errors. However, XXXX used the E-Oscar system to process my dispute electronically rather than conducting the manual review I requested. This process fails to ensure a thorough investigation, as required under the FCRA. 
The response I received was vague and did not provide sufficient detail regarding the methods, sources, or procedures used to verify the disputed information. My specific questions about the investigation process remain unanswered. 
2. Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance by a Collection Agency : Account Name Account Number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. Despite my dispute, XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX continue to report this collection account without verifying its validity or requiring the collection agency to issue a 1099-C. This raises questions about the legitimacy of the debt and violates federal regulations.

Key Violations : 1. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation : o XXXX violated 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) by failing to conduct a manual review of my dispute as explicitly requested.

o The use of E-Oscar resulted in an inadequate and incomplete investigation.

2. Failure to Provide Details of Investigation : o XXXX failed to provide the methods, sources, and documentation used in their investigation, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 4 ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ).

3. Inaccurate Reporting and Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance : o XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX continue to report inaccurate information, violating my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

o The collection agencys failure to issue a 1099-C for canceled or forgiven debt violates IRS regulations and raises concerns about the accounts validity.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is directly focused on Robinhoods unacceptable customer support practices. The company is unable to handle support tickets, as evidenced by two of my most recent interactions with them. After a disruption of my ability to trade cryptocurrencies on Robinhood, I opened a chat with their customer support. As seen on the attached transcript, the company notified me at XXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX that their service support team is experiencing longer than normal wait times, encouraging me to cancel my case. I continued receiving the same message through XX/XX/XXXX at XXXXXXXX XXXX at which point an agent joined the chat and proceeded to close it due to a lack of response on my end ( given that it was 10 hours after my initial message and, considering the time of day, I did not see their note until later that morning ). 

Given the importance of their platform for financial transactions, not having functional support is unacceptable and can potentially cost customers significant losses. Robinhoods inability to address critical issues promptly undermines user confidence and poses a serious risk to its customers. I urge the CFPB to investigate these deficiencies to prevent further harm to consumers and to compel Robinhood to strengthen its customer support practices to address the deplorable level of service they are currently providing.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax has failed to comply with its obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) and 611, in handling my dispute regarding fraudulent information on my credit report. 

Previous Dispute Submitted to Equifax : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  CFPB Case Number : XXXX Equifax recently closed my dispute without blocking the fraudulent late payment. This violates FCRA 605B, which mandates that fraudulent information be blocked from a consumer 's credit report within four business days of receiving proper documentation. 

I am a victim of identity theft and the Equifax data breach. The fraudulent late payment pertains to an auto loan opened at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, under account number XXXX. It was reported as delinquent in XX/XX/XXXX. I do not recognize this late payment or the account and have provided substantial evidence supporting my claim, including : A valid identity theft affidavit ( FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX ) Proof of address A copy of my government-issued identification Documentation linking me to the Equifax data breach Despite receiving this evidence, Equifax failed to block the disputed items within the four business days required by FCRA 605B . Instead, they " verified '' the fraudulent accounts without disclosing the sources or evidence used, violating FCRA 611. 

Equifax has not blocked the fraudulent late payment from my credit file, as required under 605B of the FCRA. This non-compliance is particularly egregious given that I am a known victim of the Equifax data breach. 

Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation ( FCRA 611 ) Equifax 's investigation did not meet the standards outlined in 611. They failed to provide details of their verification process, including the sources and furnishers contacted. This lack of transparency undermines my right to accurate credit reporting.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally dispute the reporting and handling of account, as it contains several violations of my rights under federal law. Specifically, under 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to privacy, which has been violated by furnishing or sharing my account information without my express written consent. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish account information without my explicit written instructions, which I have not provided. Furthermore, per 15 U.S.C. 1681a paragraph ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), transactions improperly reported that do not meet consumer reporting standards should be excluded from my consumer report. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1666b, a creditor may not treat payments on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose unless proper notice is mailed to the consumer at least 21 days before the due date. To my knowledge, I did not receive any such notice or statement. Lastly, 15 U.S.C. 1637b requires that creditors provide clear and timely disclosures of payment terms, which I did not receive in relation to this account. Based on these violations, I demand the immediate removal of all late payments associated with this account from my credit report, written confirmation that any improperly included transactions have been removed, and proof that all required notices and disclosures were properly sent.

Consumer complaint narrative:
ACCOUNTS : XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX After I received correspondence from your agency, it stated that the accounts I disputed were verified by your agency. Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) 1 ( a ), I am demanding that your agency perform a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the status of the disputed information.

Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) please complete this inaccurate account or delete it from my consumer reports.

The Law Cleary States : ( a ) Reinvestigations of disputed information ( 1 ) Reinvestigation required ( A ) In general Subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller.

I DO NOT consent to any E-OSCAR verification as this method is not reliable or lawful, according to the standards set for by the FCRA.

I am requesting that you validate the following items non-electronically, by performing a reasonable and FAIR re-investigation : Please provide the following details of the methods by which you verified these accounts : a. Identity and position of the representative contacted?

b. Date, duration, and substance of the conversation?

c. Contact details utilized?

d. Identity, position, and tenure of your company 's employees involved?

e. Details of formal training imparted to said employee?

f. Copies of all written correspondence?

Your agency also seems to be in violation of non-compliance and negligent non-compliance with being in direct violation or the following laws : 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court. 
( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater. 

These are now multiple attempts to handle this matter privately. If these accounts keep getting verified by a faulty e-Oscar system when I know these accounts are erroneous and destroying my credit worthiness, I will in fact sue your agency for the maximum monetary damages that the FCRA allows. 

Your agency has less than 30 days to respond with a fair reasonable re-investigation or I will have no choice but to seek legal action. This investigation must be validated by the information that I have listed above. If the information is not validated, then it must be deleted immediately from my consumer report!

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I received a letter from Midland Credit Management , Inc., attempting to collect a debt. On XX/XX/year>, I responded with a Debt Validation Request under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), requesting validation of the debt, including documentation of its validity, details of the original creditor, and proof of ownership of the debt.

I received no response to my request for validation within the legally required 30-day timeframe. Instead, Midland Credit Management , Inc. continued their collection attempts, including contacting me via email on XX/XX/year>, XXXX, despite my explicit request for all communication to be conducted in writing via USPS mail. 
The failure to validate the debt within the required timeframe and their continued collection attempts are violations of federal law, including : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1692g : Failure to validate the debt.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) : Continuing collection activity on a disputed debt.

In addition, their email communication disregarded my written request for USPS correspondence only, further violating my rights. 
The letter they sent also imposed an improper deadline of XX/XX/year>, which did not allow the 30 days to dispute the debt, as guaranteed by federal law. 
I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) investigate these violations and ensure Midland Credit Management , Inc. complies with the FDCPA by ceasing all collection activities until proper validation of the debt is provided.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to CFPB regarding the above-referenced account. Pursuant to my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, I am formally requesting validation of the alleged debt you claim I owe.

In order to comply with federal law, please provide the following documentation : 1. Proof of Ownership : A signed contract or agreement with my signature that verifies I owe this debt to your company or the original creditor.

2. Chain of Custody : Documentation showing the transfer or assignment of the debt from the original creditor to your agency, confirming that you have the legal right to collect this debt.

3. Itemized Breakdown : A complete and itemized statement of the alleged debt, including the original amount, any fees or interest applied, and the current balance.

4. Original Creditor Information : Complete contact information for the original creditor, along with a copy of any billing statements or other communications sent by them.

5. Proof of Compliance with State Laws : Any documentation verifying that you are licensed to collect debts in my state of residence and that the statute of limitations for collecting this debt has not expired.

6. Reporting to Credit Bureaus : Documentation showing that the debt has been reported accurately to any credit reporting agencies, including the dates of reporting and any disputes noted. 

By law, you are required to cease all collection activities and communication with me until you provide all of the requested information. I await your response. 

Please note, any failure to provide sufficient validation within the legally required time frame will result in your claim being considered invalid, and I will demand that you remove all references to this alleged debt from my credit report with all major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ).

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Sued you without properly notifying you of lawsuit
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against JMC Leasing Specialties , LLC regarding illegal garnishment actions initiated against me in connection with a repossession. The company violated federal law by garnishing my wages/funds without proper notice or due process. 

Key Violations : Failure to Provide Notice : JMC Leasing Specialties , LLC failed to send me prior written notice regarding their intent to garnish, as required by federal law, including 15 U.S. Code 1692 ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ) and applicable state laws.

Improper Garnishment Process : No documentation or legal basis for the garnishment was provided, violating 31 U.S. Code 3718, which governs debt collection practices, including repossession-related actions. 

Lack of Transparency : The company did not provide a breakdown of the alleged debt, including the original balance, interest, fees, or other charges, leaving me unable to verify or dispute the claim.

Impact on Me : The illegal garnishment has caused : Financial hardship, as funds were taken from my account without notice. 
Emotional distress due to the companys failure to follow legal procedures and respect my rights.

Consumer complaint narrative: I received a {$50.00} Amex prepaid gift card as a gift either late last year or earlier this year. I did not try to use it until recently ( XX/XX/year> ). On my first attempt, the card was declined ( card does not expire until XX/XX/year> ). I called Amex customer service and they said my card was compromised. Thus, they sent me a replacement card, and the new card came in the mail about one week later. I activated the card and tried to use the new card ( which was listed as active when looking up the card/balance on their website ), however the card still declined. I called their customer service again, and they informed me that I just need to try again and make sure to enter the 3 digit security code when purchasing. I followed all instructions from customer service rep when trying to purchase again, however my card was still declined. Im aware this is a widespread issue with many other individuals with this Amex prepaid gift card. Amex needs to provide me with a refund and fix this problem so other people do not get scammed out of their hard earned money.

Please note that withholding the information you received from any medical provider in an attempt to be HIPAA compliant will violate the FDCPA because you will be deceiving me after my written request. I am requesting complete documentation of what you received from the service provider regarding this alleged debt. Consumer complaint narrative:
Over 30 days ago, XX/XX/year>, I sent verifed letters to dispute the account PORTFOLIO RECOVERY ASSOCIATES XXXX, which is a debt buyer account. I have not recieved any verified information that this company has any right to collect and or report this account to my credit report. I am requested validation of this debt under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). And did not receive any of the following : proof that I owe the debt, including a copy of the original signed agreement or contract. The name and address of the original creditor, along with an itemized statement of the debt ( principal, interest, fees, etc. ). Documentation showing that you are legally authorized to collect this debt, including proof of assignment or ownership of the account. A detailed payment history of the account, from inception to the present. 

I would also like to request that you cease all collection activities, including reporting this debt to credit bureaus, due to no validation. 

I request that you immediately cease collection efforts, remove any reporting related to this debt from all credit bureaus, and notify me of your compliance in writing.
