Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative: I have disputed a public bankruptcy letter on my credit report with Equifax more than once. Then, I asked for a method of verification letter which they were required to respond to within 15 days and they failed to do so. They reinserted it on my credit report that it had been verified through XXXX XXXX and the bankruptcy courts, but that was simply not true. XXXX XXXX, nor the bankruptcy courts verify public records with Equifax, XXXX, or XXXX. The record has been removed from XXXX XXXX and since Equifax claimed that it was verified through them, it wasn't, then Equifax has to remove it immediately. Furthermore, the Supreme Court has ruled that section 349 of the bankruptcy code was intended to UNDUE the bankruptcy and to restore BOTH parties to pre-petition financial status. How does a PRIVATE company like Equifax think that it's okay to override the highest court in the United States of America? I can't dispute anything with Equifax because they repeatedly send me letters stating that my ID was not clear, even though it obviously is, because all the other bureaus accepted it, and it was sent at the same time. I feel like this is a worn-out stall tactic that Equifax uses in order REQUIR to evade the law. I'm wondering if they will come up with that same excuse now. EQUIFAX IS REQUIRED BY LAW TO REMOVE THIS ENTRY. XXXX XXXX informed me that they will also notify Equifax since they are the ones who reported it, even though they don't verify it. Obviously, this shouldn't be on my report since it was removed from XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX! I have uploaded proof as well. XXXX XXXX removed it only after I reported them to the XXXX  and CFPB.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Report provided to employer without your written authorization
Consumer complaint narrative:
Under 15 USC 6802, a financial institution is prohibited from disclosing nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the following conditions are met : The institution provides a clear and conspicuous disclosure to the consumer, in writing, electronically, or through another permitted form, stating that such information may be shared with third parties.

The consumer is given the opportunity, prior to the initial disclosure, to opt-out of having their information shared.

The institution provides an explanation of how the consumer can exercise this opt-out right.

In this case, the financial institution failed to inform me of my rights or provide the required disclosures to protect my privacy. Furthermore, I have become aware that my personal information was compromised in a data breach, representing another significant violation of my privacy rights.

Consumer complaint narrative:
LexisNexis XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute and Request for Removal of Incorrect Information Dear LexisNexis Consumer Center XXXX Please accept this formal letter as my first request to investigate and remove derogatory accounts/items from my consumer report. Going over my report, I have found it has errors. It has come to my attention that you are reporting what I believe to be inaccurate data, which I dispute, and this letter is an appeal for your assistance. As a consumer reporting agency, 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( o ), you are governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, et seq., which protects consumers from inaccurate, outdated, or invalidated information reporting of their consumer file. The FCRA states that it's the consumer reporting agency 's responsibility to ensure that all information contained within consumer files is accurate and free from errors. Your company is regularly engaged in the business of assembling, evaluating, and disbursing information concerning consumers for the purpose of furnishing consumer reports, as defined in 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( d ), to third parties.

According to federal law, you are required to comply with the requirements imposed under the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., including but not limited to : Follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information in the consumer report, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). This section imposes a high and often disregarded standard on consumer reporting agencies. See, e.g., XXXXXXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX. XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, at XXXX ( XXXX. XXXX XXXX. XXXX, XXXX ) ( breaking down the requirements of 1681e ( b ), and explaining that 'assure ' means to make sure or certain ; put beyond all doubt, '' 'maximum ' means the greatest in quantity or highest degree attainable ; and 'possible ' means something falling within the bounds of what may be done, occur, or be conceived. '' ( quoting XXXX 's XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ) ) : Comply with the investigation requirements, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ; Should not provide consumer files to companies without determining that these companies had a permissible purpose to obtain consumer files pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ; Provide consumer file pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681g. 

Accordingly, I request your company to provide veritable documentary proof ( e.g., original consumer contract or similar proof bearing my wet ink signature on it ) you have on file. 

I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of the information in my LexisNexis report. Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative: I have identified significant discrepancies in the handling of this matter, which raise serious concerns under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 1. Cease and Desist Demand Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), I am hereby instructing your organization to immediately cease and desist from all collection activities related to the aforementioned account. This includes, but is not limited to : Initiating or continuing phone calls to me regarding this matter. Sending written or electronic correspondence. Reporting or updating any information regarding this account to consumer reporting agencies. Failure to adhere to this demand constitutes a clear violation of federal law and may subject your organization to additional liability. 2. Debt Validation Request Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ), I am formally disputing this alleged debt and demanding full validation of its legitimacy. Validation must include, but is not limited to : A detailed, itemized accounting of the alleged balance, including principal, interest, and all fees assessed. Copies of any agreements, contracts, or other documentation that establish my legal obligation to pay this debt. Evidence that your organization has the legal authority to collect this debt, such as proof of assignment or ownership. Documentation of any payments made by me or third parties, including insurance providers. Until such time as this validation is provided, I expect all collection activities, including reporting to consumer credit bureaus, to cease immediately. 3. Pre-Arbitration Notice This letter also constitutes a Pre-Arbitration Notice in accordance with applicable law and contractual agreements. If this matter is not resolved to my satisfaction within 15 days of receipt of this letter, I intend to initiate arbitration. Please be advised that the costs associated with arbitration proceedings, including filing fees and daily administrative costs, are likely to exceed {$2000.00} per day, not including the legal fees your organization may incur. In addition, under most arbitration agreements, your organization will be required to bear the majority, if not all, of these costs. 4. Demands for Resolution To resolve this matter expeditiously and avoid further escalation, I demand the following : The immediate removal of this account from all consumer credit reporting agencies. Payment of {$5000.00} in damages for the emotional distress, XXXX, and reputational harm caused by your mishandling of this matter. A full cessation of all collection activities until this dispute is resolved and proper validation has been provided. Conclusion This matter requires your immediate attention. Failure to respond in a timely manner with the requested information and actions will leave me no alternative but to pursue all available remedies, including arbitration or legal action. Please direct all correspondence and documentation to my address listed above. Your compliance within the legally prescribed timeframe is both expected and required. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Debt collection
Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: I was simply doing some research the evening of XX/XX/year>, as my wife and I need just a little bit extra here in XXXX. I filled out some basic information. When I got the indicator that my next payment was going to be due on my next payday and it was like over {$600.00} dollars, I was aghast and got a hold of the loan document, to realize the percentage rate was 497.27 %. I was not going to go forward with this. I get emails asking me to review and e-sign with a link, which I did not click nor did I e-sign. Yet, next I get an email indicating I was approved, and they would be sending the money along. Consumer complaint narrative:
Target Card Services XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Reporting Request for Removal, 1099-C Issuance, and Cease-and-Desist Notice Account Number : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of the above-referenced account and to demand immediate corrective action pursuant to federal consumer protection laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq.

1. Dispute of Account Reporting This account has been reported as written off as a profit/loss ( charge-off ). However, I have identified that the account is being repeatedly reported as a new charge-off account with an outstanding balance, despite being previously written off. This constitutes inaccurate and misleading reporting in violation of the FCRA, specifically : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Duty to ensure maximum possible accuracy of information.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Duty to investigate disputes regarding furnished information.

By continuing to report this account inaccurately, Target Card Services is damaging my creditworthiness, resulting in defamation of character and material harm to my financial reputation.

2. Request for 1099-C Issuance As the account has been charged off, I am requesting that you provide a copy of the IRS Form 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ). The issuance of this form is required when a debt is canceled or written off and no longer collectible. Failure to provide this required documentation further demonstrates non-compliance with applicable consumer protection laws.

3. Cease-and-Desist Notification Under the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), this letter serves as a formal cease-and-desist notice regarding all collection efforts related to this account. You are instructed to cease all forms of communication with me, including but not limited to phone calls, emails, or letters, regarding this account.

4. Demand for Resolution To resolve this matter, I demand the following actions be taken within 30 days : Immediately correct and remove the inaccurate information from all credit reporting agencies.

Provide a copy of the IRS Form 1099-C for the cancellation of this account, if applicable.

Confirm in writing that you have ceased all collection activities and communications related to this account.

Failure to comply with this dispute may result in legal action to enforce my rights under federal law. I will not hesitate to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my states Attorney General if this issue is not promptly resolved. 

Sincerly, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
XXXX XXXX : # XXXX, XXXX : # XXXX, XXXX : # XXXX, XXXX : # XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : # XXXX, XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX ) # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX  # XXXX, XXXX # XXXX, XXXX # XXXX, XXXX XXXX # XXXX has violated my rights. 

I looked at my XXXX credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). 

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

VALIDATION AND CEASE AND DESIST Portfolio Recovery Associates Disputes Department XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dear CEO of Portfolio Recovery Associates I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor.

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed. 
XXXX. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor. 
XXXX. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt. 
XXXX. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor. 
Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 
Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing in response to XXXX XXXX letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, regarding my dispute over the charged-off account ending in XXXX. Your continued refusal to address the substance of my dispute, properly validate the debt, or remedy the violations under applicable laws leaves me no choice but to escalate this matter. If a resolution is not achieved within 15 days, I will file for arbitration under the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) rules, as outlined in your Consumer Credit Card Customer Agreement. 

Additionally, I have been a victim of XXXX XXXX, which has directly impacted the alleged debts in question. This information necessitates additional protections and remedies under federal and state laws. I urge you to review precedent where such debts were deemed invalid under these extraordinary circumstances. 

Key Issues and Legal Grounds Failure to Validate the Debt Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are required to provide adequate validation of debts and ensure the accuracy of information reported.

Case Law : In Saunders v. Branch Banking & Trust Co., 526 F.3d 142 ( 4th Cir. 2008 ), the court held that failing to report a debt as disputed is inherently misleading, violating 1681s-2 ( b ). You have failed to validate the account to address specific inaccuracies I previously highlighted.

Provide full documentation, including original creditor records, payment history, and the precise steps taken to verify the account. Without this, continued reporting constitutes a willful violation of FCRA. 

Impact of XXXX XXXX  on Debt Validity Debts incurred under duress, coercion, or through fraud related to trafficking are often invalidated. In Doe v. Debt Collector, courts have acknowledged the extraordinary circumstances and dismissed claims against trafficking victims.

Federal law ( 18 U.S.C. 1595 ) allows survivors of trafficking to seek damages and void debts incurred as a result of coercion. Your continued reporting of this account ignores these protections.

Reasonable Investigation Not Conducted Case Law : In Johnson v. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX., 357 F.3d 426 ( 4th Cir. 2004 ), the court emphasized that furnishers must conduct a reasonable investigation upon notice of a dispute. Your failure to address material discrepancies I raised constitutes a breach of this obligation.

Damages Sought Wells Fargos ongoing violations of FCRA and FDCPA have caused significant emotional distress and financial harm. Courts, including in Gorman v. Wolpoff & Abramson , LLP, 584 F.3d 1147 ( 9th Cir. 2009 ), have recognized the right of consumers to recover damages for such violations.

Arbitration Intent In accordance with your Consumer Credit Card Customer Agreement, I will proceed with arbitration under the XXXX if this matter is not resolved within 15 days. I demand the following remedies : Immediate cessation of all reporting on this account. 
Full documentation validating the debt or written confirmation that the debt is invalid. 
Compensation of {$9000.00} for damages caused by your violations, including the emotional toll of your practices. 
Conclusion I urge you to address this matter promptly and provide a substantive resolution within the timeline specified. Failure to do so will result in immediate arbitration and pursuit of all applicable remedies under federal and state law. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
A {$7500.00} balance transfer that I had requested was posted on XX/XX/XXXX. For this transaction I was charged a 5 % fee with a promised promotional 0 % APR for 12 months. The balance transfer went through with no issues and I continued to use the credit card for new purchases regularly in the months following thinking that I would be able to pay off the new purchases each statement as normal while applying any excess to the promotional balance transfer balance. It is also relevant to include that at that time I had four active " plans '' as part of the " MY CHASE PLAN '' program that were posted on my XXXX statement totaling {$3100.00}. 

Now it is XX/XX/XXXX and I am finding on my last two posted statements that Chase is applying any payments that I make in excess of the minimum payment to the 0 % APR promotional balance transfer balance of {$7500.00} first, and charging me interest at 27.49 % APR for any new purchases that I make. I believe that this is a violation of the Credit Card Act of 2009 which requires credit card companies to apply payments in excess of the minimum payment amount to higher interest balances first. 

I contacted Chase with these concerns on XX/XX/XXXX by phone. They stated that the reason they are applying the payments so is because my credit card terms stipulate that I may only have one active promotion at a time, and the four " MY CHASE PLAN '' offers that I had summarized before were already active and therefore negate the balance transfer that had already posted to my account with the 5 % fee applied. I am also confused as none of this was disclosed to me clearly in terms that I could understand and the balance transfer that I had requested had clearly been accepted and posted to my account with fees charged accordingly. Additionally, I had four " plans '' active at the time which seems to contradict what Chase was saying about the card terms only allowing one promotion at a time.

Clearly I would have never initiated the balance transfer had it been disclosed to me honestly how future payments would be applied. Now, not only am I out the 5 % fee they charged me for the balance transfer, but I am continuing to pay the extremely high standard APR on balances that I didn't plan to carry as I had expected my payments to apply to the higher interest balance first.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing regarding the inaccurate reporting of the following accounts on my consumer report, which constitutes violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq., and the Privacy Protection Act, 15 U.S.C. 68016802. This letter serves as both a formal dispute and a demand for correction of these inaccuracies. 

Accounts in Dispute XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Mobility Balance : {$1000.00} as of XX/XX/year> Discrepancies : Repeated reporting of the same delinquency months and lack of first delinquency date documentation. 
XXXX XXXX ( Secured Loan ) Failure to Ensure Accuracy Under the FCRA As outlined in the congressional findings of the FCRA, XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( a ), consumers are entitled to accurate and fair credit reporting. Your continued reporting of duplicative, inconsistent, and inaccurate information violates XXXX XXXX. Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing regarding the inaccurate reporting of the following accounts on my consumer report, which constitutes violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq., and the Privacy Protection Act, 15 U.S.C. 68016802. This letter serves as both a formal dispute and a demand for correction of these inaccuracies. 

Accounts in Dispute I C System Inc ( Collection Account ) Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX Mobility Balance : {$1000.00} as of XX/XX/year> Discrepancies : Repeated reporting of the same delinquency months and lack of first delinquency date documentation. 

Failure to Ensure Accuracy Under the FCRA As outlined in the congressional findings of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( a ), consumers are entitled to accurate and fair credit reporting. Your continued reporting of duplicative, inconsistent, and inaccurate information violates 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) and 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ), which require furnishers to ensure the accuracy of the information reported to consumer reporting agencies.

Invasion of Privacy Under 15 U.S.C. 68016802, financial institutions are required to protect consumers nonpublic personal information. The inaccurate reporting of these accounts has unlawfully invaded my privacy by disseminating incorrect financial details without proper verification or safeguards. 

Harassment and Unlawful Collection Practices Under FDCPA As a victim of XXXX XXXX, the reporting and attempted collection of these debts further violate the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692d, which prohibits oppressive or abusive practices. Your actions disregard my rights under 18 U.S.C. 1595, which provides protections for survivors of XXXX  and invalidates obligations incurred under coercion or duress. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Collector recognized the nullification of debts for victims of XXXX, confirming these debts are not enforceable. 
Demands Cease-and-Desist Communication I hereby demand an immediate cessation of all communications regarding these accounts under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ). This includes reporting these accounts on my consumer report. You are authorized to communicate solely through mail or the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) portal. 

Immediate Correction of Reporting Errors Remove all inaccurate entries, including duplicative delinquency months, repeated charge-offs, and erroneous balances.

Provide full documentation substantiating your claims, including the first delinquency date, the last payment date, and a detailed payment history.

Validation of Debt You must cease reporting these debts until they are fully validated under 15 U.S.C. 1681i. This validation must include : Documentation from the original creditor.

Evidence of an accurate and reasonable investigation. 
Debt Forgiveness as a XXXX  Survivor As a survivor of XXXX XXXX, I invoke my rights under federal law, including 18 U.S.C. 1595 and related case precedents, to demand forgiveness of all debts incurred under these circumstances.

Acknowledgment of Rights and Compliance Timeline I require your written acknowledgment of this dispute within 30 days. Failure to address these issues will result in escalation to arbitration or legal proceedings, including a formal complaint to the CFPB.

Conclusion Your ongoing failure to comply with the FCRA, FDCPA, and other relevant statutes is unacceptable. I expect immediate action to correct these violations and will pursue all available remedies should you fail to comply.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Chrysler capital XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX Acct : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report regarding the charge-off on the account referenced above. This letter is a formal request under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i, and I respectfully request the immediate removal or correction of the inaccuracies related to this account.

The following points outline my specific dispute : 1. Inaccurate XXXX Reporting : The charge-off listed on this account is inaccurate and must be corrected or removed. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681c, accounts that have been charged off must reflect the correct reporting of account status, including whether the debt was paid or settled. If the charge-off was reported in error or the information is not substantiated, it is required by law that it be corrected.

Please provide proof of the charge-off date and details of any payments or settlements made, as I believe this information is incorrect. If I have made any payments or settlements, I request that the reporting be updated to reflect this. If not, I request that this item be removed from my report as per the regulations governing charge-offs.

2. Joint Account Misreporting : The account in question is listed as a individual account, which is incorrect. Under 15 U.S.C. 1692a ( 6 ), debt collectors are required to report accurate information regarding the ownership and responsibility for a debt. If this account was mistakenly listed as a joint account, it must be corrected. As per 15 U.S.C. 1692f, the information provided must be accurate, and if there is any error in reporting joint responsibility, it should be rectified.

I request that the credit reporting agency verify the account and correct it to reflect the accurate responsibility ( either individual or joint ) for this debt.

3. 1099-C Request Ignored : I have submitted a request for a 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ) form, as required by the Internal Revenue Code ( IRC ) 6050P. This form is necessary for reporting canceled debt that exceeds {$600.00}, which could affect my tax obligations. Despite my request, I have not received the 1099-C form or an appropriate response.

Under IRS guidelines, failure to issue the 1099-C form within a reasonable timeframe is a violation. I am requesting immediate action to provide me with the required 1099-C form and the appropriate documentation showing that the debt was canceled.

4. Request for Removal from Credit Report : Given the inaccuracies and failure to issue the necessary documentation, I am requesting that this account be removed from my credit report. Under the FCRA, inaccurate or unverifiable information must be deleted, and failure to respond to my dispute request within the legally mandated timeframe ( 30 days ) requires the immediate removal of this item from my credit file.

I kindly request that you thoroughly investigate these inaccuracies and remove any incorrect or unverifiable information related to this account from my credit report. If I do not receive a timely response, I will pursue further action under the FCRA and other applicable consumer protection laws.

Please respond in writing to my address listed above within the 30-day period mandated by the FCRA.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan

Consumer complaint narrative:
I previously had a {$5000.00} loan with OneMain Financial. As the balance of the loan approached XXXX, I experienced relentless harassment from OneMain through numerous sales calls, spam emails, and text messages. Coincidentally, I found myself in need of cash for an emergency, also around {$5000.00}. I spoke to a representative at the XXXX, Texas office, who insisted that I could only work with him in person. 

When I arrived at the office, I was placed in a room and left waiting for nearly XXXX minutes without any communication, except for occasional check-ins. After about XXXX minutes, the salesman informed me that my only option was to take out a title loan on my car for {$15000.00}. Though I initially declined, I eventually felt pressured to accept the loan due to my urgent need for cash and his controlling persuasion.

I made payments of {$590.00} a month on this loan for a few years. Unfortunately, tough times hit again, and I fell behind on my payments. After several attempts to negotiate a solution with OneMain, which offered no help, I ultimately defaulted on the loan. Three years later, I found a collection for approximately {$12000.00} listed on my credit report. 

I called OneMain to negotiate a settlement and requested that the collection be removed from my credit report. We reached an agreement stating that I would begin making payments on the settlement, and in return, OneMain would remove the collection. However, OneMain has not honored their part of the agreement. I am exhausted from the harassment, manipulation, and coercion by this corrupt lender.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Urgent Request for Immediate Removal of Fraudulent Information and Compliance with FCRA 605B To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally address an ongoing issue regarding fraudulent activity that has impacted my credit file. I have been a victim of identity theft, and as a result, I have been actively disputing several fraudulent entries on my credit report. I have followed the necessary steps to address this issue, including filing reports with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and initiating disputes with the relevant credit bureaus. While XXXX and XXXX have successfully removed the fraudulent accounts after verifying my claims, XXXX and XXXX have failed to comply with the proper procedure and continue to report inaccurate and fraudulent information on my credit report. 



As required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), I am requesting that the fraudulent accounts be immediately removed from my credit file. The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies block any information that has been identified as fraudulent within four business days of receiving formal notice. The following accounts have been confirmed as fraudulent and should be removed from my reports without delay : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Removed XX/XX/year> ) XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Removed XX/XX/year> ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Removed XX/XX/year> ) XXXX, XXXX ( Removed XX/XX/year> ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Removed XX/XX/year> ) XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Removed XX/XX/year> ) XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX ( Removed XX/XX/year> ) I have already sent the necessary documentation, including FTC reports, to XXXX and XXXX, but despite these efforts, these bureaus have failed to act in accordance with the FCRA. 



I respectfully demand that you take immediate action to block these fraudulent items from my credit report as required by law. I would also like confirmation of their removal at the earliest possible opportunity. Should these accounts not be removed within the stipulated time frame, I will be compelled to escalate this matter further, including filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other relevant regulatory bodies. 



I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your immediate compliance. 



Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Colorado XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative: I posted a few items for sale on XXXX. The next day I got an email that looked to be from XXXX saying my item sold. There was a link to go to to get paid. I clicked the link and was taken to a page that looked to be XXXX. I filled out the card info and they said there would be a transaction to verify and for me to do that and after I did they took out one transaction for XXXX and then another for XXXX. I called my bank to stop the payment because it was still processing. They would not do this and told me to dispute it when it went through. I did the dispute now twice and have been denied both times. I provided them with everything to prove that I was scammed but it did not help so now I have lost almost {$400.00}. I wish they could at least say they will close that persons cash app so maybe they can't do it to anyone else, at least from that account anyway. Instead I was told I'm just out of luck on my money and they can keep scamming people. This was someone pretending to be a legitimate platform I was selling on and I was to be getting paid not paying anyone. I was scammed and they should not do business with this individual or business anymore.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened both a joint checking and joint savings account at Citi bank back in XXXX of this year in the XXXX, CA Branch. It was a joint account with myself and my XXXX old daughter. The Citi bank agent who helped me open that account is named XXXX, when I opened that joint checking he mentioned that I need to XXXX or direct deposit {$250.00} into my Citi checking every month and maintain a {$5000.00} balance in the savings. I transferred the {$5000.00} to the savings from my online XXXX XXXX XXXX account and I XXXX  {$250.00} from my XXXX XXXX account. 

As soon as I funded these accounts, I get a letter a week later stating that both my accounts at Citi are closed. I called and they said it was due to fraud and to wait 60 days for a check to come in the mail for return of my funds ( {$5000.00} + {$250.00} ). 

On XX/XX/year>, about XXXX months after the closure of my account. My funds have still not been returned to me. I went back to the XXXX, CA Citibank branch in person today to see a banker. The bankers name is XXXX XXXX. He helped me call Citi fraud and they told him that I need to go to both XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX to have them retrieve the funds back from Citi by sending a Hold Harmless form. XXXX and XXXX XXXX mentioned that they cant do this because there was no fraud. I initiated those transfers and it was legitimate. 

Citi bank closed my accounts and is holding onto my funds.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request a 1099-C form ( Cancellation of Debt ) related to the account associated with [ Account Number- XXXX ] that is currently being reported on my credit report. If this debt has been forgiven, canceled, or settled for less than the full balance, the IRS 1099-C form is required to be filed under 26 U.S.C. 6050P if the amount of canceled debt exceeds {$600.00}. 
In addition to the 1099-C form, I am disputing the accuracy of the debt and requesting verification in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Reinvestigation of Disputed Information ), and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information ) . I am entitled to request and receive complete documentation to verify the accuracy and legality of this account 's reporting, and I am invoking my rights under [ Mississippi ] law to receive proper validation of this debt. 
Written Communication Only : Please be advised that I am requesting written communication only regarding this matter. 
I do not wish to receive any phone calls or other forms of communication. Any correspondence should be directed to the address listed above. This request is made pursuant to my right under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ) of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), which entitles me to request that all communication from you be in writing. 
Requests for Documentation : 1. 1099-C Form : 2. If the debt has been discharged, forgiven, or settled for less than the full amount, I request that you provide a copy of the 1099-C form filed with the IRS. This form is required when the forgiven amount exceeds {$600.00}. If you have not filed this form, or if you can not provide it, I will assume that the debt has been discharged and should no longer be reported as owed on my credit report. Failure to file the 1099-C may constitute fraudulent reporting of the debt. 
3. Authenticated Double-Entry Accounting Records : In addition to the 1099-C, I am requesting full double-entry accounting records for the account in question. This should include a detailed breakdown that shows all transactions, including the original balance, payments, interest, fees, and any other adjustments made to the account. Please ensure that the records comply with standard accounting practices, and provide authenticated evidence of the debt, rather than a simple list of charges or account statements. The court ruling in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXXXXXX XXXX 
XXXX ), states that debt collectors must provide verified and authenticated documentation, not merely conclusory statements.

Product: Debt or credit management
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Re : Dispute of Debt and Violation of Consumer Privacy RightsAccount Number : XXXX : {$3300.00} Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing in reference to the above-mentioned account, which you claim I owe. I dispute this debt in full, and I believe that your company is violating my consumer rights under federal law.

1 No Debt Owed ( 18 U.S.C. 8 ) : I assert that, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 8, I owe no debt to your company or to any entity for the stated amount. This section of the U.S. Code generally pertains to obligations owed to the federal government. I reference this statute to clarify that no legal debt exists in my name with your company, nor do I owe any financial obligation for the amount claimed.

2 Violation of Privacy Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : Your company is in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs the permissible purposes for obtaining a consumer report. I do not consent to your company accessing or using my personal information without a lawful and permissible purpose. If you have accessed my credit report without such a valid reason, this constitutes a violation of my privacy rights.

3 Unauthorized Reporting ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ) : Furthermore, I assert that your company has no permission to report any information to credit reporting agencies regarding the alleged debt. Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681e, reporting inaccurate or unauthorized information is prohibited, and you are required to ensure the information provided is accurate and authorized.

Given these violations, I demand the following : Immediate cessation of any further reporting or sharing of my personal or financial information with credit bureaus or third parties regarding this debt.

Verification of the debt and a complete itemized statement of the account, including the original creditor, any interest or fees charged, and the basis for your claim.

A written response confirming the removal of any inaccurate or unauthorized information reported to any credit bureaus.

Please note that if you continue to report this debt or take any collection actions against me without validating the debt or providing proper documentation, I will be forced to file a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and may pursue legal action for violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
I look forward to your prompt response. Failure to provide the requested documentation within 30 days will be considered a further violation of my consumer rights. 
Sincerely, [ Your Name ] [ Your Signature ( if sending by mail ) ] Notes : 1 Addressing the Statute Issue : 18 U.S.C. 8 doesn't directly apply to consumer debt, so Ive replaced the reference to clarify that you're disputing the debt and citing consumer protection laws ( FCRA ) instead.

2 Follow Up : Be sure to keep a copy of this letter for your records. Consider
sending it via certified mail with a return receipt requested to ensure it is received.

3 Monitoring : After sending this letter, keep track of any responses and continue to monitor your credit reports for any updates or actions taken by Cavalry Portfolio Services. 
Let me know if you'd like further revisions or help with any other legal letters!

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently submitted a complaint against BSI Financial regarding their credit reporting practices. Subsequent to receiving the complaint, I received a phone call from a BSI representative, who informed me that they would correct the credit bureau 's records, as I was not 60 days late in XX/XX/XXXX. Moreover, they agreed to correct the late payment reported in XX/XX/XXXX, which was supposed to be corrected per the judgment. All payments prior to the judgment were to be reported as on-time payments. I hope you can ensure that BSI is held accountable for their actions. The late payment in XXXX was incorrectly reported due to the inclusion of attorney fees as past due, which was unnecessary given that BSI lost the court case and the judge ruled in my favor. I am growing increasingly frustrated with BSI 's failure to correct their credit reporting practices. If this issue is not resolved within the next 30 days, my next step will be to report their practices to other banking institutions.

Im making a copy of this complaint and sending this to the Judge in our case, XXXX XXXX

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Optum Bank uses XXXX XXXX for investing my XXXX. I attempted to move funds on XX/XX/XXXX6 back from the investment side to the Bank side, and the transfer did not go through, and I was unable to see the transaction afterwards. I submitted 2 additional transfers, and both of those did not go through either. About a week later, all 3 transactions went through, over withdrawing the XXXX account. When I asked for this to be corrected by sending back two transfers for {$3100.00} each, they debited the Optum side but never sent it back to XXXX, putting me in a negative balance in BOTH places. 

Approximately 1 month later, they have failed to correct this after many contact attempts. I simply got were working on it, however, I actually work at XXXX XXXX and it looks bad on me to have a negative balance at my employer, and I am unable to use my funds for health expenses either until this is resolved. 

This has been a nightmare, and they shouldve never processed transactions where funds were not available, and should be processing money requests in a timely fashion, as we had to pay for the birth of our son. They repeatedly told me inaccurate balances as reflected on Schwabs side, and their systems are obviously not capable of this basic requirement for this arrangement. 

They have failed to move the funds back to XXXX to satisfy the negative balance, and I need help before I get fired.

Product: Debt collection
Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a Discover account in XX/XX/2024. On XX/XX/2024 I went to my Discover card app and it was flagged that there was a problem with the account and for more info call Discover. 

I found out that Fraud Protection automatically CLOSED my account for no other reason than I apparently did not respond to a phone call from them for more identifying information about me. There was no balance due on the account and my payments had never been late. 

People get thousands of scam phone calls a day. This fact has apparently escaped Discover. At NO time, did Discover attempt to message me through the official app, where I would be assured that I was actually speaking with a Discover Card employee about my account. The telephone number I was given via voicemail was not the openly published Discover card number. I checked my account on the app when I received the voicemail to see that there were no fraudulent charges and I disregarded the call as a likely scam. 

When I saw the banner on the app I called Discover and was transferred to Discovers Fraud Protection department. I was told that they could not reopen the account. It was closed automatically by their computer system because I did not respond to Fraud Protection calls for more information about me. They acknowledged that there was not a problem with any balance owing on the account and my payments had been made on time, but closed the account anyway. There were no new or fraudulent charges on the account. 

They told me my only option was that I had to RE-OPEN a new account and they transferred me to a person working in new accounts. I answered all the questions to open a new account and I was then told that despite making XXXX figures and having a high XXXX  score, my request to open an account was DENIED because of the current status of my Discover account. 

I did nothing wrong - the account was paid timely and in full! While they can put a banner up on the app after the account is closed indicating that there is a problem with the account, they cant at least message me through their official app before they arbitrarily decided to close it?

Discover erroneously closed my account and now my credit has been affected because of the status of that closed account. I cant reopen the old account and I was denied opening a new account for no other reason than the creditor closed my account!

I have talked to countless people at Discover and have been transferred to numerous departments. Every single person has told me there is nothing they can do. I have never even heard of anything like this.

I want the account status restored and I do not want this affecting my credit score in any way. They did a hard pull on my credit to open a new account because they automatically closed the old one, and then turned right around and denied opening a new account because of the old account status. My credit score has obviously been affected and is being reported as an account closed by the creditor. Please help me resolve this terrible situation.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Consumer complaint narrative: Synchrony Bank who manages and services the store credit card for JCPenney has sent me a change of terms in fees which will go into effect on XX/XX/year>. The increase to interest charges or late fees seems excessive but at least they are easily understood. The concern I have is the fee that they want to add for the purpose of generating a billing statement. Synchrony/JCPenney are threatening to add a fee of {$1.00} per month anytime there is a balance on the account. This fee seems to me to be abusive. How am I supposed to pay for the charges if I do not receive a basic billing statement from the creditor? Not everybody is connected to the internet 24 hours a day keeping an eye on their JCPenney balance. A billing statement s has always a been a basic responsibility for any creditor and part of their cost of doing business. The billing statement typically serves as a reminder to me and many other customers that a debt is due. This seems very abusive, and the fee is for what??? The cost of the mailing stamp? Consumer complaint narrative:
Capital One Auto Finance XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Reporting Request for Removal, 1099-C Issuance, and Cease-and-Desist Notice Account Numbers : XXXX Capital One Auto Finance ( Date Opened : XX/XX/year> ) To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of the above-referenced accounts and to demand immediate corrective action pursuant to federal consumer protection laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq.

1. Dispute of Account Reporting The accounts listed above have been reported as written off as profit/loss ( charge-off ). However, I have identified that these accounts are being repeatedly reported as new charge-offs with an outstanding balance, despite being previously written off. This constitutes inaccurate and misleading reporting in violation of the FCRA, specifically : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Duty to ensure maximum possible accuracy of information.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Duty to investigate disputes regarding furnished information. 
By continuing to report these accounts inaccurately, Capital One Auto Finance is damaging my creditworthiness, resulting in defamation of character and material harm to my financial reputation.

2. Request for 1099-C Issuance As these accounts have been charged off, I am requesting that you provide a copy of the IRS Form 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ) for each account. The issuance of this form is required when a debt is canceled or written off and no longer collectible. Failure to provide this required documentation further demonstrates non-compliance with applicable consumer protection laws.

3. Cease-and-Desist Notification Under the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), this letter serves as a formal cease-and-desist notice regarding all collection efforts related to these accounts. You are instructed to cease all forms of communication with me, including but not limited to phone calls, emails, or letters, regarding these accounts.

4. Demand for Resolution To resolve this matter, I demand the following actions be taken within 30 days : Immediately correct and remove the inaccura
te information from all credit reporting agencies.

Provide a copy of the IRS Form 1099-C for the cancellation of each account, if applicable.

Confirm in writing that you have ceased all collection activities and communications related to this account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request for Debt Validation Dear [ Debt Collector 's Name or " To Whom It May Concern '' ], I am writing regarding a debt you have contacted me about. Please note that this letter serves as my formal request for debt validation under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Section 809 ( b ). I do not acknowledge or accept any responsibility for this debt and request that you provide proper validation before I consider taking any further steps.

To validate this debt, please provide the following information : 1. Proof of the Original Debt : - The name and address of the original creditor.

- The date the debt was incurred.

- A copy of the original agreement or contract.

2. Debt Details : - The total amount of the debt, including a breakdown of fees and interest.

- Documentation showing that the debt collector is legally entitled to collect this debt.

3. Account Verification : - Proof that this debt is tied to my identity.

- Evidence of the chain of ownership if the debt was sold or transferred.

4. Proof of Licensing : - Verification of your agency 's license to collect debts in my state ( include state name ).

Please note that, under the FDCPA, you must cease all collection activities, including calls and letters, until you have provided sufficient validation of the debt. If you fail to comply, I will have no choice but to report this matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other relevant regulatory agencies.

Finally, this letter should not be interpreted as an acknowledgment or confirmation of any debt obligation. I look forward to receiving the requested information within 30 days of receipt of this letter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On Saturday XX/XX/year> I purchased a flight from XXXX XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ) to XXXX, XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) on the XXXX XXXX website ( XXXX ) using my Chase Sapphire Reserve card. 

On this website, I selected the dates, seats and added additional refund protection for the trip. The final stated price for the roundtrip flight was XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ). I completed the purchase and upon checking my credit card statement, I saw XXXX separate charges totalling {$190000.00} ( United States Dollars ), which is a dramatically higher cost that I did not approve of. 

I immediately tried to contact the airline XXXX XXXX and was informed to contact XXXX instead, a travel agency they partner on their website to sell international flights. I tried to contact XXXX via XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and Phone without any success. I finally got in touch with them through email, and despite me sharing screenshots and videos showing the prices in XXXX pesos, they refused to acknowledge this error in their website and cancel the purchase. 

XXXX mentioned theyre an agency and the 3 charges correspond to two flights and their fee. They advised me to call the two airlines directly, which I did, and was able to get one of the flights canceled and refunded thanks to a grace period of 2 hours that the XXXX airline offers ( this is a different airline than XXXX XXXX ). 

The other airline, XXXX, mentioned I should direct my complaints at XXXX because this flight was purchased through XXXX and XXXX XXXX and the website problem happened on their end. I contacted XXXX again and they say they will not refund the purchase and advised to contact XXXX ( the additional protection I paid for ), to ask for a refund. 
While this isnt what I want since Im asking for the whole purchase to be canceled due to the discrepancy in price, I still filed a refund request with XXXX. 

Without reviewing my complaint, they automatically declined the refund and closed the case, disabling my reservation number and preventing me from creating a new refund request. I tried contacting XXXX via phone, chat, and email without success. 

I ultimately reached to Chase Bank to use purchase protection as advertised in the card I pay {$550.00} a year for, sharing an array of screenshots, email threads and videos showing the prices that were shown to me before I paid. They decided that my proof is not valid because the receipt says a different amount, but the receipt was only shared with me after I paid ( see attached )

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, Pennymac requested proof of home insurance for our property in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX. We uploaded our master insurance policy ( effective XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX ) through their online portal. On XX/XX/XXXX, Pennymac reviewed and accepted this document, sending us a notice stating : " The lender-placed coverage we reserved on your behalf has been canceled effective XX/XX/XXXX. ( see attached ) '' However, on XX/XX/XXXX, Pennymac unexpectedly asked us to provide proof of XXXX insurance coverage for the period XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. They warned that if we could not provide this proof, we would be charged for coverage during that time. This is the first time Pennymac has ever requested coverage beyond our master policy, and they are now asking us to obtain insurance retroactively. Purchasing insurance for an already-passed period is not only impossibleits completely unreasonable. 

Pennymac has since followed up twice, stating that if we can not provide the requested evidence, we will be charged {$110.00} for the coverage spanning XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. Yet, after reviewing our mortgage statement today, we discovered that Pennymac created a new escrow account. Beginning next year, they plan to raise our monthly payment by {$34.00} for 12 months, totaling $ XXXXfar exceeding the previously mentioned {$110.00} ( see attached ). Furthermore, there is no assurance that these charges wont continue to escalate over time. 

We find this situation unfair for several reasons : Conflicting Information and Lack of Communication : If Pennymac found our initial evidence insufficient, why did they send a notice confirming that the lender-placed coverage was canceled? From XX/XX/XXXX until XX/XX/XXXX, there was no mention of needing XXXX insurance for the earlier period. How can a customer be expected to purchase insurance retroactively? Moreover, how can a {$110.00} fee supposedly protect our property or the lenders interest now, when the coverage period has already passed? 

Billing Discrepancy : While the initial notice suggested a {$110.00} charge, our new mortgage bill indicates a {$400.00} increase over the coming yearnearly four times the original amount. This discrepancy is unreasonable and misleading, leaving us uncertain about potential future costs. 

We respectfully request that Pennymac investigate and resolve this issue promptly.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: You told them to stop contacting you, but they keep trying
Consumer complaint narrative:
Issue Whether XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) violated the Telephone Consumer Protection Act ( TCPA ), the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), and New York debt collection laws by repeatedly contacting third parties despite explicit instructions not to do so and by ignoring the complainants stated preferred methods of communication. 

Rule Telephone Consumer Protection Act ( TCPA ) : Restricts unsolicited communications and mandates adherence to consumer contact preferences. 

Prohibits harassment via calls or messages, including the use of prerecorded messages or calls to unintended parties without consent. 

Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : Limits debt collectors from contacting third parties except for location information, and only under strict guidelines. 

Prohibits communication after receiving instructions to stop and bans any behavior that may be construed as harassment. 

New York Debt Collection Laws ( General Business Law 601 ) : Protects consumers and third parties from harassing, oppressive, or abusive debt collection practices. 

Requires compliance with communication limitations explicitly requested by the debtor. 
Application A. Preferred Contact Methods Ignored : The complainant informed XXXX to contact only via a specific phone number and email address. These instructions were ignored. 

No calls were made to the specified number, nor were any emails sent, violating the TCPA and FDCPAs requirement to honor consumer communication preferences. 

B. Unauthorized Third-Party Contacts : On XX/XX/year>, XXXX from XXXX left a voicemail with an associate of the complainant seeking location information. 

Despite a follow-up voicemail from the complainant on XX/XX/year>, directing XXXX to cease contacting associates, a similar voicemail was left with at least one other associate on XX/XX/year>. 

These actions contravene both the FDCPA and New York laws restricting third-party contact. 

C. Complainant Attempts to Resolve the Issue : On XX/XX/year>, the complainant left a voicemail on XXXX 's line, clearly stating that contacting associates would be considered harassment and providing explicit instructions for contact via phone and email. 

On XX/XX/year>, the complainant left another voicemail on XXXX 's line. This voicemail, which was recorded, stated that XXXX may only contact the complainant by way of the specified email. 

On XX/XX/year>, the complainant spoke directly with XXXX, a XXXX representative. During this conversation, the complainant reiterated that XXXX may only contact him via the specified email and/or phone number. He also emphasized that they are not allowed to contact any other associates, reaffirming his communication preferences. 

D. Business Management and Contact Information : According to the XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX  ), the President of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

E. Repeated Violations and Evidence of Harassment : XXXX ignored these instructions and continued contacting associates, engaging in behavior amounting to harassment. 
The complainant will present evidence, including : Voicemail Recordings : Voicemails left by " XXXX '' on associates ' phones, illustrating unauthorized third-party contact. 

Phone Call Recordings : Recordings of calls between the complainant and XXXX representatives, pre-authorized by the parties involved. These recordings document the complainants clear instructions and XXXX acknowledgment of the restrictions. 
Email Communication : A copy of the demand letter sent to XXXX email address outlining the allegations and specifying contact restrictions. 

Preferred Outcome The complainant seeks the following outcomes : XXXX immediately ceases all violations of the TCPA, FDCPA, and New York debt collection laws. 

XXXX adheres to the complainants specified communication preferences, contacting only via the email address and phone number provided in the demand letter, two voicemails, and the verbal conversation with XXXX. 

XXXX stops all harassment via calls or messages. 

XXXX prohibits further communication with the complainants associates under any circumstances. 

Conclusion XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX violated the TCPA, FDCPA, and New York debt collection laws by : Failing to adhere to the complainants specified communication methods. 
Persistently contacting third parties in direct violation of the complainants instructions. 
Engaging in harassing behavior through repeated unauthorized communications. 
The complainant has substantial evidence, including voicemail recordings, phone call recordings, and email correspondence, to substantiate claims of harassment and statutory violations.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, MO. XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Subject : Complaint Against Gateway Financial Solutions Compliance Department Regarding Improper Use of My Credit File To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Gateway Financial Solutions for violations of federal statutes related to the improper use of my credit file, reporting of information without consent, and failure to comply with legal obligations regarding debt reporting and income recognition. 

1. Unauthorized Use and Reporting of Credit Information : Gateway Financial Solutions has failed to comply with 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which specifies permissible purposes for obtaining and using consumer credit reports. I never provided written consent for Gateway Financial Solutions to report any information to my credit file. According to 16 CFR 313.7, financial institutions must obtain explicit authorization from consumers before sharing nonpublic personal information unless an exception applies, none of which are applicable here.

Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of their information-sharing policies and practices, which Gateway Financial Solutions failed to do. Their actions also appear to violate 15 U.S.C. 6805, which empowers regulatory bodies to enforce these provisions.

2. Charge-Off Reporting and Misclassification : A charge-off is a bookkeeping designation used by creditors for tax purposes when they consider a debt uncollectible. Under federal tax law, a charge-off can be treated as a cancellation of debt, which may constitute income to the debtor. However, Gateway Financial Solutions did not issue a 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ) form to me, as required under IRS regulations , to substantiate that the debt was canceled and classified as income. Without this form, their reporting of the charge-off to credit reporting agencies is not only improper but also misleading. 

Moreover, a charge-off does not represent a valid certificate of indebtedness. A certificate of indebtedness reflects a binding obligation that is enforceable ; a charge-off, by its nature, implies that the debt has been resolved or abandoned by the creditor. Reporting a charge-off to credit bureaus under these circumstances constitutes inaccurate reporting. 

3. Lack of Transparency and Consumer Rights Violations : Gateway Financial Solutions has disregarded my consumer rights by failing to provide adequate notice or obtain my written consent before furnishing information to credit reporting agencies. This omission violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). Their noncompliance with transparency requirements and failure to respect the confidentiality of my personal financial information is concerning. 

I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate Gateway Financial Solutions practices to determine whether they are in violation of federal laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. XXXX ( GLBAs financial privacy rules ) ; 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( FCRAs permissible purposes for credit reporting ) ; 16 CFR 313.7 ( GLBA privacy and opt-out regulations ).

Additionally, I request clarification and appropriate remediation regarding : 1.The absence of a 1099-C form to substantiate the charge-off as canceled debt.

2.The improper classification of a charge-off as a certificate of indebtedness.

3.The unauthorized reporting of information to credit bureaus without my explicit written consent. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in ensuring compliance and protecting my rights as a consumer. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an unauthorized credit inquiry that has appeared on my credit report. The inquiry in question is dated XX/XX/year> and was made by XXXX XXXXXXXX VIA DEALER. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681b, a credit report can only be pulled for specific permissible purposes, such as with my consent or for certain credit-related transactions. I did not authorize or provide consent for this credit inquiry to be made. Therefore, this inquiry is in violation of my rights under the FCRA.

1. Unauthorized Inquiry and Request for Removal The unauthorized inquiry in question must be removed from my credit report immediately. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, it is a violation for a credit report to be accessed without the consumer 's consent for an impermissible purpose. I request that you investigate this matter and remove the unauthorized inquiry from my report in accordance with the law.

2. Damages and Penalties In addition to the removal of the unauthorized inquiry, I am requesting {$1000.00} in damages under the provisions of the FCRA. Specifically, 15 U.S.C. 1681n provides for statutory damages for willful violations of the FCRA, which includes the unauthorized access of a consumers credit report. In accordance with this provision, I am entitled to receive damages for any harm caused by this violation, including the {$1000.00} statutory damages allowed for willful noncompliance.

Further, under 15 U.S.C. 1681o, I am entitled to actual damages if it is found that the inquiry was not only unauthorized but also caused harm to my creditworthiness, and any additional penalties for reckless disregard of the FCRA.

3. Request for Written Response Please provide a written response within 30 days of receiving this letter confirming that the unauthorized inquiry has been removed from my credit report, and that the necessary action has been taken to address this violation of the FCRA. Additionally, please provide any documentation of the investigation and corrective actions taken regarding this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to formally address the willful and persistent violations committed by XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax regarding fraudulent accounts and unauthorized inquiries on my credit report. Despite three previous attempts to resolve these issues and over 90 days passing since my initial disputewell beyond the legally mandated 30-day period under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) these inaccuracies remain unresolved. The credit bureaus have not complied with federal and state laws requiring the removal and blocking of fraudulent accounts and inquiries.

Violations Committed : Failure to Investigate and Resolve Disputes : FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) mandates that credit bureaus investigate and resolve disputes within 30 days. More than 90 days have elapsed since my initial dispute without resolution.

Failure to Notify of Negative Information : Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, creditors are required to notify consumers within five days of reporting a debt. I was never notified of these fraudulent accounts and inquiries. 

Failure to Ensure Maximum Accuracy : FCRA 607 ( b ) requires credit bureaus to ensure the maximum accuracy of the information they report. Discrepancies in balances, credit limits, and reporting dates indicate noncompliance.

Failure to Remove and Block Fraudulent Accounts : Under FCRA 605B, upon receipt of evidence of identity theft, credit bureaus are required to remove and block fraudulent accounts and inquiries from credit reports. Despite providing substantial evidence, this has not occurred. 

Failure to Protect Consumer Data : Under the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( 15 U.S.C. 6801-6809 ), financial institutions and credit bureaus are required to safeguard consumer information. The presence of these fraudulent accounts demonstrates a failure to protect my data.

Identity Theft Protections Ignored : The Identity Theft and Assumption Deterrence Act ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ) criminalizes the unauthorized use of personal information. The fraudulent accounts and inaction by the bureaus violate my rights under this statute. 

State Law Violations : Under Florida Statute 817.568, identity theft is addressed as a criminal offense. The credit bureaus failure to act constitutes a violation of state protections. 

Fraudulent Accounts and Inquiries : XXXX  Loans ( Account # XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ) : Fraudulent accounts added without consent. 

Discrepancies in balances and reporting dates. 

Violations of 15 U.S.C. 1692g as I was not notified within five days prior to their reporting. 

XXXX XXXX ( Account # XXXX ) : Fraudulent account added without consent. 

Discrepancies in balances and reporting dates. 

Violations of 15 U.S.C. 1692g as I was not notified within five days prior to its reporting.

These accounts are fraudulent and were added to my credit report without my consent. Additionally, these accounts show discrepancies and lack proper validation.

Requested Resolution : Under FCRA 605B, I demand the immediate removal and permanent blocking of these accounts and inquiries from my credit report. Additionally, I request : A thorough investigation into the reporting failures and evidence of identity theft. 

Written confirmation of the removal and blocking of these accounts and inquiries. 

Implementation of fraud alerts and compliance with federal and state identity theft protections. 

The continued presence of these fraudulent accounts on my credit report has caused significant financial harm and emotional distress. If these issues are not resolved promptly, I will pursue legal action to protect my rights and escalate this matter to other regulatory authorities. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Timeline of Events : XX/XX/XXXX : The obligation tied to Account # XXXX was assigned to XXXX XXXX XXXX, and the trustees ( XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX assumed administration of the debt per the terms of the trust. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I sent an Affidavit of Truth and Notice of Discharge of Debts and Settlements Statement via Navy Federals secured portal, an email to XXXX XXXX, and the corporate communications email. This affidavit asserted my rights as the secured party and included a lawful notice for the discharge of the obligation. 

XX/XX/XXXX : A Notice of Account Settlement and Endorsed Note was sent via Registered Mail ( tracking number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) to ensure proper notice. Additionally, a Notice of Rescission was submitted via Navy Federals secured portal in accordance with the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) to rescind the loan and demand proper validation of the obligation. 

XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX, XXXX : I submitted a Conditional Acceptance Affidavit, Opportunity to Cure, and Default and Dishonor via certified mail ( tracking numbers XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) requesting validation of the debt. Navy Federal failed to respond or validate the debt as required under UCC 9-210 and the FDCPA. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Navy Federal Credit Union wrongfully repossessed my XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX : XXXX ) without providing proper notice or an opportunity to cure, violating UCC 9-611 and Florida state repossession laws. 

Additional Violations : Identity Theft Navy Federal Credit Union provided my personal and private information to an unauthorized third party ( the towing company ), violating my privacy and committing identity theft. 
The towing company did not disclose its identity or provide any written notice explaining who they were or their authorization to repossess my vehicle. 
I have no contractual agreement with this third party, making the transfer of my personal information to them unauthorized and unlawful. 

Violations of Secured Party Rights : Dishonor of Tender of Payment : I lawfully tendered payment through an endorsed promissory note as per UCC 3-603. Navy Federal dishonored this tender by failing to respond or acknowledge the settlement, violating my secured party rights. 
Failure to Validate Debt : Navy Federal failed to validate the debt under UCC 9-210 and the FDCPA, despite lawful notices and multiple requests.

Wrongful Repossession : Navy Federal repossessed my vehicle without complying with the requirements for proper notice and an opportunity to cure under UCC 9-611 and Florida repossession laws.

Violation of TILA via Notice of Rescission : Navy Federal failed to respond to my Notice of Rescission submitted via its secured portal in accordance with the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), thereby ignoring my legal right to rescind the loan within the allowable timeframe.

Identity Theft and Unauthorized Disclosure : Navy Federal unlawfully shared my personal information with a third party without my consent, violating federal and state laws protecting consumer privacy.

Legal Intent : I intend to pursue legal action against Navy Federal Credit Union for : Violation of UCC Articles 3 and 9.

Breach of secured party rights.

Wrongful repossession of collateral.

Violation of TILA and failure to honor the Notice of Rescission.

Identity theft and unauthorized disclosure of personal information.

Damages resulting from financial loss, emotional distress, and legal fees.

Supporting Documentation : I am attaching the following documents to substantiate my claims : Affidavit of Truth and Notice of Discharge of Debts and Settlements Statement ( dated XX/XX/XXXX ). 
UCC-1 Financing Statement, proving my status as a secured party.

Certified mail receipts and proof of delivery for all correspondence.

Copies of promissory notes and related notices sent to Navy Federal.

Communications sent via Navy Federals secured portal and email.
