Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an unauthorized credit inquiry that has appeared on my credit report. The inquiry in question is dated XX/XX/year> and was made by CAPITAL ONE VIA DEALER. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681b, a credit report can only be pulled for specific permissible purposes, such as with my consent or for certain credit-related transactions. I did not authorize or provide consent for this credit inquiry to be made. Therefore, this inquiry is in violation of my rights under the FCRA.

1. Unauthorized Inquiry and Request for Removal The unauthorized inquiry in question must be removed from my credit report immediately. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, it is a violation for a credit report to be accessed without the consumer 's consent for an impermissible purpose. I request that you investigate this matter and remove the unauthorized inquiry from my report in accordance with the law.

2. Damages and Penalties In addition to the removal of the unauthorized inquiry, I am requesting {$1000.00} in damages under the provisions of the FCRA. Specifically, 15 U.S.C. 1681n provides for statutory damages for willful violations of the FCRA, which includes the unauthorized access of a consumers credit report. In accordance with this provision, I am entitled to receive damages for any harm caused by this violation, including the {$1000.00} statutory damages allowed for willful noncompliance.

Further, under 15 U.S.C. 1681o, I am entitled to actual damages if it is found that the inquiry was not only unauthorized but also caused harm to my creditworthiness, and any additional penalties for reckless disregard of the FCRA.

3. Request for Written Response Please provide a written response within 30 days of receiving this letter confirming that the unauthorized inquiry has been removed from my credit report, and that the necessary action has been taken to address this violation of the FCRA. Additionally, please provide any documentation of the investigation and corrective actions taken regarding this matter. 

Should I not receive a satisfactory response or compensation within the required timeframe, I will pursue further legal actions to enforce my rights under the FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative: To whom it may concern, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting inaccurate and incomplete credit information. I am distressed that you have included the information below on my credit profile and that you have failed to maintain reasonable procedures in your operations to assure maximum possible accuracy in the credit reports you publish. Credit reporting laws ensure the bureaus report only 100 % accurate credit information. Every step must be taken to assure the information reported is completely accurate and correct.The following information therefore needs to be re-investigated. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required by federal law to verify, through the physical verification of the original signed document contract, any and all accounts that you post on a credit report. Otherwise anyone paying for your reporting services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account. I demand to see verifiable proof ( i.e. : an original customer contract with my signature in it ) that you have on file for the accounts listed below. Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA, unverifiable accounts must be removed and if you are unable to provide me a copy of verifiable proof, you must remove the accounts listed below. I demand the following accounts be removed immediately. If this account is not removed from my credit report I will sue you for violating my rights and statutory damages being that you violated the FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Tx, XXXX XX/XX/year> Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Charge-Off Accounts Reported on My Credit Report Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of several charge-off accounts reported on my credit file. According to my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request a thorough investigation and verification of the accounts listed below. 

Accounts in Question : Creditor Name : Applied Bank Account Number : XXXX Charge-Off Amount : [ {$690.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Charge-Off Amount : [ {$0.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$990.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$1200.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$8500.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$340.00} ] Creditor Name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$58.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$330.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$630.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$830.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$270.00} ] which is conjunction with XXXX  XXXX for XXXX charged off what your reference is above same account number different amounts, please delete. 

Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$1900.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$720.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX : [ {$720.00} ] Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$270.00} XXXX Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Charged-Off Amount : [ {$7400.00} ] Discrepancies and Grounds for Dispute : Charge-Off Reporting : IRS Publication 525 explains that debts canceled or charged off must be reported as taxable income only if the creditor issues a 1099-C form. Please verify whether the creditor filed this form and whether the debt is legally collectible. 


Account Accuracy : I request that the credit bureau confirm with the creditor all details about this account, including payment history, account balance, and charge-off validity. 

Verification Documentation : Under the FCRA, I have the right to request the documentation that verifies the legitimacy of these accounts. Without proper evidence, these entries must be removed from my credit file. 

Tax Implications : If the creditor issued a 1099-C for this account, the IRS considers the debt settled or forgiven. As such, it may not remain valid for collection or reporting as a charge-off.

Resolution Sought : Please investigate and remove all inaccuracies regarding the above accounts. If the creditors fail to provide accurate, complete, and timely documentation, I request the deletion of these entries. 

Supporting Documentation : I have enclosed copies of my credit report highlighting the disputed accounts for your reference. 

I expect a written response and resolution to this matter within 30 days as stipulated by the FCRA. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I had a horrific experience with Rocket Mortgage. I am listed on the mortgage, the note, and the deed, yet during my divorce, my ex-husbandwho was court-ordered to pay the mortgagefailed to make payments. Despite this, XXXX XXXX ignored the issue, and my phone calls to Rocket Mortgage always ended with them refusing to communicate with me. They repeatedly stated that I was not their client, refused to provide any assistance, and hung up on me. 

Although they refused to communicate with me, they foreclosed on the property, sending letters addressed to me, my ex-husband, and even to my unknown spouse. When I contacted their lawyers at XXXX XXXX XXXX, I was told they would go after me and destroy me. I have recordings of all my phone calls with Rocket Mortgage, as I always informed them of the recordings. 

I was ultimately forced to repurchase my house through a XXXX sale and pay a 6 % fee because Rocket Mortgage refused to address the situation. My family paid off the mortgage through the XXXX on XX/XX/year>. However, as of XX/XX/year>, I have yet to receive any discharge of mortgage or warrant of satisfaction. Despite calling and emailing their lawyers at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I have been completely ignored. 

I also contacted the XXXX, but they can not provide the necessary documents from Rocket Mortgage. I have received no summary of the payments I made. Furthermore, I paid for insurance for the entire year, and when I contacted Rocket Mortgage to address this, I had to make multiple calls and speak to a XXXX. Eventually, I was informed that they had no record of the mortgage being paid off. They said they would cancel the insurance but provided no clear timeline for when this would happen or how I would be reimbursed for the premiums I had already paid. They even mentioned that if any reimbursement were issued, it would go to my ex-husbanddespite the fact that he did not contribute anything toward the mortgage. 

As of today, the mortgage is still recorded against my house, even though it was paid off XXXX months ago. I have not received any documentation, refunds for the insurance, or acknowledgment of the payoff. I was forced to pay a 6 % fee on the entire mortgage and endured extreme stress due to Rocket Mortgages refusal to act responsibly. 

The way I was treated by Rocket Mortgage was appalling. Their handling of this situation was a complete failure, marked by incompetence and unacceptable behavior.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX has violated my rights. 

I looked at my Equifax credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Neither my old mortgage company nor my new mortgage company gave a 15-day notice of changing servicers as is required by federal law. 

I received a notice in the mail of the sale of my mortgage. I immediately, same day, got on line and discovered that the transfer had all ready been completed. Essentially no notice was given. 

I assure you that i received no email of the impending transfer and I did not receive a text message. My old mortgage servicer has all that information and could have notified me. 

If I had gotten the 15-day notice I would have immediately paid off my mortgage which is probably the exact reason NO mortgage company likes to give advance notice. 

This is NOT the first time this has happened to me. A couple of years ago the same thing happened -- different mortgage company -- and my monthly payment to the old mortgager was no where to be found for weeks. Finally it showed up.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Sub-issue: You told them to stop contacting you, but they keep trying
Consumer complaint narrative:
Issue Whether United Check Recovery Bureau , Inc. ( UCRB ) violated the Telephone Consumer Protection Act ( TCPA ), the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), and New York debt collection laws by repeatedly contacting third parties despite explicit instructions not to do so and by ignoring the complainants stated preferred methods of communication. 

Rule Telephone Consumer Protection Act ( TCPA ) : Restricts unsolicited communications and mandates adherence to consumer contact preferences. 

Prohibits harassment via calls or messages, including the use of prerecorded messages or calls to unintended parties without consent. 

Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : Limits debt collectors from contacting third parties except for location information, and only under strict guidelines. 

Prohibits communication after receiving instructions to stop and bans any behavior that may be construed as harassment. 

New York Debt Collection Laws ( General Business Law 601 ) : Protects consumers and third parties from harassing, oppressive, or abusive debt collection practices. 

Requires compliance with communication limitations explicitly requested by the debtor.

Application A. Preferred Contact Methods Ignored : The complainant informed UCRB to contact only via a specific phone number and email address. These instructions were ignored.

No calls were made to the specified number, nor were any emails sent, violating the TCPA and FDCPAs requirement to honor consumer communication preferences. 

B. Unauthorized Third-Party Contacts : On XX/XX/year>, XXXX from UCRB left a voicemail with an associate of the complainant seeking location information. 

Despite a follow-up voicemail from the complainant on XX/XX/year>, directing UCRB to cease contacting associates, a similar voicemail was left with at least one other associate on XX/XX/year>. 

These actions contravene both the FDCPA and New York laws restricting third-party contact. 

C. Complainant Attempts to Resolve the Issue : On XX/XX/year>, the complainant left a voicemail on UCRB 's line, clearly stating that contacting associates would be considered harassment and providing explicit instructions for contact via phone and email. 

On XX/XX/year>, the complainant left another voicemail on UCRB 's line. This voicemail, which was recorded, stated that UCRB may only contact the complainant by way of the specified email. 

On XX/XX/year>, the complainant spoke directly with XXXX, a UCRB representative. During this conversation, the complainant reiterated that UCRB may only contact him via the specified email and/or phone number. He also emphasized that they are not allowed to contact any other associates, reaffirming his communication preferences. 

D. Business Management and Contact Information : According to the XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ), the President of United Check Recovery Bureau , Inc. is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

E. Repeated Violations and Evidence of Harassment : UCRB ignored these instructions and continued contacting associates, engaging in behavior amounting to harassment. 
The complainant will present evidence, including : Voicemail Recordings : Voicemails left by " XXXX '' on associates ' phones, illustrating unauthorized third-party contact. 

Phone Call Recordings : Recordings of calls between the complainant and UCRB representatives, pre-authorized by the parties involved. These recordings document the complainants clear instructions and UCRBs acknowledgment of the restrictions. 
Email Communication : A copy of the demand letter sent to UCRBs email address outlining the allegations and specifying contact restrictions. 

Preferred Outcome The complainant seeks the following outcomes : UCRB immediately ceases all violations of the TCPA, FDCPA, and New York debt collection laws. 

UCRB adheres to the complainants specified communication preferences, contacting only via the email address and phone number provided in the demand letter, two voicemails, and the verbal conversation with XXXX. 

UCRB stops all harassment via calls or messages.

UCRB prohibits further communication with the complainants associates under any circumstances.

Conclusion United Check Recovery Bureau , Inc. violated the TCPA, FDCPA, and New York debt collection laws by : Failing to adhere to the complainants specified communication methods. 
Persistently contacting third parties in direct violation of the complainants instructions. 
Engaging in harassing behavior through repeated unauthorized communications. 
The complainant has substantial evidence, including voicemail recordings, phone call recordings, and email correspondence, to substantiate claims of harassment and statutory violations.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Report provided to employer without your written authorization
Consumer complaint narrative:
Under 15 USC 6802, a financial institution is prohibited from disclosing nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the following conditions are met : The institution provides a clear and conspicuous disclosure to the consumer, in writing, electronically, or through another permitted form, stating that such information may be shared with third parties.

The consumer is given the opportunity, prior to the initial disclosure, to opt-out of having their information shared. 
The institution provides an explanation of how the consumer can exercise this opt-out right. 
In this case, the financial institution failed to inform me of my rights or provide the required disclosures to protect my privacy. Furthermore, I have become aware that my personal information was compromised in a data breach, representing another significant violation of my privacy rights.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request a 1099-C form ( Cancellation of Debt ) related to the account associated with [ Account Number- XXXX ] that is currently being reported on my credit report. If this debt has been forgiven, canceled, or settled for less than the full balance, the IRS 1099-C form is required to be filed under 26 U.S.C. 6050P if the amount of canceled debt exceeds {$600.00}.

In addition to the 1099-C form, I am disputing the accuracy of the debt and requesting verification in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Reinvestigation of Disputed Information ), and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information ) . I am entitled to request and receive complete documentation to verify the accuracy and legality of this account 's reporting, and I am invoking my rights under [ Mississippi ] law to receive proper validation of this debt.

Written Communication Only : Please be advised that I am requesting written communication only regarding this matter.

I do not wish to receive any phone calls or other forms of communication. Any correspondence should be directed to the address listed above. This request is made pursuant to my right under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ) of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), which entitles me to request that all communication from you be in writing.

Requests for Documentation : 1. 1099-C Form : 2. If the debt has been discharged, forgiven, or settled for less than the full amount, I request that you provide a copy of the 1099-C form filed with the IRS. This form is required when the forgiven amount exceeds {$600.00}. If you have not filed this form, or if you can not provide it, I will assume that the debt has been discharged and should no longer be reported as owed on my credit report. Failure to file the 1099-C may constitute fraudulent reporting of the debt.

3. Authenticated Double Entry Accounting Records : In addition to the 1099-C, I am requesting full double-entry accounting records for the account in question. This should include a detailed breakdown that shows all transactions, including the original balance, payments, interest, fees, and any other adjustments made to the account. Please ensure that the records comply with standard accounting practices, and provide authenticated evidence of the debt, rather than a simple list of charges or account statements. The court ruling in Chaudhry v. Gallerizzo, 174 F.3d 394 ( 4th Cir.

1999 ), states that debt collectors must provide verified and authenticated documentation, not merely conclusory statements.

4. Proof of Legal Right to Report and Collect the Debt : I also request authenticated evidence, in compliance with [ Your State ] law, that you have the legal right to report and collect this debt. This should include the original signed contract or agreement showing my obligation to pay the debt and your legal right to enforce collection and report it to the credit bureaus. In Spears v. Brennan, 745 N.E.2d 862 ( Ind.

Ct. App. 2001 ), the court held that creditors must provide original signed documentation to prove the validity of a debt. Failure to provide this evidence could result in violations of both state and federal consumer protection laws.

Request for Deletion if Evidence is Not Provided : If you are unable to provide the requested documentation or proof of the debt, I request that you immediately delete this account from my credit report in compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2. Under these provisions, you are required to investigate and correct any inaccuracies in the information you report to consumer reporting agencies. 
Failure to respond to this request, or failure to provide the required documentation, will compel me to take further action.

To : XXXX, Equifax & XXXX XXXX Report # XXXX Equifax XXXX # XXXX XXXX File # XXXX RE : Requesting you Block and Remove Fraud from My Consumer Report I am writing to inform you of a serious situation involving the compromise of my Social Security number, which has led to both an XXXX data breach and identity theft. I have already reported this to the Federal Trade Commission and filed a report, which is referenced as FTC report number attached, and included with this letter. 

In accordance with 15 USC 1681c-2 ( c ) ( a ), it is imperative that you, ( XXXX, Equifax & XXXX as a credit reporting agency and/or bureau, take immediate action to block and remove all information related to this identity theft from my credit report. 

This statute requires credit reporting agencies to address such requests promptly, within four business days of receiving a complaint containing the following information : Collection Names : XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX 


I want to underscore the gravity of this issue and my expectation for a swift and effective resolution. Should your response be inadequate, such as a refusal to cooperate by blocking and removing the above accounts within 4 days, I will be forced to pursue legal action against your agency, as allowed by law. 

Please be aware that I will seek damages, including statutory costs, with each violation carrying a statutory fee of {$1000.00}, as specified in 15 USC.

These violations include : -Defamation of Character - Negligent Enhancement of Identity Fraud - Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act - Non-compliance with 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil liability for negligent non-compliance ) - Non-compliance with 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( b ) ( Civil liability for willful non-compliance ) -Failing to comply with 15 USC 1692 ( g ) - Violations of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible purposes of consumer reports ) - Non-compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) ( Method of verification ) - Violations of 15 USC 1681a ( 4 ) ( Right to privacy ) -Violations of 15 U.S. Code 1681c ( Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports ) I am treating this matter with the utmost seriousness and request that you promptly block and remove the fraudulent accounts from my credit report. 

I have already provided all necessary information to facilitate this process. Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide a timeline for resolving this issue. Your prompt attention to this matter is greatly appreciated. 

You may respond via my email @ ( XXXX ) or by mail @ XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, AR XXXX Best wishes, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Response to XXXXXXXX XXXX Noncompliance with U.S. Codes and CFPB Guidelines. 
XXXX XXXX Department, I am writing in response to your inadequate and dismissive handling of my complaint submitted through the CFPB Complaint Portal. Your response regarding the tradeline from NATIONAL CREDIT ADJUSTERS demonstrates a clear disregard for your obligations under federal law, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and guidelines established by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). Your vague assertion that XXXX is either currently processing that dispute or has recently provided results is not only insufficient but also a blatant violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), which mandates that consumer reporting agencies conduct a reasonable reinvestigation when a dispute is submitted. By failing to provide transparency in your investigation process and evidence supporting the disputed tradeline, you are in clear noncompliance with the FCRA. 
Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 2 ) you are required to notify the furnisher of disputed information promptly and provide them with all relevant information regarding the dispute. Your failure to ensure the completeness and accuracy of the investigation violates this provision. Additionally, if the information can not be verified, it must be deleted from my credit report under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) Your approach is disrespectful not only to me as a consumer but also to the regulatory framework established by the CFPB, which emphasizes the importance of fair and accurate reporting practices. The continued presence of inaccurate information in my credit file and your vague responses highlight systemic noncompliance with federal law and CFPB guidelines.

I demand the following actions : 1. A **detailed explanation** of the investigation process you conducted regarding this specific tradeline.

2. **Full disclosure of all evidence and correspondence** from NATIONAL CREDIT ADJUSTERS used to substantiate their claim.

3. Immediate deletion of unverifiable or inaccurate information, as required by **15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) **.

4. A mailed copy of my **updated credit report** showing all corrections made.

Failure to meet these obligations will result in additional regulatory complaints and legal action. Under **15 U.S.C. 1681n** and **15 U.S.C. 1681o**, you are liable for both willful and negligent noncompliance with the FCRA , including statutory damages, actual damages, and attorney fees.

I expect a comprehensive response and resolution within 15 days. Any further evasion or noncompliance will be reported to the CFPB and other regulatory agencies for review and enforcement action. 
XXXX XXXX social Security number XXXX

After pulling a copy of my Consumer credit report I noticed that your agency is in multiple violations and Im entitled to monetary compensation under FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( c ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ) FURNISHING reports in connection with credit or insurance transactions that are not initiated by consumer ( Inquires ) - ( 1 ) In general A consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report relating to any consumer pursuant to subparagraph ( A ) or ( C ) of subsection ( a ) ( 3 ) in connection with any credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by the consumer only if ( A ) the consumer authorizes the agency to provide such report to such person or ( B ) ( i ) the transaction consists of a firm offer of credit or insurance.

( 3 ) INFORMATION regarding inquiries Except as provided in section 1681g ( a ) ( 5 ) of this title, a consumer reporting agency shall not furnish to any person a record of inquiries in connection with a credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by a consumer.

Under FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( b ) ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ( 2 ) such number of punitive damages as the court may allow.

I did not initiate any of these inquires furthermore if you feel like I did please send me copies of my written signature giving consent to this matter please.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Dear Sirs : My third estimated tax payment for XXXX - check number XXXX in the amount of {$59000.00} payable to United States Treasury from my personal Wells Fargo checking account ( # ending in XXXX ) - was mailed to the IRS on XX/XX/XXXX. It was stolen from the US Postal Service, altered, and fraudulently cashed by XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. 
I was notified by the IRS on XX/XX/XXXX ( after filing my XXXX tax return ) that I owed {$59000.00} plus penalty and interest. I immediately searched my bank records and discovered the theft, which I promptly reported to Wells Fargo Bank on XX/XX/XXXX. 
I have filed a XXXX Police Dept Report ( XXXX # XXXX ) on XX/XX/XXXX and Sgt. XXXX has been assigned to the case. Their investigation is about to be launched. I also filed a report with the United States Postal Service on XXXX # XXXX being handled by Area Inspector XXXX XXXX ( phone # XXXX XXXX XXXX I am informed by XXXX XXXX that the FBI does not investigate fraud for any amount less than {>= $1,000,000}. I have not heard back from him. 
Wells Fargo Claim Department has denied my claim stating that it was not reported within thirty days of the statement date on which the check appeared which would have been the XX/XX/XXXX statement. 
This is unfair since I reported the fraud/theft promptly upon discovery. 
Despite numerous phone calls made by me to the Wells Fargo Claim Dept, they will not send me any information in their files regarding the receiving bank that cashed the check, or the manner in which it was cashed. Furthermore, they will not provide me with any information regarding what precautions/policies that Wells Fargo has in place to prevent this type of bank fraud from being perpetrated against their customers. 
In summary, Wells Fargo has ignored my request for information regarding the theft. This has and will continue to hamper further investigations to be made by law enforcement. I maintain that I reported the theft promptly to Wells Fargo and that Wells Fargo has inadequate policies in place to prevent this type of fraudulent activity. Wells Fargo Bank is liable for and should reimburse me for my entire loss in the amount of {$59000.00}. 
Respectfully submitted, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Received unsolicited financial product or insurance offers after opting out
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a business credit card with American Express in XXXX using my business EIN number. No problems at all. 

In XXXX, I opened a personal XXXX and gold credit card with American Express using my SSN. I later opened a business XXXX card using my EIN number and they reported they needed my SSN number to verify my identity. 

I notice that my American Express business credit cards started to show up on my credit scores. I called American Express and asked them to verify to the last two number they had listed on the business credit cards for the EIN number. The last two numbers they provided were my SSN number and not the EIN number. I asked if American Express had their business credit card customers combine their personal American express credit cards together. They reported no, that they are kept different and are not combined. I then asked, then why did American express have my personal American express credit cards mixed in with my business credit cards and using my SSN for all the credit cards and not using my business EIN number as they were suppose to be doing from the very beginning. 

They asked me where on my account was I was able to see that ; I informed them I noticed it on my credit report. They were not able to provided me with an explanation as to why they used my SSN and basically put the blame on me and stated " I should have changed it from the very beginning to my EIN and if I wanted to changed it ; I would need to close out the cards and reapply. '' I was furious as I had originally applied with my EIN number and they scammed me asking me for my SSN to " verify '' my identity. 

They have not ruined my credit score, had charged interests on my business credit cards, have declined payments on credit cards that have " no spending limits '' yet inform me that the payments were declined due to " spending over my limit '' - how can I spend over my limit when the card clearly states 'there is no spending limit. '' They then started decreasing the credit limits on my other credit cards even though there was no balance due and even when payments were being made on time and " no balance due at this time '' was indicated in the account. They also informed me I was able to receive up to 5 employee business cards with no membership fees ; I ordered two cards and then was charged a {$350.00} membership fee for each card.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX my parents made the decision to send me out of the state of Texas for college. I was enrolled into XXXX XXXX in XXXX, XXXX. I did not graduate with my degree due to lack of financial resources. I was XXXX XXXX XXXX when I was sent to Oklahoma. During the enrollment process the college advised my parents and myself that we were going to need more financial resources than what Federal Student Loans qualified me. Little did I understand how Federal Student Loan funding initially worked. XX/XX/XXXX a disbursement of {$5000.00} with a XXXX variable interest rate was made to XXXX XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX another disbursement of {$5000.00} with a XXXX variable interest rate was made to XXXX XXXX. Although I am grateful my parents made the decision to take out private student loans on my behalf, this decision was not the best financial decision for myself. Having little knowledge and understanding how a variable interest rate student loan would immensely effect my financial future. XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX. of {$5300.00} was applied to the total loan equaling to {$15000.00}. XX/XX/XXXX payments began ( I had transferred to a online college to get my actual degree. I was financially unable to fund the last few classes at XXXX XXXX to obtain my XXXX XXXX in XXXX ). Again, I did not fully understand the future financial hardship this was going to cause me. The student loan was originally owned by XXXX XXXX. From XXXX until XXXX when the student loan was converted to Firstmark Services, I had already paid {$2900.00} towards the principle balance and {$6500.00} towards interest. From XX/XX/XXXX ( the time XXXX XXXX converted the student loan to Firstmark Services ) to current day, the total amount that has been paid to the principle balance is {$5800.00} and the total amount paid in interest is {$11000.00} with a 13.490 % VARIABLE. This combines a total loan payback with interest of {$17000.00}. As of XXXX XXXX a pay off quote of {$9800.00}. A loan statement as of XX/XX/XXXX shows a estimated XXXX XXXX XXXX of {$16000.00}. A late payment fee was issued on XXXX XXXX. Prior to the date payments were made on time as well as to present day, today. Again, being XXXX XXXX XXXX at the original disbursement of the college loans, I was very uneducated at the future financial downfall impact this was going to have. I have made request for lower monthly payments, I have request the remainder of loan forgiveness or even a settlement within a certain time frame of payout. I have reached out to my parents in hopes to receive advice or relief with the student loan debt I obtained at the early age of XXXX XXXX XXXX. No resolution has been found. As of today, I have filed bankruptcy, endured financial hardships, often times unable to pay my bills due to the overload of student loan debt that has a estimated combined total of {$80000.00}. The cost of living and the student loan debt has placed a hardship of living at minimal. The mental and emotional stress the student loan debt has impacted my life. With the debt to income ration with vast majority of student loans, I have been unsuccessful in obtaining a refinance loan with a lower FIXED interest rate. I have been made aware I am 'too high risk ' because of my high debt to income ratio. ' Since this financial hardship due to the student loan crisis, I have been unable and unsuccessful to start a college fund for my own child. The import thing I have learned during this process is educating myself of the lack of knowledge I had as well my parents had during my college process. I have educated myself immensely to help provide better guidance for my child when the time comes to her college education.

I have to wait till this is all resolved but i will get a new debit card. I fear my mony will be lost and uS bank works with my money as long as possible.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This is an accurate written account of issues I have had with large corporations. Discover Bank, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX 

I have always had amazing credit. I got a Discover credit card in XXXX after separating from my ex husband. Only my name, my account. I hardly ever used my card and when I did I paid on time every month more than the required amount owed. I had always had trouble logging into my account and when I did everything looked fine, but I did notice my balance going up after a few months and I couldnt understand why. But I didnt see anything unusual at the time. It was in XX/XX/XXXX that I lost my job. I went on XXXX  and got an XXXX XXXX to help take care of my XXXX kids. I reached out and explained my situation to Discover and for a while they were happy to defer my payments. I paid a little here and there when I had a little extra money. 

I hardly ever received any paper mail from Discover with my transactions and balance paid amounts, which I changed many times on my account when I logged in. But again, I hardly ever used the card, it was more for emergencies. When I would get an email or paper mail from them it was, your payment of $ x is due on xx/xx ). So, I paid through my bank and their link. 

It was when I wasnt able to pay on a regular basis that my amount due kept going up and up. Again, I worked with them for a long time making sure I wouldnt mess my credit score up for being late. I have held over a XXXX ( mid XXXX ) for years and years and it took me over XXXX years to get it to that, then in less than a few months it went well below a XXXX for being late just a few times. 

Then in XXXX I started receiving mail from lawyers wanting to represent me in my case against Discover. I had no idea what they were talking about. I had not received ANYTHING from Discover in over a year and I had no idea they were now trying to sue me, through the help of XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, XXXX. I looked up my court number ( given by a mail lawyer ) in XXXX XXXX, XXXX Said Discover had written off my account but this law firm was coming after the total amount of over {$13000.00}, again I didnt even know what purchases were made in that amount, barring the few transactions I knew I had made and that was XXXX years earlier. Also, once I was unable to pay my account I was locked out completely from my online account. So I couldnt see that my charges were going up and up. I filed paperwork with the court requesting to see what all the charges were within my Discover account. I did receive these documents from the lawyer, however, they only sent dates XX/XX/XXXX and up. I had the card several months before that so I dont even know what was charged before that. Also, when I received the credit card statements there were missing dates and many line items were blackened out for me not to see the information. If you get the billing statements, look at the date and time for many of the purchases. I'd have to be in XXXX different states on the same exact days. Many times over. Hotels, restaurants, etc. 

Anyway, looking through the charges that I used I started noticing page after page of fraudulent charges from restaurants I never ate at nor heard of, plane travel to destinations I hadnt been to, theme parks, gas stations in cities I never drove through nor lived around, hotels, XXXX, travel insurance, the list goes on. I immediately called XXXX and told them what had happened. I also had XXXX other credit cards, of smaller spending limits that were both maxed out and they sent me to collections. XXXX XXXX and XXXX. I too got a hold of those statements and found they both had fraudulent charges. I disputed them with XXXX. Discover said, we investigated the charges and they were all correct and that I disagreed. They never even called me to ask me questions. I disputed all three credit cards with known fraudulent charges, which I would have been happy to furnish, but they all basically called me a liar. 

I also found out that my ex husband had opened up a XXXX XXXX in my name and with my information. When I called XXXX I spoke with a gentleman and after telling him my name, birth date, and social security, he told me he did see an account with this information but I wasnt allowed to access it and it was in my ex husbands name, but he had opened the account while we were still married, XXXX of XXXX is when he opened it. But the line went quiet and he asked me to hold a moment. A woman then got on the phone and told me the guy had made a mistake and my social security number was not associated with this account, but my name and other information was and that I wasnt allowed to have access to it and to forget about the account and delete the information I had to log in to the account. Then she hung up. 

My ex also was receiving the government checks, we legally separated in XXXX of XXXX, he kept receiving these checks but never told me about any of them. I have mailed in a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX of XXXX and I have still heard nothing from the IRS about where it was deposited to. I also ended up having to pay taxes on that money, that I didn't receive, instead of a single mom with XXXX kids getting the correct refund. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX has not been holding up their end of the bargain by making sure our information stays safe. I get spam calls and emails all the time. My bank account information has been stolen I don't know how many times and yet they still charge a fortune and won't be help responsible for financial pain and emotional suffering I have had to deal with regarding my credit card statements, bank accounts opening in my name, my social and name address etc being put on the dark web. My phone had been hacked, my emails had been hacked, I started not having any mail coming to me, including information from the IRS that I have been expecting and still havent received. Even in my new residence I was expecting a letter. Checked on the status and called and they said it was delivered to my address, but I never saw it. 

I have been taking all the necessary precautions to protect my identity, but keep getting beat down. These few accounts have completely ruined my credit and my ability to buy, rent, or get a mortgage. Large deposits have been required as a down payments, when Ive rented, security deposit, utility deposit, etc. which I have never had to do before. I am so frustrated. Once I sent the court document, I havent heard anything from anyone, including Discovers law firm. I finally contacted the law firm and Discover trying to get to the bottom of what needs to be done. The law firm said I needed to speak with Discover and Discover told me they didn't have anything to do with it any more. So I am not being helped with either party. Again, this has HUGELY impacted my life negatively. 

XXXX, XXXX, nor XXXX have helped either. They have just listened to what the companies have said and not me and what is on report doesn't help and have lowered my score. Also, XXXX and XXXX companies DO NOT have the right information on my credit file and they make it incredibly difficult to update anything and they cost a lot in order to view MY own credit score that I need to see if I have more identity theft problems. I can't even change my address and name on the accounts without calling them OR mailing MY personal information I.e a copy of my social security card, drivers license, passport, ummm all the items I'm trying to not have people steal easier then they already have. I have had phone numbers, addresses, accounts added to my credit report that were not nor ever have been mine. But they won't update my information until I mail them these items. They should just look at my social security number they have on file and review name changes and addresses, etc. 

I can send anyone the full statement reports if needed from Discover and their law firm. 
Please help, XXXX XXXX
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> XXXX Equities ( Dobberstein Law Firm ) filed a small claim lawsuit in XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Wi. The date of the hearing was XX/XX/year>. They mailed communications to me to an address in XXXX  I DO NOT reside at, causing me to receive documentation late. On XX/XX/year>, they mailed a letter to me regarding the debt, amount owed, and that I have until XX/XX/XXXX to dispute the debt. This was sent to my new address in XXXX XXXX I was not given 30 days to dispute. They went ahead with the lawsuit and because I was not able to appear ( I do not live in Wisconsin ), they filed the judgment against me. I thought I had until XX/XX/XXXX, per the letter. They are now attempting to garnish my wages. I spoke with an attorney in Wisconsin who advised they can not do this because they have to file something with my new state, which this debt collector/law office clearly knows my new address since they sent me the debt letter AFTER they filed the lawsuit. I wasn't even aware they had my debt. From my understanding, they are supposed to allow you 30 days to dispute prior to filing any lawsuit. I have been attempting to reach this office. I called the courthouse who provided me contact information. I also used the contact information on the form they mailed me. I have attempted calls and emails. They do not answer the phone. They do not respond to emails. I started putting delivery and read receipts on my emails. I also received a letter from the court house dated XX/XX/year>. I didn't receive this until XX/XX/XXXX. They sent it to my old address in Wisconsin. I have copies of the envelope that shows it was mailed, and then the yellow sticker from the post advising it was rerouted on XX/XX/XXXX. I am not getting my mail because they obviously didn't inform the judge of my new address they clearly had. I am not sure where to go from here. I wanted to be treated fairly. I wanted to have my 30 days to work out a payment arrangement with them, as I could have had this paid off by the end of XXXX, but they will not answer or respond.

Midland Credit Management purchased a debt from XXXX XXXX. They allege that this debt belongs to me. 
I never had an account with XXXX XXXX. 
Any accounts with XXXX XXXX  were the result of fraud.

They claimed that this was under investigation. I asked them who was investigating this, so I could speak with them. 
Midland stated that they could not tell me or give me the fraud investigator 's contact information as the investigation was not complete, and that could take up to 90 days. They did give me the number of their legal department but said it would not be helpful with the fraud investigation.

Sub-issue: Problem with rewards from credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I made a {$530.00} purchase via the Chase Travel portal on my Chase Freedom Unlimited credit card. I specifically made this purchase to receive a promotional credit, as advertised by Chase Bank on the app, for {$100.00} back with a Chase Travel purchase of at least {$500.00} on my Chase Freedom Unlimited card by XX/XX/year>. I never received this credit from Chase Bank ; therefore, on XX/XX/year>, I called and spoke with a Chase representative who created an escalation case and told me that I needed to send a message on the Chase app including proof of purchase. Accordingly, on XX/XX/year>, I submitted a message to Chase through the app indicating that I was waiting to receive the {$100.00} credit and providing an attachment that showed my email receipt for the travel booking made through the Chase app, including a time stamp showing that the purchase was made on XX/XX/XXXX. Over the next two weeks, I received several conflicting messages ( via app ) from Chase Card Services stating that my request had been forwarded to another department, that I would receive a response in one to two business days, and that Chase Card Services was experiencing a large volume of requests. On XX/XX/year>, I emailed Chase again via app to say that I never received a response to my message. On XX/XX/year>, Chase Card Services sent a response on the app saying that my purchase wasnt eligible because the purchase was made with my Chase Sapphire Reserve card. This response is untrue as the purchase is clearly posted on my bank statement for my Chase Freedom Unlimited Card. 

Around this time, I also received a letter in the mail dated XX/XX/year>, from Chase that states that my credit was refused because the purchase was made on XX/XX/year>. This response clearly ignored my original message with the time stamp proof. 

Since receiving the two conflicting and inaccurate responses, I have tried calling Chase multiple times and have spoken to several Chase representatives who have been unable to help me, despite verbally agreeing that the responses from Chase were erroneous. During those discussions, representatives have said that they would transfer me to a supervisor only to put me on hold for another thirty minutes, send me to an automated line stating a wait time of over 30 minutes, and send me to another representative who simply makes me file another escalation as Ive already done once. I have also sent multiple messages via the Chase app, and nobody has responded to me. 

In conclusion, despite verbal acknowledgment from Chase representatives that I am owed a {$100.00} credit, Chase Card Services has failed to truthfully and adequately respond to my complaint in writing, citing several conflicting and erroneous reasons for failing to credit my account in accordance with an advertised promotion on their application ; and is currently refusing any timely help or rectification to this issue, including the issuance of the {$100.00} credit that I am legally owed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I tried to check my rates for a home equity loan through a mailer I received from Discover Home Loans. On their website I was asked to enter my information for a " pre-approval ''. I entered my information and clicked the consent for them to obtain a copy of my credit report, and then was presented with my rates and loan options. Shortly after, I was alerted that there had been a hard inquiry on my credit report by Discover. 

I have checked my rates and loan options and have gotten numerous " pre-approved '' offers for credit/loans. No other company has needed to make a hard inquiry to show me my loan options and rates, even when they have asked, and I've consented for them to obtain a copy of my credit report. They have all been soft inquiries. 

Discover is the only company that for a pre approval has pulled a hard inquiry ... before any other portion of the application has been submitted. 

Discover failed to make it clear that I was consenting to a hard inquiry. I think at best this is negligence on their part, and at worst is a deceptive business practice to pin people into continuing with an application. 

All I want is for the inquiry to be pulled from my credit report. 

Thank you.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a complaint regarding a Capital One credit card purchase of airline tickets made online with a company called XXXX XXXX XXXX. They in turn booked our flight on XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX is clear than they don't book by phone, and do not refund any flights if the customer cancels the flights. XXXX XXXX XXXX advertise as associated with XXXX  and offer to do phone bookings for them. 

The seats booked in XX/XX/year> were confirmed by XXXX XXXX using correct names : XXXX XXXX XXXX ( also uses name XXXX XXXX XXXX ) my daughter, and XXXX and XXXX XXXX , my grandsons. 

Two days before the flight in XX/XX/year>, XXXX received an email from XXXX XXXX telling her ( at first ) that her flight was cancelled, and then when she questioned why, that her reservations were cancelled. They then attempted to extort her by telling her if she would pay them an additional {$750.00}, they would refund her charge. 

Realizing she had been scammed, she went to the XXXX  site ( could not reach anyone in real time because they don't have phone service ) and saw that her reservations had indeed been made but cancelled by the passenger, that is XXXX XXXX XXXX. In the XXXX  documents sent, we can read the line entries closely and see that part of the scheme must have included using false surnames. Those were the names used on the cancellation notices which we have taken screen shots of to submit as evidence, ( see documents submitted ). It seems XXXX XXXX was able to bypass the verification code that XXXX requested before cancelling the flight. 

Although XXXX claims that their verification code provides security that the right person is cancelling, in our case the security failed as it was XXXX XXXX they were communicating with, and XXXX XXXX was cancelling using our credit card and phone information. XXXX allows bookings to be made by XXXX XXXX. There are 22 complaints against XXXX XXXX of similar scams on XXXX XXXX XXXX site . XXXX must have had similar experiences with XXXX XXXX before. 

Since the surnames did not match passport info, or for some other reason, it was XXXX which actually cancelled our reservationsat the request of XXXX XXXX. Although XXXX is claiming that we, the passenger, cancelled that is not the caseit seems possible that they were scammed, and as such, they should recognize this and refund our money. 

My daughter and two children were stuck at the last minute, bags packed, preparations made for months, but never even went to the airport.

We disputed the charge. Capital One refunded while they " investigated ''. We sent pages of documentation. When XXXX answered with their defense, Capital One closed the case, returned the charge to my card, and said to take it up with XXXX. 

All along we have been attempting to resolve with XXXX but as of this date they have only responded with dismissive emails, treating this as a case of customer cancelling, or other messages that may even be AI generated or at least not handled by any person to person managerial staff.

I have been reluctant to engage directly with the scammers. Capital One also disputed the charge with them. They have not responded so by default their part of the charge ( XXXX plus ) has not been added back to my card. 

I am including a package of documents to validate my statements.

In accordance with 15 USC 1681c-2 ( c ) ( a ), it is imperative that you, ( LexisNexis, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and XXXX XXXX XXXX ) as a THIRD PARTY credit reporting agency and/or bureau, take immediate action to block and remove all information related to this identity theft AND lack of verification from my credit report. 

This statute requires credit reporting agencies to address such requests promptly, within four business days of receiving a complaint containing the following information : Collection Names : ( The Texas Child Support & MS Bankruptcy 's ). I want to underscore the gravity of this issue and my expectation for a swift and effective resolution. 

Should your response be inadequate, ( AS YOU HAVE STATED PER CFPB ( 4X ) such as a refusal to cooperate by blocking and removing the above accounts within 4 days, I will be forced to pursue legal action against your agency, as allowed by law. 

Please be aware that I will seek damages, including statutory costs, with each violation carrying a statutory fee of {$1000.00}, as specified in 15 USC. These violations include : -Defamation of Character - Negligent Enhancement of Identity Fraud - Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act - Non-compliance with 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil liability for negligent non-compliance ) - Non-compliance with 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( b ) ( Civil liability for willful non-compliance ) -Failing to comply with 15 USC 1692 ( g ) - Violations of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible purposes of consumer reports ) - Non-compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) ( Method of verification ) - Violations of 15 USC 1681a ( 4 ) ( Right to privacy ) -Violations of 15 U.S. Code 1681c ( Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports ) I am treating this matter with the utmost seriousness and request that you promptly block and remove the fraudulent accounts from my credit report. I have already provided all necessary information to facilitate this process. Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide a timeline for resolving this issue. 
Your prompt attention to this matter is greatly appreciated. 
You may respond via my email XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX or by mail XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Best wishes, XXXX XXXX

At XXXX XXXX XXXX and sent out of state by the decisions of my parents as well as the lack of knowledge student loan debt would financial effect me in my future, XXXX  has poorly mismanaged my student loans. I have entered rate reduction programs that were not allocated correctly. With the loans having a covariable interest rate. that has significantly increased from the original rate. The items brought to light regarding federal student loans are the same issues revolving around my private student loans ; costly repayment options, deprived student borrowers of opportunities to enroll in more affordable plans, steering struggling borrowers into forbearance where interest continues to accrue and capitalize XXXX illegal actions led numerous borrowers to pay additional interest charges, and much more. I had multiple student loans with variable interest rates and monthly payments. These errors resulted in late fees, interest accrual, and negative credit reporting. XXXX  has tarnished my credit because of their misleading, misguiding, and inevitable way to repay their student loans. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, here is an email that I sent Cross Country Mortgage, Insurance explaining the ordeal. 

Dear Cross Country Mortgage, See Attachment Please be advised that this email is in response to a letter I received on XX/XX/XXXX requesting PROOF OF HOME INSURANCE FOR THE MONTHS OF XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX IMMEDIATELY. 

Cross Country Mortgage/ Insurance , I would like to take this time to express the unprofessional and unjust behavior that I have experienced by your organization. Back around XXXX of XXXX, my wife and I entered a contractual agreement with your organization, by way of a mortgage, and in said agreement, XXXX XXXX XXXX was our chosen Home Insurance provider. Cross Country Mortgage, Insurance, you were responsible for paying my homeowner insurance policy Fast forward to the end of XXXX XXXX of XXXX, Cross Country Mortgage Insurance XXXX you failed to pay my home insurance policy, resulting in XXXX  XXXX XXXX canceling my home insurance. I, the consumer, found out that my home insurance was cancelled in XX/XX/XXXX after XXXX XXXX XXXX sent a check to my address with the cancellation information. I immediately contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX demanding answers to why my policy was cancelled and their response was, " XXXX XXXX your mortgage company Cross Country Mortgage paid your home insurance policy XXXX days late and we were forced to cancel your policy in XX/XX/XXXX ''. I then called " You '', Cross Country Mortgage Insurance, and informed you that my Homeowners Insurance policy had been canceled due to Your late payment. You then informed me that your organization attempted to reach out to XXXX XXXX XXXX for the updated insurance policy information and received said information in XXXX of XXXX and that's when you rendered payment. Cross Country Mortgage Insurance, you never reached out to me/ the homeowner requesting said information, despite your Standard Operating Procedures, instead, after my call to you in XX/XX/XXXX, you then send a letter stating that if I do not have homeowner Insurance XXXX will be place by you which will result in a higher cost! My wife and I worked tirelessly to obtain a replacement homeowner insurance policy, despite numerous companies denying us due to our lapse in our previous policy. Because of your actions, we had to purchase a policy that was double the cost of our original one and to add insult to injury you sent us a second letter stating that you need proof of insurance from XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. 

Cross Country Mortgage Insurance : Federal law requires the servicer to make insurance payments on or before the deadline to avoid a penalty, as long as your mortgage payment is not more than 30 days overdue. This law also states that, " If your mortgage company 's late payments cause a lapse in your insurance coverage, they could be liable for any damages that would have been covered if your policy had remained in place. '' In closing, Cross Country Mortgage Insurance, it is very apparent that You are unwilling to bear any transparency in this situation, even after I communicated this information to numerous representatives/ supervisors and requested reimbursement, You are still unwilling to reimburse me for the difference in premium/ policy payments. Because of this fact, I am forced to report this to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, where I will be filing my official complaint in hopes of being made whole after your unjust practices that have resulted in financial hardship.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem with additional products or services purchased with the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: Financed a vehicle through Ally Financial ( Auto ) in the middle of XXXX and have yet to have access to my online account to view my information, messages, billing statements, make a payment etc. I received the welcome packet from Ally in the mail a few weeks after purchasing the vehicle and have been calling to get this issue resolved ever since. Which has been a little over 2 months now and hours of my life wasted on the phone. I have other accounts with Ally ( checking, savings, credit card ) and thought this would be a seamless process. I was wrong. I have made it to their highest level of customer service and there is no urgency to fix my account. Every time I call I am told the person handling my case will contact me, which still hasn't happened after three weeks now. Meanwhile, interest/late charges accrue and they are telling me nothing can be done about that. The only other options given to pay ( mail/phone ) come with extra fees or lead to higher finance charges. This is unacceptable and I feel like I am being taken advantage of. They literally advertise in the welcome packet to download the app/create an account to have access to above stated information and pay whichever way is most convenient. I have the call logs on my phone of when I started to call, how often, and how long I spent on the phone. I have screen shots of the error messages I get when trying to access my account, both on the mobile app and web browser. This is just a brief explanation, but has been a nightmare experience during an already difficult time in my life.

I looked at my report and noticed some things are incomplete and inaccurate I sent a letter to all XXXX credit bureaus ( XXXX Equifax and XXXX ) I asked them to investigate the completeness and accuracy. I received the results and noticed that they did not fix nothing. There are breaking FEDERAL LAW!

According to 15usc 1681e ( b ) it states this ( b ) accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedure to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

So I then asked them to provide me a description of the investigation according to 15 usc 1681i ( 7 ) : ( 7 ) description of reinvestigation procedure. A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a description referred to in a paragraph ( 6 ) ( b ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description.

But they did not do that as well either.

They also are breaking these laws as well below 15 usc 1681i ( 5 ) it states this ( 5 ) treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) in general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified the consumer reporting agency shall..

( I ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer or modify that item of information as appropriate based on the results of the reinvestigation and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer According to 15 usc 1681s-2 it states this ( A ) reporting information with actual knowledge of errors This is unfair and if they doing it to me imagine who else they are doing this too. Can please fix ( Method of verification/the process and procedure used to verify information/name and contact information of person contacted/any contracts bearing my wet signature ) IT TOOK LONGER THAN 30 days on my investigation therefore these items by law have to be deleted

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a Carnival Rewards mastercard with BarClays. I was looking through my statements and noticed several fraudulent transactions and reported them. I was issued a provisional credit while they investigated my claim, but soon reversed the credit because they said the transactions were valid and I benefited from them These transactions include XX/XX/year> XXXX in XXXX XXXX California for {$250.00}. 
The information provided said that the chip technology was used and can not be duplicated. I never lost that card and never gave anyone permission to use that card. I explained that I live in XXXX Michigan, and have never been to California nor did I use that card and purchase anything at XXXX XXXX. Barclays insists that I did this transaction and by insisting that I did this transaction has concluded the other transactions made in California were made by me too. These include XXXX {$5.00} transactions to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and one on XX/XX/XXXX. Same day the XXXX XXXX purchase was made. There was also a charge on XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX XXXX for {$32.00}. I called again and explained it's impossible for me to have used the chip technology at those places because I have never been to California and literally live XXXX XXXX miles away. Barclays refuses to make this right and has said I most definitely benefited from these purchases. I was a victim of fraud and Barclays has done nothing to help me in this situation. I requested a new card and shut off the old one when I noticed these transactions, however I refuse to activate the new card in fear that something will happen and Barclays will refuse to protect me under regulation Z. I have asked for the information as to what was purchase with my credit card, but Barclays has refused to provide that info, nor credit the fraudulent charges off my card.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, LA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX LexisNexis XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : Request for Opt-Out, Rescission of Permission, and Dispute of Information To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally request that LexisNexis immediately opt me out of any and all personal identifying information ( PII ) associated with my name that you may have on file. Additionally, I dispute the accuracy and legality of any public records or personal data currently listed in your system under my name.

I do not recall providing written permission or explicit consent for LexisNexis to collect, maintain, or share my personal information. Any prior permission you may claim to have received is hereby rescinded, effective immediately. As per 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ), 15 U.S.C. 6802, 6805, the Privacy Act of 1974, and the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ) of 1974, I demand the removal of any public records, school records, or personal information that you have unlawfully obtained.

Specifically, under FERPA, my educational institution has confirmed that it does not share my personal information with any third-party credit reporting or data aggregation agencies. Furthermore, I understand that courts do not directly provide public records to private entities such as LexisNexis. I dispute the inclusion of any such records in your system and request that you provide : 1. Documentation detailing the methods and sources used to verify the accuracy of the information in my file.

2. The identity of the entity or individual who authorized LexisNexis to include this information in my file.

The failure to provide me with this information would constitute non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Furthermore, you are obligated to investigate and correct inaccuracies within 30 days of receiving this dispute.

I request written confirmation of the removal of all my personal information, including any public records, within the legally mandated timeframe. Failure to comply will result in me exploring further legal remedies to protect my rights under federal law.

Please consider this a formal opt-out request and a dispute of the data associated with my file. All correspondence regarding this matter should be sent to my mailing address listed above. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of the reporting associated with a charge-off account under my name, referenced as Account Number [ Account Number ]. This letter serves as a formal request for investigation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2. 
Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, you, as the furnisher of information to credit reporting agencies, are legally obligated to report accurate information and to investigate disputes regarding the completeness or accuracy of reported information. Additionally, any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable must be corrected or deleted promptly as required by the FCRA. 
I respectfully request the following : 1. Immediate removal of any unverifiable or inaccurate information from my credit file in compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2. 
2. A written response detailing the outcome of your investigation within the 30-day period required under the FCRA. 
In light of the legal precedent set in XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, I wish to emphasize the seriousness of this matter. However, I also recognize the importance of resolving disputes amicably and without unnecessary escalation. 
To this end, I am willing to explore a pre-arbitration settlement to resolve this matter promptly and avoid further dispute or potential legal proceedings. Please provide a point of contact to discuss settlement terms, which could include corrections to my credit report, financial adjustments, or any other mutually agreeable resolution. 
If you fail to comply with your obligations under the FCRA or refuse to engage in meaningful pre-arbitration discussions, I will escalate the matter by filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my states Attorney General. Furthermore, I will initiate arbitration or pursue other legal remedies as necessary to protect my rights under federal law. 
I trust that you will take this opportunity to resolve the matter efficiently and without the need for further legal intervention. Thank you for your immediate attention, and I look forward to your timely response. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice
